Comment: I came here this passed Sunday for brunch. We had a reservation for 11:30 and they started letting people in at 11:28 approximately. They also sat us at 11:40 I think or so. I was concerned if we would have enough time because brunch ends at 2:00 p.m. I was wrong we had more than enough time and I loved this brunch. When we were seated everything was fresh and ready. They started with the rotating meats. Our waiter was very friendly and informative. They have all day happy hour and I had two drinks. The buffet has everything you could imagine, rice and beans along with soup. I had the rice and beans. Then I had different salads and fruits. The fruits were delicious and fresh. The buffet area was immaculately clean. I also had vanilla parfait which was good. The meats were very good and it was hot. I am concerned with the temperature of the foods in buffets. I am happy to say all the food was at the correct temperature. The salads and fruits were cold and fresh. The meat and hot items were hot and fresh as well. There was a good amount of variety in the meat selection. They would ask what type of temperature do you and for the meat. I liked that because everyone has a preference. I also loved the sides which they gave us the polenta fries were my favorite and the mashed potatoes were also delicious. They have delicious hot sauce and a green sauce.There were a couple of items which I did not enjoy the lamb, the pork Parmesan and chicken wrapped in bacon. The chicken wrapped in bacon, the chicken was dry. The Parmesan pork, was a bit dry and the coating of the Parmesan on the pork did not work for me. The lamb was not flavorful. The place is quite beautiful and perfect place for a gathering or dinner. The place has a lot of lighting which I like. My favorite part is no one rushed us which was great. Someone came to check on us and asked us if we were enjoying the restaurant. Everyone works as a team, and it shows because various people would help us when we asked for something. I am looking forward to going back.

I came here last night and I must say I was unsure of what to expect due to all the negative reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised. Now we went to the launch party which means we did not eat the buffet. So my review is about the appetizers, drinks and bar area upstairs. So the food, was good and most of it was fresh and well seasoned. When we came in we were given champagne which was very good and they had two tables filled with shrimp cocktail, cheese bread, charcuterie board and artichoke and spinach dip. This was a very nice spread which was very fresh. Then they also had waiters with appetizers and this was also delicious. They had lamb chops which were really well seasoned and cooked perfectly. The lamb chops were juicy. Also the beef empanadas were also very good. They had shrimp and lobster lettuce wraps. This was very good as well but they said tacos. To me a taco is not a lettuce wrap. That's just my opinion but it was also very fresh and had the right balance. What I did not like the way they make chicken. They had chicken sliders they were dry and even when I added the sauce it was dry. They had pierces of chicken, the same thing it looked dry. Then they wings and those were perfect. The wings had a bbq sauce and they were coated in the sauce and it was absolutely delicious. So my recommendation is use that recipe for the chicken in the sliders. Now the grilled cheese was delicious and we ate so much of it.The service was amazing the staff asked if you needed anything and were very friendly. The bartender Sarah  was awesome very friendly and her drinks were perfect. Also Andrea was so nice as well making sure we had everything we needed. Overall I would definitely recommend this place and come back for the hh. They have drink specials and food hh.

- super large venue- they have it down to a science where everything is refilled on time, the meats are coming sporadically (not as consistent as we wanted), and the staff are well rehearsed- took 20 minutes to sit down; they told us to "go to the bar," but then after 20 minutes we checked with them and they said they called us out loud but since we were at the bar, we didn't hear them- filet mignon was my favorite, but took until the very end to come by- the cheese bread is insanely good- chicken drumsticks; wish they had wings- the sausage was excellent- martini and alcoholic drinks were well made and mixedOverall, professional staff, good quality food, and clean. It was very busy, and the meat flow was slower, but would come again.

We made a reservation for thanksgiving at 5:45 and walked in right before, the place was packed and they made us wait for over an hour, we did not get seated until 7pm The meat service was so slow and we didn't get to try the things we really wanted to. The service was slow, too. It took them an additional thirty minutes to bring our check I received an email for a complimentary dessert and when I ordered it, I still got charged for it. So what was the point? Not worth the 100+ per person Overall 3/10

You should always be seated at your reservation time, Ali, and we're sorry to keep you waiting. Our team would like to work towards a chance to give you a better experience in the future. If you are willing, please contact us at feedback@fogo.com with the best way to reach you. Kind regards.

This was my first time visiting the Manhattan Fogo De Chao location. This location is beautiful and huge. There are multiple floors. I was seated on the lower level. The staff were very attentive and they provided excellent customer service. For my meal, I had the Churrasco Experience which consisted of different signature cuts of fire roasted meats. I had the pork sausage, pork belly, chicken wrapped with bacon, chicken leg, filet mignon and sirloin steak. Everything was well prepared and delicious. I went to the Market Table and Feijoada Bar and I took advantage of the different varieties of salads. I had the white rice with beans, potato salad, chicken salad, corn salad, Caesar salad and tomatoes. I enjoyed my meal and drinks. I ordered two drinks the Cucumber Mint Smash and Passionate Caipirinha. The drinks were very tasty. I was stuffed and very satisfied. I'll definitely come back to this location in the future. Great experience!

Snow day in NYC was a good excuse to skip breakfast and go right to lunch. And when I say lunch this probably will be your only meal for the day. Here's the set up. You wait to be seated at a cavernous space downstairs across MOMA, at an emporium of meat. Yes there is a full salad buffet and some additional classic hot dishes like feijoada, but you're here for the meat. Lunch is $50 AYCE. Drinks and dessert is not included. For that $, you get unlimited selections of churrasco meats, which are constantly brought out in a steady procession. You need to pace yourself through various parts of chicken, drumsticks  and breast wrapped in bacon. If you're waiting for the beef, you will also be tempted by pork chops and also lamb. Assuming you waited patiently, the beef lover in you will rejoice in multiple different cuts from classic filet mignon to picanha all served to your liking from rare to well done. Naturally all the meat also comes with side dishes of mashed garlic potatoes, fried polenta, fried banana and of course cheese bread or pao de queijo. No pressure to finish what you don't like and they will gladly swap your plate. I felt that the servers struggled a bit to keep the cuts thin enough as well as not too overcooked. The lighting is dim so that doesn't help when you want to get medium rare and waiter thinks it's well done.  All in with tax, soda , gratuity we paid around $140 for 2. To save some $$ , buy gift cards from Costco $100 for $80 to help offset the total. Would you come back frequently? Probably not but occasional meat sweats from this well established chain is worth the experience.

So good!!Came here for the best of Brazil deal ($44) and it was amazing.Loved all the cuts of meat, especially the picanha and bottom sirloin. Didn't see any pork or lamb, but I prefer beef anyway so nbd. Might have to request for specific cuts since it sometimes takes a while for meats to get to you. Excellent service and great way to celebrate my birthday early!

Huge steak house. The ambience is beautiful. The food was good, but it seemed that the meat quality wasn't great . We got the Churrasco  Experience . Some of the choices were good, some not at all. The Churrasco experience comes with buffet MARKET TABLE & FEIJOADA BAR, which had good selection of appetisers. We didn't like The detests  at all. The lava cake was super dry and ice cream felt like a regular supermarket ice cream. The service was ok as well. You are supposed to flip the sticker on the table to green side when you are ready for another piece of meat. I wish they were more attentive, as sometimes we had to call them, as they'd just pass by without getting to our table , although our stickers were with green side up .So overall we had good time, but should we return- no .

As you know I love Fogo but this is my first time visiting the one in Manhattan. This place is beautiful! This location has all day happy hour at the bar. Score! Lol the decor blows u away as soon as your walking downstairs to your table. The salad bar never disappoints and the meats were cooked to perfection. My goal is to visit as many Fogos in as many locations as I can. If you have never experienced Fogo please do yourself a favor!!

Came here with some friends after work for the all you can eat and it was a good experience. You can do the all you can eat option that gives you a select set of meats for a certain price or you can opt to get the more expensive cuts instead. There is a difference in quality of the cuts when it comes to the price as well. The servers come around with different meat options to choose from ranging from beef, lamb, pork and chicken. The lamb and beef were tender and cooked to perfection. They have an upstairs and downstairs section hood for large groups. My only issue was that later on in the dinner service, it felt like the servers forgot about us. I guess they thought we were full. Overall a great bang for your buck!

Been here last week after hearing many good things about this place. It was actually nice looking and very clean, the open salad bar was great and with a variety of offers, starters and dishes. The meats started arriving and most of them were pretty good. I didn't personally enjoy the Parmesan pork and one or two more, but the others were good (I know I'm being generic, but we ate so much it's hard to remember exactly what we got!). For meat lovers this is a great option. We asked for Coca-Cola, the first one was good. The second one, they tell us they only have Coca-Cola Zero. We ask for two, then an other server asks us if we want to drink something, we say that we already asked for two cocacolas, they bring the zeros after 15 minutes, and two minutes later the second server bring us the regular "draft" ones (so they actually had it!!) They change them and they were absolutely without gas  so sad. Well, at least they didn't charge us extra, but they were bad. Oh, and they poured tap water in our glasses that were full of bottled water, absolutely ruining the 8.25$ that a bottle of Acqua Panna costed us. Except this long waiting time, their miscommunication between waiters and the water issue, the food was good. I would come back :)

My first experience here was really great! Lots of meat varieties and you can ask them for a specific one and they'll call their staff over to serve you. We got happy hour drinks and the passion fruit cocktail was the favorite.Meats ranked in order of our favs:PicanhaBottom sirloinChicken drumstickTenderloin (only saw it come around once and it was ok)Top sirloinSides: cheesey bread and the honey cheese were really goodService was great and they checked on us very often. Definitely recommend coming for a nice treat for a birthday or anniversary!

Great food and top notch quality service. I stopped by after several attempts to eat at other locations and I was glad I made the right choice. The ambiance was amazing and the restaurant had dim lighting. I have to give a shout out to Christian, who had just started his first day of employment and he was brilliant and took great care to make me. The Churrasco experience is the way to go. (76pp) was more than worth the price.

Malique, we're thrilled to know that your visit provided you with great food and top-notch service, making your dining choice a memorable one! It's fantastic to hear that Christian impressed you on his very first day. We value your appreciation and believe that the Churrasco experience indeed offers something special. Looking forward to welcoming you again soon!

If you have ever been to this Brazilian steakhouse, I would say it is even more worth it with their special $45 per person meal. Hands-down, one of the best experiences I've ever had, besides from the awestruck interior, the service and food quality were on par! Veggies and appetizers were very fresh. But don't make the mistake I made by getting full on these apps. The cuts of meat came to our table as long as we had our tags faced up to green (red means no more!). Meats were portioned out well with a lot of varieties. My friend does not eat pork but still trie a lot of different cuts. Best of all was their cheesy bread (not shown), which also comes as part of your all you can eat meal. On top of that, Service was top notch. I did not request a celebration for my birthday month, but they were kind enough to send a crème brûlée to our table which was, no surprise, fantastically smooth, not overly sweet, yet refreshing. Definitely would recommend! And try to make it for their special pricing if the deal hasn't ended!

Went there for our anniversary. Extremely nice ambience. Waitress was very friendly, and we got seated immediately, She told us how the process worked and soon the waiters started coming up to us with different cuts of meat.The meat was very nice, although a bit unseasoned. We really enjoyed Garlic Chicken and the Pork Sausage. They try to give you these complimentary puff balls as appetizers but I do not recommend you eat any of it since it fills you up and you end up not eating as much meat.I ordered a Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream as a dessert and it was fantastic.TLDR: Very nice place, good selection of meats (needs more salt), friendly & professional staff, very nice dessert.

This Brazilian steakhouse can be gluttonous fun, more if it's on a corporate dime, but no matter how much they charge (and it's a lot) it doesn't feel high end. Came here for a large birthday party. We were about 30 people and took up two tables. A party that size is forced to have a pre fix price per person, which is understandable, but we couldn't help noticing that smaller dining parties got a larger variety of meats that were brought more often. Additionally, the non meat eaters at our table, who had to pre order salmon, had to pay the same for the fish as those paying for unlimited steak. So while the whole place can be fun it sucks a little to feel like you're overpaying.

This birthday celebration should have been wonderful, and we apologize for falling below your expectations, Lana. Your feedback is important to us, so if you would like to discuss your visit directly, please feel free to send an email to feedback@fogo.com with the best way to reach you. Kind regards.

bring your appetite because Fogo de Chao has the meats--plus so much more other food! Churrascaria (Brazilian bbq) is a feast of endless types of bbqed meats (about 13 different kinds from ribeye to bacon-wrapper chicken to ribs) that are sliced and served at your table by roving waiters and the experience is rounded out by a fantasy island of a salad bar (serve yourself). really enjoyed the Picanha (top sirloin), ribeye, and ribs--all the meats tasted high quality and were really well seasoned. and the salad bar is large and full of variety from fresh veggies to rice & beans to cheeses and so much more and is constantly refreshed. don't forget to order a caipirinha or two...anyway my main takeaways is the food options are high quality. the restaurant itself is gigantic--multiple floor of dining. the space has a classy feel without feeling snooty. the service is excellent and the staff works hard to make sure your meal goes well. ended up having a table on the top floor which was the smallest dining space so it was a little more intimate while still maintaining the energetic vibe of churrascaria. Fogo is definitely where you should bring your appetite and expect to have a fun night. great option when you have family and friends in town or looking for a different kind of dinner experience in NYC.

Christmas Eve dinner was so unenjoyable we'd never consider going back, even with the gift-card I have in my wallet.Arriving at 3:35 for a 3:45 reservation will get you seated by about 4:30 apparently and being that it's such a big place, they cannot heat the rooms anywhere above "super cold degrees"So while you stand for a half hour waiting for your table, reservation or not, you also get to be so cold you'll need to huddle together... yet they still ask people if they wanted to check their coats... imagine!?  I can't at all imagine not having my coat for that wait let alone once being sat at the table and still needing to bundle up.It was so cold that the food skewers wouldn't even be warm when cut and served table side.   I just wanted my mother to come have a decent time visiting me in the city on christmas; I really wouldn't have expected it to go that far south.  The salad bar is tiny but you'll be full in three seconds, no matter what you start grabbing- pro tip, save room for the meat, you're paying a lot for it.The lamb was phenomenal and hands down the best meat served while there.A few others were great and most everything was good but I'd expect to roll out the door at a place like this which wasn't the case, I ate a moderately small amount as I was just so uncomfortable and mad.The manager comped meals and made it right; they apologized and I understand it was a brutally cold night but I think they have a responsibility to keep everyone warm or say something beforehand.    Because they made it right, I'll keep the star rating three, but even if it was warm I think I'd prefer other similar places.

I'm still trying to recover guys and gals...I went with a friend on their lunch special ..which included the salad buffet ..this place is gorgeous .seated below the ground level..waitresses and waiters with suits and ties..staff was EXTREMELY attentive. However you don't necessarily have to dress up..everything and everyone is welcome ..NOW THE FOOD ! Baby if you know how Brazilian steakhouses are "governed" prepare yourself ..meat ;after meat ;after meat ..TENDER ..delicious ..pork , bacon wrapped chicken; lamb; sliced sirloin ..and  it's a heavy rotation ..the DRINKS WERE "blessed and highly favored " just the right amount ..the salad bar had an assortment of different salads and greens ..the killer was the PRICE ..for two of us ------ under one hundred fifty price tag ..the only peeve was...they asked many times if we wanted dessert too many times ...but listen that's a part of the job ...it's awesome .....

So disappointing. Had  dinner  last night with friends at Fogo.  The food and service were subpar to say the least. The meat was not coming frequently as usual and the servings in the table; cheese bread, polenta and plantains were even more scarce - - - I had to keep asking them for water, drinks and extra servings. Last time we have an abundance of food coming to the table.  They didn't have half of the dessert options and took out the pudim (Brazilian fan)  from the menu as well.  I don't understand how this restaurant changed so drastically in 6 month from my last visit.Now they also have a cheaper version of the rodízio to attract more people which is fine but don't compromise the quality of the food and service for everyone. They are cutting corners to make more money. What didn't change was the price of my bill of course! Paid 460 dollars for 4 people. Time to look for another churrascaria in Manhattan - - - not coming back here.

We can assure you our high standards have not changed, and it's concerning to hear you feel this way. If we can do anything to restore your trust in us, please let us know. Kindly send us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Warm Regards.

FANTASTIC! As a born and raised Brazilian from Porto Alegre City - - - the so called churrasco capital of my county, I was very impressed! We had the "churrasco" ( BBQ) and the quality of the meat was second to none. It was like we were eating in Brazil.  The side dishes tasted just like our home made food with all the authentic flavors. They also have a vast salad bar with top quality cheeses, cold cuts etc.  The venue itself is trendy and very spacious with a cool decor reminding the origins of this type of restaurant from the most southern State of Brazil. The service was very efficient and friendly - - - shout out to our waiter Paulo! Again, we loved this restaurant and will be coming back for sure but just be aware that it is not a cheap place. Having one drink and dessert you will dish about $150 per person.

I went on a Tuesday night to celebrate my boyfriends cousins birthday! I had a really good time. The food and service was also really good! The place itself is gorgeous. When you get to your table they start you off with cheesy bread and drinks, I ordered a skinny Margarita. It was refreshing and had the perfect amount of lime. My boyfriend had the passion fruit caipirinha I found that to be too sweet for me. After that you get up and serve yourself from the market buffet. The caprese and Cesar salads were my favorite. They also had fruits, veggies, salami, dressings & so much more! After that the servers come around with the meats. It's so many kinds I couldn't even keep track of them. My favorites were the sirloin, filtet mignon, & churrasco. I asked for my meats to be medium well. I wasn't a fan of the lamb but others at my table seemed to enjoy it. They also give you sides of mash which is to die for, plantain & something like yuca fries. To end our meal we had dessert they brought us cheese cake, chocolate mousse cake, & key lime. The cheese cake was the star, the chocolate mousse was also good but the key lime pie was not the best it was like biting into a lime. Overall I would recommend this restaurant for a special occasion as it is on the pricer side. The food is good and the service is truly excellent. The staff is really attentive and makes sure you're taken care of! Thank you Fogo de Chao!

As an appetizer, we ordered caviarServed with small potatoes, freshly baked, super soft, and caviar are good friendsFor main meal we ordered bison and duck breastBoth were super delicious. I have never raised bison.I was a little scared at first, but after taking a bite, I almost broke my glasses.So gentle! You can see the cross section in Figure 2Perfect medium rare gravy locked insideAlmost everyone in the restaurant has this dish and the whole family must order it!The duck breast was also very tasty. The caramel and duck meat on the outer layer makes me feel that this duck's life has not been in vainThere were a lot of things on the menu that I wanted to order, but there were only two of us and we couldn't eat because we were already full, hahahahaLater we asked the waiter and found out that they had just opened less than a year ago. They are really delicious. Each dish is simple but full of harmony. Even simple French fries are delicious. You can try it when you have time. I really recommend it

2nd time here. Service is good, food is good, drinks are great but some things cannot over look. Way too many people here. Can barely walk around. I'm sure it's over capacity on weekends. One salad bar for the entire place is ridiculous. Barely able to load plates at the salad bar as it is packed with 50 people at once. Need a second salad bar. Also Hundreds of people inside by front area waiting for a seat makes going to the bathroom while dining an ordeal. Not worth spending that much money and being uncomfortable the whole time. Either limit the amount of people in the place or make place bigger.  We had a group of 20 and it wasn't a great experience. Other locations are not as bad. NYC one is not worth returning too.

Your experience at our restaurant should always be worth it, Jerry. If there is anything we can do to ensure your return, please let us know in an email to feedback@fogo.com. With this, be sure to include your contact information and availability. Thank you.

Great service. Location excellent. Clean and spacious. Staff pleasant. Salad bar was good. But lox was small and very soft. Cheese was lacking as compared to other locations. Everything else was good. Meats were very good except for the chicken which was lacking flavor. Sea bass was a very small portion. All drinks we had were excellent. Kids loved the milky lemonade drink. Prices fair Had great time and will return.

My boyfriend and I came here last minute for our anniversary.  The other restaurants were booked for a Saturday, and I had told him I came to another Fogo de Chao from a Yelp event and it blew me away.I didn't know how much it was, I expected it to be expensive but not as expensive as this.  He didn't mind paying and wanted to go.As soon as we get in you're taken aback by the atmosphere, and as you look down the staircase you're in aw.  The hostesses were great, seated us quickly (it was an earlier dinner, though).  Although by the time we left - the lobby was full - they should really get more seating.  Unless they do and it was just because the christmas tree was there.Anyway, our waitress was named Genesis.  She was one of the best waitresses I've ever had.  She made our experience fantastic.  She offered us a light because it was so dark, super nice of her, when noticing nobody else got a light around. She asked if we were here for a special occasion and we had told her.So as the night goes on, we had a great dinner.  Dinner is EXPENSIVE.  $75 for unlimited meats, but the trick is they fill you up on umlimited mashed potatoes (which were amazing btw), yuka fries and plantains, along with the buffett "salad" (but more) bar.  He said their meats were fantastic.  I ordered the salmon cause I can't fathom spending $75 on a plate of food.  So we got pretty stuffed quickly, and as he asked for the check, Genesis gave us a cheesecake plate that wrote Happy Anniversary.  She made this dinner incredible and such a sweet lady. We were so grateful!The other staff as well were just so incredibly on point. I'm so suprised it's a chain restaurant with such great quality and quantity.

I came here with some of my friends, and this restaurant can give you a very good ambiance. Worth paying for their "eat all you can" deal as well as the creme brulee. I can say it's one of the best deals I've paid for. Nothing special with their drinks, but our dining experience is worth it. Great service as well!

Meat quality remains great although it does feel like they come around repeatedly with the same options. We've been to other locations but this one by far was the worse. The waiter messed up our drink order the first time. The second time he never brought the drink, and the third time we had to ask other waiters because we still hadn't received them. They also messed up the drinks, tasted very off, so we had to send them back. We had about 3 different people wait on us to the point where we didn't even know if our first waiter was still our server. He also brought out the sides (potatoes, polenta, plantains) after we turned our card red and were done eating. When we asked if we could pack a few of the leftover cheese puffs to go they said no and that we had to pay for them. Seemed like a tacky thing to do since they are complimentary and should be thrown out anyway of we didn't consume them. Overall we love the food and the market table is tasty but service needs major work.

Ofelia, thank you for your remarks on the quality of our meats and the Market Table offerings. However, it’s disconcerting to hear that the service at our New York location did not meet the high standards we are dedicated to providing. We apologize for the confusion regarding your service and the drink mix-ups, as well as any misunderstanding concerning our complimentary items. We take all of your points seriously and wish to rectify any service shortfalls. Please contact us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and preferred time for a call, so we can discuss your concerns in detail. We value your patronage and look forward to the opportunity to elevate your service experience to match the quality you love in our food. Thank you.
Ismael and the other servers  did such an amazing jog serving us tonight.We celebrated my moms birthday and we had an amazing time! Perfect night, amazing food!
You can tell the food is old and been out for days and the meat  does not taste good. You will get an upset stomach if you come here.

Carolyn, we're genuinely disheartened to hear about your recent experience at our restaurant. Freshness and the quality of our cuts and Market Table are of utmost importance to us, and your feedback is taken seriously. To address your concerns and discuss how we might better serve you in the future, please reach out to our team at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

My favorite place for Brazilian bbq in midtown. Fogo de Chao is both a hardy choice and good for what you pay for. Location: Located right across from the Modern and not far from the MOMA, Fogo de Chao is in an easy to find location in Midtown. Food: We decided to go for the full service which includes salad bar and meat. The salad bar was well stocked and had a variety of cheeses, in addition to your traditional salads and dressings . Of course, though, the real star of our meals was the unending parade of meat that came to our table - everything was well cooked and tasted delicious. I also really liked the cheesy bread. Service: The service was really attentive, and we all were very satisfied with the service. Price: Not cheap, but great if you consider how much meat you get for how much you pay.  Verdict: Simply good and hearty Brazilian.

This is my first time in the NYC location. I've tried the Boston one before and this one is pretty much the same. They come around very frequently with all different sorts of meat cuts and you can get as much as your heart desires. I think there's definitely a strategy involved here where you want to sample as much as possible but don't want to get full too early, so it's good to split some of the cuts with a friend or partner. The meat itself is not bad but some pieces can be very dry or tasteless, so YMMV. The unlimited salad bar is also pretty decent but the food quality varies. Some of the vegetables don't taste very fresh, but their watermelon is pretty good - I could feel my stomach ballooning up with all the watermelon I ate. I probably won't be coming back here until a year or 2 later because you definitely need a lengthy recovery time after having AYCE brazillian meat.

What an amazing experience. This is the first time I got to come to the NYC location. It was such a great experience. The waiters were very attentive. The customer service was A1 you can tell they are constantly watching they came over to my table to remove plates.. refill water.. get drink orders they were consistently in and out so helpful.The unlimited meat options coming to the table was great!! Some meat I liked more than others but all were good. They had happy hour drink options during dinner but my favorite drink was the pineapple one they walk around offering.The salad bar was good everything looked fresh as soon as things got low they grabbed it to replace. Such a great experience I will be back!

Came for a wedding brunch, restaurant had a separate party room which was very nice and private. As a vegan I was grateful for their salad bar and vegan cauliflower steak option (originally comes vegetarian but they can make it vegan if you ask). Food was delicious and drinks were as well. Will gladly return!

I came here this past Friday night for a wedding rehearsal dinner and had a nice first time experience at Fogo de Chao. There is a buffet for non-steak options where you can get ample of vegetables, cheese, and other delicious foods. If you're here to get your fill for steak, then don't let the buffet distract you! Otherwise, I found the mozzarella, Caesar salad, cauliflower, and sliced pineapples to be quite delicious. they also had some cured hams and pepperoni if you want something more like a charcuterie board. Fogo de Chao is crowded so the servers will come by with steaks on a stick like a large skewer. They told us we would be trying 16 types of meats but it's honestly pretty hard to hear what you're trying since they're pretty busy trying to get to other tables as well. I'm not even sure if I tried all 16 types but my rule of thumb is if it looks fresh out of the oven and tasty, then ask for a slice or two. I personally found some cuts to be pretty dry and/or lacked seasoning. However, there were a few steaks I tried that were absolutely delicious and salted very well, and so tender! It is definitely very heavy, though. Fogo de Chao is probably not somewhere I'd go to very often because of that. The desserts were pretty sweet and heavy as well. I could only stomach a few bites of each one. Overall, good first time experience. It is quite crowded and the servers have a lot to do so you might not get all the cuts you'd want to try.

Came here for Christmas. We had a reservation at 8pm and were seated shortly after. We enjoyed drinks at the bar while we were waiting. Once seated we ordered two more drinks and did the full experience. We have been to several Fogo De Chaos all over so this is not new to us.The waiter told us to go enjoy the salad bar so we did. We noticed there was no place cards on the table we figured since it was busy maybe that's why he told us to go to the salad bar. We waited another 10-15 mins and we were just sitting there wondering where the cards for. He said he forgot and put them down. After that we immediately started getting different types of meats. That service was fast and they were attentive. We didn't see the waiter again we had to stop someone else who looked like a manger to ask for a dessert menu. Then finally we got the waiters attention to order the dessert. We could not get his attention for the check we spend more time waiting from wanting to order dessert to trying to pay the bill than we did eating. The waiter is what ruined our experience. The overall quality of the meat is the same that we have experienced at all the fogo de chaos so that came out expected it was the service which made the experience lack. We would not come back to this location for that reason.

Your Christmas dinner should have been excellent and we're sorry it left more to be desired. Our team would like to work with you to give you the five-star experience you deserve. When you have a moment, please contact us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
The BEST chocolate covered pineapple and lemon rice I have ever had! WOW!  Fogo de chao is the best in town!

When a friend from out of town wanted to have lunch here I was baffled - it's a chain, and why wouldn't you want to go somewhere local in nyc?  But after a visit I was sold.  For $20 you get unlimited salad bar and for $10 more you can get prime beef.   For nyc - it's fairly good price and good quality.  The salad bar has salad, cheeses, cold cuts, fresh papaya, fresh pineapple, pastas, marinated mushrooms and more.  I never get to try everything. There's so much food I can't write it all, but it's like being on a cruise.  If you get a meat you get mashed potatoes, Maduros, and fried yucca.  One of the best things is the starter croissant round w melted cheese inside.  Come hungry.

Wow! This place is amazing. My friend goes here a lot and posts the pics on Facebook, so I was dying to come here. Finally made it and had the all you can eat salad bar.  Delicious and great price! Incredible service from Johnny and Nielsen

Everything was flavorful and hot off the grill stick so to speak. As advised, I would only have 2 pieces of the original fat capped picanha steak. Top and bottom sirloin, filet and garlic steak kebab. I get it. Service and ambiance were also plentiful and courteous, but for the wait on rib eye (we'd never get) and garlic steak. But we were passed our fill already. And the fried cheese, fried polenta and best- cheese balls.

Service was ALL OVER THE PLACE, taking many minutes to seat us, bring us water, and our drinks when we were very quick and concise with ordering. Steaks were cut nice but seasoning and cooking temp "medium, rare, etc" were very off. As the only person in my group who was fine with eating rare cuts I was handed MANY large pieces of fully rare steak from people who asked for medium or medium rare cuts. Frankly the maple bacon from the self serve bar was the best item I had tonight. Was an ok experience but definitely would not go again!

Raazy, we apologize for the disorganized service and inconsistency in cooking temperatures during your visit. This certainly isn't indicative of our standards. Your feedback is integral for our improvement. Please email us at feedback@fogo.com for a direct follow-up. Thank you for your patience.

It's very crowded and noisy but worth it for the food in my opinion. Young children are noisy in general so if you have kids I actually think this is a good environment to eat with them. If they are below a certain age (forgot which exactly but went with a 5 year old and that was definitely young enough) they can eat the buffet and endless meat for free.The buffet and endless meat is great - especially worth it for anyone with a big appetite. Options for anyone no matter what their diet is (yes, that includes vegans and vegetarians). I would definitely go back.

This place is amazing. 3rd time here and each time the service, food is excellent. Came tonight to take advantage of their special offer to see how they differ from the regular price dinner of 75.00. Few prime cuts were omitted  but nevertheless it was still satisfying. Will definitely come back again
Just stopped in for drinks and a quick snack after visiting the Moma. The drinks and service were amazing. I say at the cute bar in the rear of the street level.

We visited the new Wayne, NJ location and it was fantastic. The staff was friendly and helpful. Ari our server was attentive, Gary was keeping our plates full, Albi was helping us select the best cuts for our palates. The shrimp cocktail was delicious, the picanha on point and the table side caipirinhas (and the strawberry hibiscus one) were delish! Great vibe for a relaxed upscale dining experience. Definitely coming back and want to try the bar menu next!

We sat upstairs to do the meats. Andrea and Ana did everything for us to have a lovely experience. And they scored!! All the meats were delicious!! Also we tried the wagyu ribeye, it literally melts in your mouth. Definitely we are coming back.

How does one note "better than superb service" ! I hosted an event for 25 persons in one of the private rooms for my anniversary. From beginning to end , Natalia , the servers and the gauchos made my event spectacular . The food was  AMAZING and the decor works for any event !! Timeliness, quality and smiles are ALWAYS a great recipe for a successful event. My guests and I will surely be returning !

Whatever you do, do not let them persuade you to sit upstairs.My third time here, but my first time being seated upstairs, was quite a disappointment.  You come to Fogo de Chao for the meats and efficiency. The staff are always friendly enough, but the desire to simply sale, is ever-present.  You overlook the lack of any genuine spirit, cuz they always deliver where it counts - THE MEATS! That is until you sit upstairs where it was very difficult to have the full experience of the restaurants. We kept being served a rotation of the same three of four meats, and when we requested other selections, it took quite a while to make its way upstairs.  Anyhoo, I highly recommend this place, but, again, DO NOT SIT UPSTAIRS.

Great time with friends! Great for groups and very crowded in the evenings. Very loud. Food was very good and came nonstop but some cuts could have used more flavor. The servers did a great job making sure each person got the cuts of new trhey wanted (medium rare vs medium well). Perhaps we were coming too late (small group seated around 9pm) but there weren't as many cuts as we were expecting. The salad bar and carbs were extremely well seasoned and tasty (yuca fries, cheese bread, mashed potatoes). Too full for dessert but maybe next time!

I had been to Fogo de Chao in another state. Since it was my mom's birthday, I wanted to treat her to a place she loved since she visited me in another state. I made a reservation in advance to ensure we got in even though it was a weekday since it could be popular. This fogo is multilevel and we ate at the bottom floor where the salad bar was.Overall, our waiter was the sweetest and made sure we had everything we needed. We shifted tables because our original spot was not well lit and my mother was antes it to see the menu.The menu was standard to what I have seen at other Fogo. However, the vibes are different. On the upper floors, there are bars and tv screens for sports near a bar. This was available in other locations but I had not seen it as popular as it was here. There is the all day happy hour so that could of be a reason. But since it is in midtown near popular sites and across the street from the moma. I can see why more people would come here to chill and not just because of the people carrying meat skewers. The meat is as great as usual and everyone was kind. I most likely coming back at the very least for her next birthday. Plus they do takeout so if I really need picanha, I know where to go

I went to Fogo de Chão for a bday dinner and I am happy to announce that my life is forever changed and I will never be the same. Everything was so GOOD. I swear I dreamt of meat for at least 4 days following the dinner. The highlights were the parmesan pork chops, lamb, ribs and of course the pão de queijo. I think I ate a thousand pieces of it by the end of the night. If you have room for dessert, I highly recommend. We got the sampler but and they were all out of this world. Also there's an all day happy hour drink menu which was great. Our waiter and host was so attentive and the service was great, but that might be because we were in a private room. I will be back soon!

The ambiance is just stunning. The music choice soothing while I enjoyed a long awaited date night with hubby. The food fresh and several choices of meal all bringing its unique flavor. My husband is a vegetarian and really wanted more of a selection of choices for himself. It his goal was to impress me and that he did. He wowed me with a shot of Louis XII which cost more then our combined meal lol. I was smitten. Reminding me why I married him in the first place.

Visited the Wayne NJ location, newly opened.  Party of 4 were greeted by all very warmly. The decor is really nice, many tables ....1st Con: altho some were positioned too close to the restaurant entrance and the bar and patrons passing by almost on top of the seated diners. The food was delicious, loved the variety at the Market Table. Our server Sara was informative, fun and extremely attentive. 2nd Con: seems the manic traffic of the servers and meat carriers was a bit chaotic. All in all, our table enjoyed our dining experience, and will return.
Just an absolute treasure in the midtown Manhattan area. The steak, the service...WOW what a restaurant.To use the word "sublime" seems overkill, but this was truly a magical experience. 10/10

Came down for my birthday with my daughter and boyfriend about a week ago and enjoyed every min of it. The food and ambiance was great. The service was on point as well. Highly recommend !! Will be returning soon.

This place is whack.... I get it but the meat isn't like terribly seasoned and the sides are like whatever I'll go back for like happy hour and check out the scene then of it in that it's a no for me... Tabar how much meat can you really eat. Didn't even take any pics.

Our goal was to impress you with our quality and delicious cuts, Justkey, and we apologize for falling short. We would be more than willing to address your concerns in detail, so kindly send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Currently waiting over 10 min to be seated with a reservation . Chaos. Very unhappy. Still waiting. One person was coat checking and reservation checking. Finally seated after 30 min.Modifying my review to more stars after having their salad bar which was very good. Clearly understaffed but after another 20 min wait at the table, the wait service was good. Nicely decorated on the inside. Due to the long waits, i missed my 1:30pm meeting.

Cher, we apologize for the unexpected wait you experienced, as this is certainly not our intention. We'll be sure to address this feedback will our team in order to ensure your next visit runs smoothly.  If there's anything more we can do, please send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Always a stellar time at Fogo! They specialize in food, service and a nice atmosphere for their patrons!
We work hard to offer you exactly this, Kisa, so thank you for sharing! Our team can't wait to serve you again!

My favorite Brazilian steakhouse! I've been coming here for years with a bunch of friends to celebrate various birthdays and gatherings. With a bev the total comes out to about a hunnit a head so it's not cheap you kinda gotta have to have a appetite. The cold bar is probably one of the most impressive in New York with so many different side dishes to choose from. The servers are quick and readily available and you can request certain cuts and they will bring it to you. The ambiance leans more towards the high end so business casual is preferred for this restaurant.

My favorite Brazilian steakhouse! I've been coming here for years with a bunch of friends to celebrate various birthdays and gatherings. With a bev the total comes out to about a hunnit a head so it's not cheap you kinda gotta have to have a appetite. The cold bar is probably one of the most impressive in New York with so many different side dishes to choose from. The servers are quick and readily available. You can request certain cuts and they will bring it to you. You must try the bacon and fried cheese both very good.

I usually have a great experience here, but this last time I visited assured I won't be back. The white male waiter that worked on 4/23 was so rude to my friend and I. He literally rolled his eyes when we said we didn't want to drink (at 2:00pm on a Sunday) and instead of bringing us tap water brought us a $17 bottle of mineral water we didn't ask for. We never saw him again and thankfully our second waiter was a Black woman who was nicer, but the first one put such a bad taste in my mouth. I couldn't enjoy my meal, in part also because we ran out of fried bananas and nobody asked us if we wanted more. Please do a hospitality training for your white servers who clearly feel like they're too good to serve Black people who are coming to have a good time. We were celebrating my friends birthday, which I said in my reservation and got no acknowledgment about that. Very disappointed to say the least.

Kiana, this is certainly not the impression of our staff that we want to leave you with. We would be grateful for a chance to discuss your experience personally so if you are willing, please send us an email at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

ZERO STARS!!!!!Worst dining experience of my life . I can't even think where to begin , because I can't even tell which part was the worst of it, and it's hard to wrap my head around how ridiculously awful this experience was. DO NOT come here for a group larger than 3!!! They cannot handle it !!! They are incompetent , disorganized, and untrained and simply do not care about your event.!! Let me see.. how can I start to break this down.I made a reservation for 12 people, one full month in advance. I confirmed my reservation via email and text the day before. Then I called the same day of event and confirmed if it was OK that I was bringing birthday balloons and wanted to place them on the table. They said "OK NO PROBLEM SEE YOU LATER." On the phone. My group of 10 arrive at 7:50, 10 minutes before our reservation. They refuse to sit us and tell us all 12 need to be there. We told them 2 couldn't make it. Suddenly ? they don't have a table at all for us and we are waiting 40 minutes at the door before they can seat us. What happened to our table for 12? Clearly - they never had a table. So we're standing there with our balloons while at least 50 people are going in and out of the restaurant ahead of us. The restaurant is so extremely packed you can't even walk by, you have to wait for others to walk before you can walk. Tables on top of tables and no spacing. We get to the table , and it's missing 2 chairs. So they didn't even have a table for 10 ready, nonetheless lied to us earlier about having 12. and to top it off, we're seated all the way in the back of the restaurant; Therefore the people coming around with the meat are coming to us last , if not at all? I've been to beautiful Fogo de Chao locations around the country, and the meat is supposed to feel like it's rotating nonstop. I'm leaving this location hungry, can you imagine? The waiters had no idea how the menu worked. Some of us were vegetarian and only wanted the cold food bar and some of us wanted the meat experience. It took 3 different waiters to explain that the bar menu was one price and the meat buffet was another price because the 3 waiters all said completely different things. ( I personally knew how it worked because I've been to Fogo before but the other people at the table were extremely confused by what they were being told) To top it all off they put our 1,000$ bill on one check. As if the 10 of us are supposed to be paying with one check?? They didn't even ask. And so when we asked them to split it, they told us they would not do that. So for 40 minutes, our table had to hash out who got what. Horrible horrible horrrible birthday experience. Ruined the night for everyone. Everyone was stale quiet and sadly eating their food when we're supposed to be celebrating. Had to add to the car meters and change our after party plans because we were there for an additional hour for our table and then an additional hour to pay the check. Ambience was ugly. I bought a nice professional camera to take pictures and there wasn't even a nice area to take them in being that the restaurant was so packed and lacked any kind of decor .

Fogo de Chao offers a very open and tastefully modern ambiance, one of the best one can find in NYC. The service is great as one would expect in the Brazilian steakhouse style, given that green light means they will keep coming. The salad bar is fresh and plentiful, offering the things that are fresh and acidic to counter all the protein soon to be consumed. However, I was a bit underwhelmed by the flavor of the meat and that was surprising. The chicken came first and it fell flat. My long time friend from college, a great cook in her own right and a certified foodie, felt the same. One does not come to a steakhouse and are less than impressed and, if it happens and you have a reliable friend with you, you'll ask if they feel the same for confirmation. The bacon wrapped chicken and steak could not be helped with the assist. The garlic steak moved the flavor needle, but it should with the somewhat heavy hand of garlic used. This is an indication the quality of the meats is in doubt. Any steakhouse should offer a level of quality that stands on its own, without the need for bacon wrapping or fairly heavy handed garlic for the assist. If I can recall only the lamb, top sirloin and pork belly as flavorful at this location of Fogo de Chao, then there are too many other misses with the other offerings and the quality becomes a prime suspect for the lack of flavor.At $75 for the full Monty, it may come down to what can reasonably be expected for the variety and quantity offered. There is no way to leave hungry and everyone will be entertained by the frequent and friendly visits of the wait staff. This would be a great place to visit with a group of friends or colleagues, when the attention to the quality and flavor is not as focused when alone or with another person. Service and ambience are very good, but there should not have been any waste on my plate at a steakhouse, but there was and I noticed I was not alone when others finished eating. It gets three stars and the third is added owing to the service and ambience, which were very good.

Serving high-quality cuts Is our commitment, Edmond, and we appreciate your honest feedback. Please feel free to send us an email at feedback@fogo.com so that we may discuss your comments personally. Your complete satisfaction is our goal and we hope that you will visit us again in the future. Thank you.

Amazing service, very attentive and communicative. It was my first time here and Bardo was my server and he gave me and my wife great recommendations about the wines and meats offered. Everything was really tasty and tender, I definitely recommend coming with an appetite :).

Came here as a guest for my extended family member's milestone birthday. Manager needs professional training, or to be replaced. Reservation was made more than a month ahead and had to put down a 50% ( ~$600 ) deposit. The manager was very aggressive/fussy about putting money down to reserve yet forgot to put our reservation in the system!?! She was rude and not apologetic for her grave error. We ended up having to wait quite a while in the lobby for a table when this was supposed to be a surprise party. The food was good. But when we asked the waiter to help us take a photo, he took it in two halves, and split the group and half. Terrible photo taking skills! Also, at reservation time, we were promised a prime table, but were seated to the side on the day of

Alex, we apologize wholeheartedly for the issues you encountered with the reservation management and the lack of proper hospitality during a significant family event. It is essential that our guests' arrangements are handled with care and precision. We take your experience seriously and wish to address each point you've raised. Could you please email us at feedback@fogo.com with your contact details and when it would be suitable for us to contact you? It's our priority to ensure that such mistakes are not repeated and that your future experiences reflect the level of service we aim to provide. Thank you.

Like the buffet style they had for salads and appetizer. The service was good but found the meats to be underwhelming. Very salty at times. I did enjoy the cheese bread and plantain! Good to try once but probably will not be back. AYCE is around 75!

We never want you to have an underwhelming experience, Janet. Serving delicious meals is important to us and we would like to learn more about how we can earn your complete satisfaction in the future. To discuss your visit further, please send us an email at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

Hello,Wanted to say that the food we received was great and all but it was slow. We came around 12:00 pm on a Saturday (Brunch). We were seated quickly since we had a reservation. We were seated in a corner even though there was a lot of open space in the middle or on the side. That was a problem since no one would notice us if we turned the card to request more meat. The servers were barely approaching us. I don't know if this is a strategy for us to get full with the sides or what but it took away the experience of what we were expecting. Another thing, my wife and I went to get some additional sides then came back with a waitress already collecting our plates and utensils. That person didn't even ask us if we were done eating. I understand about the plates, but for her to take the utensils away as well was rude. This was around 1:25 pm. I know we were taking our time, this is because we were waiting for the cuts of meat to be offered to us, even asking the other servers for specific cuts so that we could get out in a timely manner as well.I hope Fogo De Chao management will fix this.

Kristian, we strive to provide prompt and excellent service, and we're sorry we fell short during your visit. We would be grateful for a chance to speak with you personally and work towards making this right. If you would like, please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

My husband and I came here for the first time on Valentines Day. There close to Nurset & parking is available on the next block. I knew of Fogo de Chao in Miami but was curious to see the NYC location. We didn't know the style was more buffet than actually ordered. The waiters walk around with a variety of meats for you to choose from. They slice them directly onto your plate. We enjoyed the salad bar which had many delicious options. The waiters came around asking if we needed anything many times.We ordered the bacon wrapped chicken & steak. The food was great. After dining we headed back up to the main floor and enjoyed a few more drinks at the bar. Would definitely come again.

We had dinner here recently on a Saturday.  The food was just OK.  Many of the meat selections on the menu were not offered to us. There was no bone-in ribeye, no bacon wrapped anything, no chicken, no beef ribs, etc.  Much of the meat was overcooked and arrived at our table barely warm. Overall, the quality and quantity of the meat dishes seemed lacking for $74 per person (no drinks or dessert included). There are better much steaks available in Manhattan for the price.  This restaurant would be better deal during lunch or brunch when it is $54 per person.

Serving high-quality meals is important to us, Mike, and we never want you to feel otherwise. Our team would like to work with you to give you the five-star experience you deserve. When you have a moment, please contact us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Great service and love the experience :) food was great and minimal wait time. Our drinks were awesome and everyone was so nice

I used to think Fogo was excellent, but the service I had today left me with a bad feeling. As they sat me I felt like I was being up-sold on their many extra options as well as pressured to buy a drink. I turned down all the extras because the Full Churrasco Experience is plenty of food and variety and actually a good deal for the lunch price. The server asked if I'd like sparkling or still water and I said still. I went to the salad bar and came back to find a tall bottle of specialty mineral water on my table. I apologized to the server and told him I just wanted tap which wasn't an option he mentioned in his initial pitch. He took the bottle away slightly annoyed. I've learned now to always ask for a cut that's very rare because more and more often, the meat is coming out over cooked and dry.When it came time for the check he told me to wait a moment because he had another table to see to. No problem. But he never came back. I had to flag down another waiter to get my check which he did happily. Then my original server came back and said oops I forgot your check to which I told him someone else is getting it. The check came and because I was in a little bit of a hurry, I just put my card in the folder and they ran it. I signed, tipped 20%, and I left. It wasn't until I was walking away did I realize that lunch wasn't usually that expensive and it dawned on me, he didn't take off the fancy water that I asked him to take away. Anyway, lessons learned -- always look at the final bill and don't be so trusting. Also, if they're trying to up-sell, just slow down the tempo of the sales pitch, smile, and say no thank you with confidence.

We are taken aback by what you have shared, as we can assure you that correcting guest complaints promptly is vitally important. We apologize for what you have encountered and appreciate you making us aware of this. If you wouldn't mind, please send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you, and we look forward to your future return.

I made a reservation for lunch Saturday Dec 30th  in New York, R 999895926I was celebrating my wife birthday, Evening went well until the server brought the check, I wanted to apply the $15 off that I got in the mail, But the interaction went wrong from that point forward;The server didn't know how to apply the code to my check, when I asked she said "I don't know, it doesn't work"  I showed her my phone with the email with the code, she continued to say "I don't know" "I don't know" I offer her to take my phone so she can apply the code or find a manager to help her, but she start asking for my credit card to run the payment,  I didn't accept that so I ask her to find a manager to help her. Surely after Carlos came with the check, the $15 off was applied to my check, I gave him my card for the remaining balance, and I mentioned to him "I feel that the server was rude and not helpful, that he should address that behavior with her"He apologized, he was super nice an understanding, he even brought a desert to us.  I Feel he understood, I was very satisfied. But then the server came back to my table to recriminate why we had complained, she even told us that we were the rude people because I showed her my phone with the code. She made us feel very uncomfortable.I wanted to talk to a supervisor or manager, I found this behavior very unprofessional and wrong, that is not the experience you want to have after a meal. but if she was so careless to come back to the table and question us why we complain and  talk to us like that, I figured she will stop us at the door to get back on us.1 if Fogo de Chao send discounts or promotions on someone's email, make sure your staff how to apply it.2 Fogo the Chao should provide hospitality training and manners training for employees.  (If someone asked for something you are not familiar with or have not knowledge, don't say I don't know" just  say " I am not familiar with that, but I'll find a manager and we will help you out" simple right?

Eddy, we're sorry your experience fell short, particularly on such a special occasion as your wife's birthday. We value Carlos's efforts to address your concerns and regret that the initial interaction over the discount code was not as smooth. Our team is dedicated to constant improvement and ensuring that each guest feels cared for during their visit. Kindly reach out to us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability so we can discuss this matter further. Thank you for your feedback.

I came with a friend for brunch and had, hands down, one of the best experiences ever at Fogo. The staff was amazing. Ana took the best care of us checking in and telling us about off menu items. Hunting different meats down when we haven't seen it for a while. She went above and beyond, and my friend was blown away just as much as I was. I can't wait to go back!!
Came here  with a friend there was live music. Had an amazing time. Will definitely come back for another event

I made reservations here for my birthday Feb 25th and was originally going to have 12 people. I was contacted by their event coordinator and offered the Amethyst package. I was really pleased with the process of making my reservation. I did note however that I requested half booth of possible, due to traffic I arrived 20 minutes late with my party so one wasn't available. I cannot blame them if that's the case.The food was incredible and awesome. Everything was delicious. The waiters was very attentive with our drinks and requests. When it comes to the food we were very satisfied.4 of my original party didn't make it and I was left with only 8 guests but they still honored the group rate they gave me when I made my reservation. This was greatly appreciated. They also took the time to split the check so we could pay as smaller groups since some of us were couples, some were single, and some wanted extras, others did not. They were very accommodating and this was very appreciated.My one complaint was the temperature in the restaurant. It was freezing. I couldn't remove my sweater because I routinely needed to hide my arms inside it. We were sitting in the back by one of the exits leading to the parking lot and every time someone left it got colder. I requested they turn up the heat the waiter was very apologetic that there was not much he could do. Apparently the power outlets near where we were seated were not working so they could not place a space heater at our table. Eventually they did attempt to use a space heater by running an extension cord but sadly it did not help. The bathroom was also Ice Cold and had no hot water. On my walk to the bathroom I did notice the center of the restaurant by the half booth WAS much warmer but at this point it was too late for me to ask for them to move as dinner was winding down and they had stopped serving meat. We were so cold we elected to take our dessert home. Oh, they also apparently had limited dessert options. We were told the Cheese cake was frozen and only had Key Lime Pie and Chocolate Moose as options. Both were DELICIOUS, but I was hoping for the Cheesecake!After all is said and done despite the freezing cold I really enjoyed the meal and I'd 100% come back again; however this time if it was this cold I'd likely get up and leave. I want to come back to the food again. The meat was delightful and delicious. I got the Wagyu Ribeye and my friend got the Wagyu NY Strip and my other friend got the Lobster add on. We were very satisfied with every single bite!I hope to come again one day but PLEASE FIX THE HEAT! I ended up with a respiratory infection I'm still recovering from!

Let me start by saying service was impeccable and may be the best I have seen in the city.  Staff were informed, attentive, had initiative to offer other appetizers and sides, but provided space when needed. There was a good selection of meats, but it seems Churrascaria may have more choices. The lamb sirloin was perfect, and the other cuts were really good. I hesitated on the chicken leg but even that was roasted well and was juicy.The Papaya Cream was delicious and the crème de cassis made it all the better.

We've been to Fogo many times over the years and always have good churrasco experience. This is also our go to joint when we have out of town guests visiting whom are also meat lovers like us!  The restaurant is spacious. I like the openness, comfortable and inviting environment in the dining room. There are many variety of fresh and good quality food at the extensive salad bar. Be sure to pace yourself as there are many different kinds of meat going around tables non stop until you you 'flip on the red'.I love the warm cheese bread for the table and the Picanha is my favorite churrasco meat of all, I can't have enough of those!!!

One of our go to place for some good Brazilian BBQ meats! My favorite is the picanha. I always request the brunt side, it's a little crispy and taste so good! Do not fill yourself up at the salad bar and just have the meat keep coming until you give the 'sign' to stop! Yes, there is a sigh for each patron and you flip it like a coin. One side is green and flip to the other side which is red to stop.

My family and friends celebrated a birthday dinner on February 3, 2024 with a reservation at 10PM. Was seated quickly and that seemed to be the only positive part of our experience. Once seated we were not greeted by any server, after staring down multiple servers and managers a manager came to greet us and get our drinks. We let her know that we're celebrating a birthday and would like a dessert to come when we're finished. Food was good per usual and got the regular sides except missing the cheese bread. I had to ask 3 people with one being a manager to bring bread to the table and finally got it after 15 minutes. We continue our meal and as we're finishing our meal I try to find the manager I spoke to in the beginning for the cake. She was nowhere to be found. We finished our meal and went ahead to ask a different manager for the birthday dessert to be brought to our table and he said "Yes, of course. I'll bring it to your table." After 20 minutes the cake had not arrived to the table. We then had to ask 3 more people for the cake, which was brought out after 15 minutes of asking the 3rd server. We waited from 10:45-11:30 for our birthday dessert. While waiting for the dessert we had asked for our bill and seperate checks. After about 45 minutes of waiting for the bill the bill then arrived with everything on 1 check. we felt we did not receive quality service so we left a 5% tip. A server by the name of Reginaldo then opened the check while it is still on the table, picks it up and turns around. Turns back around to us and says "18% is the minimum required service charge, you need to put atleast this amount, do that for us please" and handed us the pen and checkbook back. As everyone is aware tip is based on service which we did not receive, then to say 18% is required is absolutely ridiculous. After hearing that from Reginaldo, we grabbed a manager who said "It's okay, you don't need to do that" but he was very quick with his response and seemed to not even care. Reginaldo who never came to our table before dropping the check was trying to scam us by saying it is required. I've dined at multiple Fogo De Chaos in multiple states and have NEVER had such a HORRIBLE experience.

Kara, we are sincerely apologetic for any frustration or disappointment caused during what should have been a celebratory dinner at our New York location. The lapses in service, from the delay in receiving the cheese bread to the challenges with the birthday dessert and billing, do not represent the high standards we aim to uphold. Furthermore, the interaction regarding the service charge is concerning and not in line with our values. We take your feedback very seriously and would like to address the issues you've raised. Please email us at feedback@fogo.com with the best way to contact you. We hope to resolve these matters to your satisfaction and ensure a better future experience. Thank you for bringing these points to our attention.

went to the Garden City L.I. location and although the food was so so,  the service was horrendous.  it was extremely loud and kids running wild.if you want a good Brazilian churrasco house go to Plataforma on West 49 Street in Manhattan.  Amazing food and service.

It is our goal to provide top-notch service and we're disappointed to hear about your experience. We would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you directly and work with you to make this right. Please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com if you would like. Kind regards.
Everything was so delicious. I loved my caipirinha. Sazia was so sweet and gave me the name of the premium cachaca! I'm going to grab a bottle and take it back to Australia!

TOO SALTY! My wife and I went to Fogo de Chao in Manhattan in December 2022. The place was packed (tables are packed close together) and lively. The servers were very nice, although it seemed to take forever to get a glass of wine or a glass of water. My reviews:MEAT: Salty, salty, salty. I love properly seasoned beef, but the salt on the beef was overbearing. As for taste, each type of beef was gamey. Strange but true. The lamb they brought was even gamier. I love lamb, and I don't mind when lamb is a bit gamey, but the lamb they served me was so strong that I couldn't eat it. And, again, the beef was gamey too. Tough, too, except for the beef ribs which were fatty and tender. But did I mention the salt? By the end of the meal, I didn't want to eat more meat because I couldn't stand the thought of more salt. Is this intentional (so people don't eat too much meat)? I think so.In addition, I found each cut of beef to be tough (except for the ribs). Even the filet mignon. Lamb was tough, too.  DRINKS: I ordered three glasses of wine, and they very very small pours. Disappointing.SIDES: They brought some sides to the table which we delicious, but the potatos were tooooo rich and creamy. I did ask for some french fries, which they brought me for free. That was nice.SALAD BAR: Fine.I will never go back to Fogo de Chao. I would rather spend my money getting a perfectly seasoned, cooked steak at an upscale steak place.

We appreciate you and your wife dining with us and for sharing your rating, David. It disappoints us you were not impressed with your meal, as we work hard to maintain quality cuts, a fully stocked market table as well as attentive service. We can assure you this feedback will be addressed with our team in order to improve and we truly hope to have another chance to restore your support. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

I've been to Fogo in other cities before but never tried just the Market Table for weekday lunches. Currently priced around $19, the Market Table has a great selection of fresh veggies, fruit, meat, cheese, and dips. Some highlights for me were the elote, cauliflower, pineapple, and seasonal hummus.  I'm also glad we got to enjoy my fave pao de queijo (cheese balls), plaintains, garlic mashed, and polenta fries. Everything tasted pretty good, but you definitely get full really fast because most of the foods are on the heavier side. But for $19, you really can't beat the price. You can also add on meat for around $8-10 which would still be a solid deal.

Large spacious area, with great servers and great overall atmosphere. Beautifully decorated interior, great location. Amazing first time experience of churrasco. You receive a card, one side green indicating to bring out more meat, and the red side indicating to stop. We started with the salad bar, which was fresh and delicious. Had a variety of different greens, meats, and salads. Various meats were served, our favorite was the lamb and beef dishes. Great side dishes.

Had a terrible experience celebrating my birthday at this establishment.1. The hosts sounded like they did not want to be there. We had reservations at 2:30pm, I took them 40 minutes to seat us down. I was wondering why bother having a reservation system if you are going to make your guests wait anyway.2. The all you can eat experience was mediocre. The waiters kept skipping our table. we were always missing the complimentary bread, had to beg for water refill.3. Because they sat us down late, they charged us dinner price instead of lunch. Our reservation was at 2:30pm. We arrived at 2:20pm. They only sat us down at 3:10pm. Overall, please if you want a truly Brazilian steakhouse experience, go to Churrascaria Plataforma. They have much better customer experience, better servers, and meat quality. I will never go back, or refer anyone to this chain, ever again.

Bruno, we love hearing from our guests which is why we are disappointed that your birthday celebration fell short. In order for us to try and turn things around and hopefully restore your confidence we ask that you, please email feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

This place doesn't let you tip a waiter directly if she is great at her job. We talked to the manager which didnt let us tip her more. We would have spent alot more if we could have tipped her directly. Very disappointed since she was great at recommending great wines. If i could give negative ratings I would. definitely not come back

Kevin, we take your feedback seriously and we encourage you to reach out to us personally so we can address your concerns. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Awesome food, service and experience!Great variety of meats and a very well balanced buffet that is very tasty.
Thank you for your supportive review, Alex! We hope to welcome you back for another delicious meal!

Took my mom here for Mother's Day because for some reason Fogo de Chão ends up being one of her favorite restaurants Even with a reservation, you'll find yourself waiting so you might want to book a table for 15+ minutes earlier than when you'd actually want to be seated. The drinks are good so can't complain much about that. The drink menu isn't that big but they'll allow you to order drinks that aren't on the menu so be prepared that they won't get it right if it's not one of their regular drinks. I ordered a champagne martini and it was alright, I'd say 6/10The salad bar is ok and nothing spectacular. Other patrons are gross so you may want to skip itThe food itself is mostly good but some meats were over cooked or were not seasoned well so tasted bland. The variety was good. The staff was all over the place:- hostess was probably the worst part of the whole thing. They were friendly but not very bright and extremely slow to seat us- the servers were actually very good.  They were quick, got everything right the first time, and checked in from time to time- the staff bringing out the meats would skip tables or not pay attention to whether the table had red or green. They should incorporate some sort of light system or just go to every table. There were a lot of times where we wanted to see what was coming out but they would never look or stop by - the bartender was ok and tried his best when it came to custom drinks but even some drinks on the menu were not good. At one point the server said she would take back 2 bad drinks but the bartender wasn't around for a while to make new drinks One thing I didn't like was that we were seated on the top floor which was great for private convo. The bartender is located there but like I mentioned, he wasn't always around so getting drinks was delayed, also you had to take a janky service elevator to get down to the salad bar if you wanted something from thereoverall it was alright but there are better alternatives

Kenneth, we're saddened to hear that you were disappointed in your visit. Our team is dedicated to serving high quality in every aspect, so we appreciate you sharing your honest feedback with us. In order to ensure this is properly addressed we ask that you please send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you, and our team will be in touch.
