I was hoping for this to be our annual Thanksgiving restaurant, but the performance was less than acceptable. Ther server who was pushing bottles of wine. We declined a bottle of wine. He pushed a new bottle. We said no again. He wouldn't take no for an answer and was incredibly rude. Our friends have stopped drinking this year-- so having a bottle of wine on the table is out of the question. The waiter stopped visiting our table for 45 minutes--despite us asking for checks. We were in a back room with horrible temperature control that was extremely hot. We asked for potatoes with no chives and they took 30 minutes to come out.The turkey was served coldWe asked for more filet and they never came out.We asked for more chicken legs and they never came out.We asked for refills on black beans--they never came out.Stuffing was cold. A check was brought to our table but was not from our actual table. Why were you trying to pass off someone else's bill on us? What really grinded our gears was being told we were unable to split checks because they were 'too busy'. In 2021-- they gave us a palm pilot and we could split our checks and it was super easy. The manager was rude, and just said-- told me what to charge and refused to split checks based on what we ordered. Leadership has not provided answers to:--Our reservation was at 6pm, and we were not sat until 6:30. The front desk told me you overbooked by 20%. Why did you overbook? --Our server was relentless on upselling us bottles of wine--Our table was not visited by a server for almost 45 minutes. --Our friend was still eating, but no more meat was coming out. --Why were we unable to split checks? Is this your new policy? Why were we not notified?

We would have loved to become your family's yearly go-to restaurant, Alexander, so it's disheartening we missed the mark. Providing polite, helpful service is our goal, and can assure you this is not a reflection of our business standards. In order to make sure this is properly addressed, kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

Decided to make dinner reservations to celebrate my college graduation and so happy I did.I had the churrasco experience which included the market table and salad bar. I only had 1 trip to the salad bar as after a few bites I was stuffed. It was so much food. The market table items are sweet plantains, garlic mashed potatoes, polenta fries, and cheesy bread. All of the delicious cuts of meat and the items from the salad bar... Whew! I was stuffed...I ate a piece of garlic steak that spoke to my soul. Omg it was so good. Literally the best thing I've tasted out of the entire meal.The staff, the ambiance, and the food was excellent!They have both indoor and outdoor dining. It was quite humid and stuffy out so sitting indoors under the air conditioning made my dining experience even better.I will definitely be back for brunch before the summer is over.
Perfect date night... nice ambience... good selection of meats ... amazing wait staffPerfect venue
I give it a five star. Roman and his buddy's taking good care of his customers with quick service and a lot of tasty meat with love.

Yesterday I went to this place to celebrate my brother birthday. I am not sure what they use to cook or how fresh is  their food.  Right now is 4:30am and I can't sleep or stop going to the bathroom. (My family as well)I had the worst experience in this location and I sure I got a food poison from them.We had the barbecue experience. All the meats were unflavored and they waited so long to bring the meats.They basically brought raw even though I ask for well done.The can feijoada that I get from the supermarket was better than theirs.The pão de queijo (Cheese bread) had more oil than cheese. Obs: I wasted most of the food. I was chocked with the price that I had to pay for the food with this experience. However, definitely not recommended, the only good thing was the location besides that the rest wasn't worth.Custumer service was "ok" and they didn't care about my meet preferences or how I liked to be cooked. And I ask for more kind of meats but they just brought chicken legs and picanha. Which they offered multiple times even tho I rejected multiple time as well.Plus: They were giving some kind of meats that wasn't event the real meat that they mention. We had chosen this place because we liked the lamb in their website. However in reality wasn't a really different view and raw as well.

Felipe, the safety of our guests is of the utmost importance so please know that we take your concerns seriously. We would be grateful for a chance to speak with you personally and work towards making this right. If you would like, please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

I've been to a few locations and generally like Fogo chain. It was however an extremely disappointing experience at this midtown location last night.  It's at lower level and comparably smaller ---- not big deal. The dinning room was freezing! How cold was it? Almost all customers were wearing their winter jackets! And then fire alarm went up with the loud noise so for a decent 10 minutes we couldn't hear each other. Waiters had no sympathy. The host/manager never showed up to apologize. We just ate as fast as possible and ran out ---- it felt warmer outside than the restaurant!Not going back again.

We are very sorry to see this 1-star rating, as we strive for perfection at Fogo de Chão. When we do not meet that standard it is very concerning to us and we would like to make things right, so please reach out. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Great service (thank you Marina)! I had the samba martini and it was delicious! Great lighting and music. Nice place to have a drink and meal before or after you go to MOMA

This place is amazing! Have been coming here for years and always has been great. Highly recommend. One of the tightest run restaurants in the city and the food is really delicious. Special thanks to manager Jorge Almeida to taking great care of us today!
Thank you for your continued support, Rob! It's great to hear how much you enjoy our food and we look forward to serving you again in the future!

First, the service provided by Roger was outstanding.  He was very attentive to our requests and answer all of our dinning related questions.  The food layout and preparation was fabulous and tasted exquisitely delicious.  The ambiance was very pleasant and relaxing which added to the total dinning experience.  It was the perfect start of a memorable evening.  I will return for another special occasion.

The food and our waitress were AMAZING. However the hostess and the woman calling your name need to be removed from their jobs or need further training. I was there on Nov 11 for a birthday dinner that I booked in advance. We got there about 25-30 min early. I approached the hostess and told her I would be adding an extra person to my already 13 person dinner. She didn't even bother to read the instructions of wishing my uncle a happy birthday she just asked if we were all there and since we were early we were not so she told us to approach her again when everyone was there. Then at 5:48 ish the person sitting us approached us and asked again how many ppl were at the restaurant and at that moment we were 12 expecting 2 more who were on the way. She then proceeded to give us a nasty attitude and tell us "if they are not here in the next 30 min you're loosing your reservation" 1. How is it that you're threaten us with canceling our reservation when our reservation wasn't until 6 it was 5:48 pm... like who are you timing us when our time haven't even started?? 2nd how dare you speak to guests like that specially when my uncle chose that location to celebrate such  a special day like his birthday? Honestly it wouldn't had matter if it was his birthday no one deserves to be spoken like that. You are acting like you are giving me free food! On top of that once the two people we were waiting on arrive they told them there was no reservation under the name they had provided... like what?!!! So unorganized and horrible service from these ppl. Like I said our waitress was amazing and no complaints about HER service. I will not be going here again. Please spend your money somewhere else. To be treated badly and pay such high price for their food is insane to me.

Providing professional and excellent service is what we strive for, Josseline, and this is not the impression we want to leave you with. Our team would like to work towards an opportunity to give you the five-star experience you deserve. If you are willing, please reach out to us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Loved the visit just a little over crowded. Staff was extremely friendly. Salad bar was delicious
God place for visit Friday evening is cool 10-12 main corses beside of salad bar Recommend to visit

Come with an appetite! My friend and I were accommodated with such great care. I'm vegetarian and she has severe food allergies. Our server Rafael was attentive, polite and even got us the infamous Cachaca Infusion drinks! The cauliflower and filet mignon entrees were mouthwatering. The chocolate desserts were rich and sweet. I would recommend the restaurant because of how great the service was.

First time here, this dinner was wonderful for our family of 5. We had such a good time laughing over the unique fine dining experience. The Best of Brazil was amazing, and the service was wonderful; our plate was always full with meat and sides. Saziya had such great recommendations for dessert (the tres leches and brigadeiro were great) and our waitress was wonderful as well. The ambience feels chic, but not stuffy which made us feel very comfortable. We would absolutely return here and would recommend!
Not as good as the other local Brazilian steakhouse...not great service, pricing nor options on the bar. Wouldn't go back.

It is disappointing to hear that you were not impressed with your experience, Mark. If there's anything we can do to ensure your return in the future, please let us know in an email to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you and we hope that you will consider giving us another try.

This place I may need to jobs first before I go back because my bill was crazy.. But it was all worth it( it was for me and my little cousins birthday) I had the Waygu Ribeye Steak... I swear there is no way I'm going back to regular steak NO WAY!!!!!! That piece of meat right there hit differently. It has changed my life forever I will definitely go back when I get my money up though lol!!!!!
good service Good environment delicious good price fresh meat $90 per person, I enjoyed the service and food for this value worth the money worth the time

First after making reservations for a birthday dinner, we had to wait half an hour. Got seated in the wrong place and one of the women working there had a very nasty attitude about something that wasn't our fault. After that, the food was very yummy, and great options for the buffet. I recommend it. Lots of variety of meat and Good service after the mishap and made us all forget about it. Amazing ambiance, can't wait to go on a date here now.

Food was very good but service wasn't greatI ordered and appetizer but never got it. The waiter was asked to bring an additional bread and potatoes but never received it and finally when I got the check they gave me the check fr the next table over.

Although we appreciate you dining with us, John, we are disappointed to see we missed the mark. We hope to ensure your next visit is worthy of five stars. We encourage you to reach out to our team directly. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

Wonderful experience and wonderful service!!!!We went here to celebrate a grandparent's 80th birthday :)The food was amazing and the ambience excellent. Upscale spacious restaurant - design rarely found in many places in the city.  Great for large groups!The meat options were incredible and very well executed and delivered.We did the all you can eat option in two forms:1) most of us did the one including all the tender meats (chicken, lamb, pork, steak)2) a few of us did the option that was the marketplace salad bar option only (which also had some chicken salad, lox, and cured meats)Both options were fantastic and all of us were stuffed with whichever choice. The only downside was that the menu at the table was very confusing and that the dining options were not clearly presented.  Appetizers and beverages seemed to just be immediately offered in a way that felt like they were upcharging without explaining how the dining options worked.  This made for a very uncomfortable and awkward start.   Would suggest that the restaurant make the menu more transparent and clear with regards to the options. Overall, had a nice celebratory experience and they graciously created a dessert for the birthday grandparent. Would definitely recommend and come back.
Excellent! Came on vacation to celebrate for my daughters graduation and she said it was the most amazing steak she's had.
Is jus what you expect from Fogo: Great food, Great Service.In addition, Great ambience.Came here to celebrate my daughter birthday.

Love coming here. The cheese bread bites they give you throughout the meal is so delicious. The restaurant is also in a massive space so making a reservation isn't an issue at all. Kids under a certain age eats free and the older ones get to eat for half price. Good selection of different proteins and also items from the salad bar. The service is also great and if you go during lunch time there is happy hour. Winning!!
Thank you for taking a moment to share your comments, Dom! It is great to hear how much you enjoy the food and service, and we look forward to serving you again soon!

I only paid 44$ for the cuts of Brazil special, and I am so happy I didn't end up paying for the full dinner service. Nearly all of the meat is underseasoned and improperly rested - resulting in tough and chewy meat with little flavor. Beyond this almost all of the meat is medium well - well done, if not it's like super rare. I left with a stomach ache feeling unsatisfied. Their drinks were also notably bad - with the Jorge's sour tasting as if it were straight out of a dive bar. Do not think I'll ever find myself in a Fogo de Chão again.

Nov 2021- the food is absolutely delicious. Definitely opt for the buffet. Their salad bar had such a variety of quality things to choose from besides your typical tossed greens. They had hummus, prosciutto, various cheeses, so many types of salads and chilled seafood items.The highlight of this restaurant is their carved meats. On your table you're given a round coaster type thing. One side is green and the other is red. You flip it over to green when you'd like the meat servers to stop at your table. The meats were so juicy!! My only complaint is that we had to wave down the server for the homemade sausages since he overlooked our table a few times. The customer service is great. The hostess was friendly, the servers were quick and attentive. The workers stationed at the salad bar were also on top of it refilling the items and keeping things neat.The restaurant itself is a beautiful space. The restrooms were clean.You can make reservations easily on Open Table.You'll definitely have a nice looking bill at the end. Our bill came out to +$350 for 3 buffet options and a few drinks. But you'll definitely taste the quality and care put into the foods and be satisfied afterwards.I'm so glad we went to this restaurant and am looking forward to going again next time I'm in NYC.

Good dining experience. I had the patio to myself. I only had happy hour foods are this location but in the past I've bad really good food here. The food was decent and very reasonably priced. The coconut caipirinha is amazing.

at this price point, fogo de chao seemed like a place to celebrate a special occasion or entertain guests.  but the execution was just off during their weekend brunch/dinner service.  - the menu we received was a shortened version so unless you looked on the website, you wouldn't know that there are fish and vegetarian options- the brunch salad bar had bacon, but none of the other brunch options- an omelet station was set up, but it was not staffed- no one acknowledged that we were celebrating a special occasion- the first sign of this odd experience is that no one called to confirm/remind us of our reservationour servers, however, were cheerful and helpful when we asked for anything.   our table really enjoyed the fried cheese with honey that has to be requested from the kitchen.  so, i would come back for a casual buffet experience, but not as a place to impress.

My girlfriend and I dined at the 53rd Street location on 10/21/23. We were seated on the top floor table 300/1 near the bar. We got to the top floor and was greeted by a female with great posture and smile. We later found out she was the Manager. Absolutely no regrets! Our Server, Julia and the Manager, Anna were nothing short of amazing. There was another server by the name of Chinzilla who was also very nice an attentive. Julia is the type of server who managers/owners should strive to hire. She was very attentive, professional yet friendly, consistent with all her tables and knew about the menu. The food, drinks and desserts were fantastic. We got the bill and I asked to speak with the manger because I needed express our satisfaction with the service she provided. I didn't realize my tone made Julia feel as thought something was wrong or we not satisfied (which was NOT the case). It was very busy but Anna arrived in a timely manner ready to fix what she assumed was wrong. We complemented Julia on her service and I apologized profusely to Julia and Anna. I would definitely return in hopes of being served by them. We left feeling full, satisfied and happy! We will definitely return.
Good food and drinks. The bar was full and we were treated nice. Amazing server Kate.

Came here for an event with my wife. The event was hosted at the upstairs bar. As always with Fogo de chao, service was super hospitable. I believe the restaurant takes up there stories and there are some cool views of the restaurant from the upstairs bars. It's a cool place to hang out.We were there for a cocktail event so we did t experience the typical Rodizio but we did have some great food. My favorite item was their grilled cheese with honey while my wife enjoyed the lamb chops. I enjoyed some wine throughout the evening too. Before we left, I had a glass of scotch. They had a fair variety of whiskey. Not a huge selection but definitely a nice array with options a all different price points.
Deliciosa su variedad de carnes y ensaladas. De igual manera sus cócteles. La atención de los meseros me fue satisfactorio
Great food and Sazia was great! All in all I'm never disappointed whenever I come here and I come here a lot
Best place to eat meat service very good and friendly  definitely i will be backBest caipirinha i had
It's awesome to know how much you enjoyed our meat cuts, Deni! Thank you for your compliments and we look forward to your next visit!

It was a cool experience..A lot of different cuts of meat were all great. They really don't play about turning your green and red cards though. If you don't tell turn the card over to tell them stop they just keep pushing out all cuts on your plate! Solid place!

O yea I'm a savage! I appreciate a nice steakhouse that will give me my steak slim thick and juicy. They kept coming with the meat pause you will not leave hungry! Great place to go with friends or on a date.

Absolutely loved it !! (The meat waiters where a bit rude one of the bold ones had nasty attitude towards us we asked nicely to come he replied calm down & never came back ) but other then That I had the best experience my son had an amazing birthday & i apréciate the birthday slice thank you for that

Fogo de Chao is a wonderful restaurant with a great atmosphere,  incredible tasting food and an attentive staff. Our waiter Valmir was terrific and the customer relations lady Sazia was charming. The variety of meats, the salad bar and the drinks (as well as the creme Brule) were to die for. A perfect way to spend a night in midtown Manhattan!
We had a very nice Friday evening at Queens Fogo de Chao, the service was nice, our server name Wilber was very polite and attentive to us, we really appreciated. Also the food was amazing.Thank you

Did a takeout order from Fogo de Chao during Restaurant Week and had a wonderful meal. The Picanha was nicely done and flavorful (and was also a good sized portion) and the Quinoa Tabbouleh and Mashed Potatoes were great side dishes. Had to wait a little bit while my order was being prepared but it was well worth the wait!
Thank you for your review of our take out, Andrew! Our goal is to wow our guests in ever dining aspect so this review means the world. Hope to have you back in soon!

Big fan of Brazilian steakhouses so was excited when we managed to get a reservation at Fogo de Chao during Restaurant Week. It ended up okay.....  The service was good and there was plenty of meat but perhaps except for the picanha, the selections for one reason or another were not very impressive. Some like the pork and chicken were a little dry while others did not seem to be properly seasoned.That being said, the Restaurant Week menu is a great deal and do not regret going. However, all else being equal I would probably choose Texas de Brazil (better tasting meats and better salad bar) over Fogo
Come here hungry.  Meats are good.  They also have a salad bar
the food was faboulous as always! great service and ambiant! Service was nice and attentive. I just miss the charcoal fire pit lol

I went on a Saturday afternoon for a birthday lunch. Food and service was great. It's definitely a lot of food if you get their churrasco experience. It comes with their salad bar that includes with some crudite too. Dont fill yourself on the salad bar though. Their Caipirinhas are tasty but strong. The only complaint I have was that we were sat next to a large party and they were really loud, and the hostess was rude when we checked in. For a restaurant of this caliber and price, I wished the environment could have been nicer.

I always look forward to trying the different types of meats/poultry served on skewers. There didn't seem to have much variety for this type of restaurant on the day of our visit. I had high hopes to try a wide variety of offerings. Instead we got what seemed to be three different steaks, bacon wrapped chicken, chicken drumsticks, and that's it. The salad bar was subpar. There again were not impressive choices. There were veggie choices. The soup was good - butternut squash. I didn't leave feeling stuffed which is how I normally feel after one of these all you can eat meals. However I did like the special cocktails and desserts though!

Rion, we are saddened to hear that you did not enjoy your time with us. We work diligently to impress our guests with our delicious meals and apologize for falling short of your expectations. If you wouldn't mind, please email us at feedback@fogo.com, with your contact information and availability, so we can address this further. Thank you.

I love brazilian churasscaria & have been to this location before. We went last night & it was just like going in to buy a used car. As we sat down we literally were rushed with up selling on our meal. The waiter asked if we wanted bottle water...we got sparkling which is the norm for me...we also ordered alcoholic drinks which is norm as well for us, and we would've stayed longer to drink if they just RELAXED!  but he kept shoving the wine bottles down our throats  & we dont drink wine. Then he kept trying to upsell us on the upgraded meat/steak selection...like we hadn't even sat down for 2 minutes to even see what we were feeling like.... Or what there was on the regular pre fixe....making us feel awkward & pressured with the bum rush on over selling us...he asks if we want any other drinks on top of the sparkling water & alcohol..we said I think thats good to start with. Then he starts with the upsell on appetizers ...we hadnt even seem what the salad bar had yet. As he walks away another server comes over to sell us a card to help hungry children in need...we literally hadn't even gotten water yet. LIKE WTF. When are u approached about donation & charity at a restaurant even before you have eaten!!! Or ever!!!!!! Did we come to eat a restaurant or to buy a car???? There were over 50 servers all around us ready to sell us more things...they offered additional appetizers to buy again ....when there is so much food that you get anyway cause its all you can eat. Like relax...let us get started & slowly work ur sales into it! As a professional sales person...i hated every minute of this & didn't even get to enjoy a relaxing meal with a friend in town....we felt bum rushed & THE UP SELLING just ruined the experience. Not to mention the drinks he was so eager to sell us didn't even come out for 20 mins cause they forgot the order. AND IN ADDITION I had made reservation on the site & it was $44 special per person mentioned on the site at time of making reservation but the bill came & they charged us $75 regular price & i had to have them adjust it. I've always liked how nice of a location it is but the dining experience was mehhhh & not enjoyable. Maybe spending more time cleaning & re filling the salad bar is more important for your workers to focus on than selling us cards to donate to starving children before we even started eating! HOW TACKY!!!  And to teach your servers & more seamless way to upsell than the harsh pressure sell! Made me lose my taste for that restaurant completely!

Arzo, your dining experience with us should always be wonderful, so it's disheartening to hear we missed the mark. We appreciate you allowing us the chance to address your comments and work towards making this up to you. Please send us a note with your phone number and the best time to reach you at feedback@fogo.com. Warm Regards.
Reservations are a waste of time. We have at least 8 people ahead of us and waiting 20 minutes. What's the point of having reservations.

We take reservations seriously, Al, and we're sorry to keep you waiting. We would be grateful for an opportunity to speak with you personally regarding your visit and work towards making it up to you in the future. If you would like, please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

"THE CHURRASCO EXPERIENCE" Recomendado al 100%  cuentan con varios tipos diferentes de carnes los cuales están todos muy deliciosos, también tienen un buffet de comida bastante variado (ensaladas, frutas, sopas y otros acompañantes) los cuales vienen  todo incluido por un costo que me parece bastante accesible y adecuado a la calidad de la comida la cual cumplió con mis expectativas  Las bebida y postres son aparte pero cuentan con un Happy Hour excelente yo aproveche y me tome unas cuantas CAIPIRINHA, mis favoritas fueron STRAWBERRY HIBISCUS CAIPIRINHA y PASSIONATE CAIPIRINHA  En cuanto al restaurante como tal es bastante grande una decoración muy bonita y la meseros están vestido bastante acordes al lugar. Muchas gracias por todo fue una gran experiencia volveré nuevamente con mi familia y amigos.

What's not to love about all you can eat steak?! The meats are always cooked well and delicious. Salad bar is great but wish there were more hot options. They do provide hot mashed potatoes, Pão de queijo and yucca fries which are good. The passion fruit caipirinha drinks are amazing! And they do a great (free) dessert for birthdays if you tell them it's a birthday. Definitely a great place to come, especially with a group of friends!
We love to eat here especially for lunch.  The salad bar for lunch.  The buffet is only $18.00 without meat.  The employees are great especially Wanuza.
Thanks for sharing the love, Kathy! We look forward to serving you again soon!

I'm honestly very surprised to see recent reviews stating bad service and bland meats at Fogo. I've come here before in 2019 for a belated birthday dinner celebration and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing service and good flavorful meats. So, I decided to come back again for another birthday celebration, this time for my mom and with a smaller group. I made a reservation for brunch this past weekend. When my party and I arrived, we were promptly seated and had all our questions answered by our waiter. We, of course, did the churrasco experience and had the salad bar and brunch features included since it was the weekend (it is automatically brunch from 11:30-2pm.  At first, it did seem like no one was coming to our table with meat, but after 15-20 minutes, people started coming around. They actually made sure to come to us as long as we made eye contact and had our cards flipped over on the green side. And honestly, the cuts were super fresh and flavorful! Of course, there were some cuts I liked more than others like the filet mignon, but that's all persona preference. The salad bar was also super great and a nice way to refresh the palette in between the different meats. I also tried the made to order omelette, which was super good. We also got the complimentary sides such as mashed potato, fried plantains, and the fried yuka chips. All of the sides complimented the meats. Also, FYI, they have happy hour all day now. So, we were able to get a bottle of red wine for the table for $28! Definitely ask your waiter what they recommend and what the happy hour bottles are! The biggest surprise, however, was when a piece of cheesecake was brought to the table at the end. When you make a reservation now, you're prompted to specify what the occasion is. It was super nice to get a birthday slice for my mom with a candle and all! Overall, Fogo is definitely a nice experience to have for a special occasion. I would also note that I definitely enjoyed both the brunch and dinner, but feel that it is better to go during brunch since the salad bar is included!

Phenomenal experience. Top notch food, atmosphere, management (especially Nathalia - FOH Manager) and wait staff. Have been here multiple times, and every time is an amazing experience all around. I always take my out of town guests here, as the food is always superb. Definitely a lifetime customer!
We are happy to hear that you had a phenomenal experience at Fogo, Arthur! Thank you for your patronage and we look forward to serving you again soon!

Excellent service! It is fancy dining so I recommend that you dress up a bit. My colleague made a reservation here for lunch at 12pm on a Saturday. For all you can eat buffet here it's $60, not including tip and tax. We dined inside. They have a nice selection of salads, fruits, and appetizers at a salad/fruit bar where a waiter guides you and transfers the food items you pick to your plate. My colleague and I ordered a bottle of a malbec wine for $50. My colleague is a VIP here and they surprised us with 3 free desserts: a key lime pie, a chocolate cake, and a cheesecake. The waiters also gathered and sang happy birthday. I love how you can easily split the payment on their high tech calculator that is embedded with a credit card/cash payment tool. I would definitely come back here for a special occasion.  I highly recommend it.
Everything here was really great! We had a great time in Philly, so we decided to come to this location, everyone has been so nice :) food was delicious

Amazing, beautiful and delicious. I came here for my 27th birthday and my parents have never been. They're usually skeptical about new places but they really enjoyed this experience. The service is fantastic and very attentive. The high ceilings make you feel like you're not in NYC. Sazia worked with us and was amazing. Will definitely be coming back.

I've always liked Fogo de Chao, but that liking turned into "I LOVE Fogo de Chao" during this pandemic for sure.Their packages for delivery are really reasonably priced for how much food you get (especially if you purchase the pounds of bbq meat and sides separately, you end up with quite a few delicious meals and it's a great deal!). The meal packages are good as well - it gives you more variety, but if you know what you like, and plan to make a few additional veggie sides yourself, definitely go for order the items individually. My favorite of course is the picanha. No flavor loss from delivery and it came hot, fresh, and tasty. The bottom sirloin was pretty good as well, and the prime lamb steak was definitely another favorite. The side asparagus and pao bread is amazing as usual - even better when you can order more and eat them for breakfast the next day!Highly recommend getting delivery here - I have to admit I might like Fogo delivery even more than I'm person dining! #thankyouthuraday

I made a 5:30 pm reservation, arrived at 5:20 but we were not seated until 6 pm. This was rather annoying because I had a baby with me. At 5:50 I asked the host and hostess how much longer the wait time would be, the woman basically ignored me and the man was just rude. The man told the woman that I had just arrived, I responded and told him that I arrived 30 minutes ago and did not just arrive and that i was just asking how much longer the wait would be, his response was that when he told her I just arrived it was something "internal", it didn't make much sense to me but anyhow, we were seated 10 mins later. i personally think reservations are made for a reason, not to wait 30 minutes. When I arrived, we were not asked if we wanted to check in our coats, but others were asked. Also, once seated, we waited 15 minutes for a wine menu and we had to repeatedly ask for the meats to be brung to the section we were seated in. Our waitress was very nice, and checked on us a few times or was nearby whenever we needed something. I've been to this location many times and I feel like the service has gone downhill and the buffet section has different items that are not as tasty. i won't say that I'll never go back, but I definitely won't be returning any time soon. The upstairs host and hostess really need an attitude check though because the rudeness was completely unnecessary.

Jean, we apologize for the delay in seating and the interaction with our host team. We understand that prompt, courteous service is especially important for guests with young children. We appreciate your past patronage and are concerned to hear about the service not meeting past standards. Please email us at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability so we can address your concerns. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

I came here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon. I've actually never been to a Fogo de Chao restaurant before but it's probably because I'm not a big fan of red meat. For all you red meat lovers, this place is definitely for you. You turn your card over to green and you're ready to eat meat. The best cut of meat to me was the NY strip steak. Since it was thick cut, it was not dry and super juicy. The lamb chops were good as well. Everything else (sirloin, ribs, pork, chicken) were a bit too dry to me. You also get complimentary sides: polenta fries, mashed potatoes, caramelized bananas, and pao de queijo (tapioca cheese bread). The best thing was the warm pao de queijo. The Market Table & Feijoada Bar had a good selection of cold salads, cheese, cured meats, and fruit. I especially liked the exotic fruit: starfruit, kiwi, papaya. Service was really amazing since you can request a meat and they will try to bring it out for you. It was a fun place to try out once in a while but since I'm not a fan of red meat, I probably would not come back here often.

Food was decent. About what you would expect when a 3 star hotel puts on a buffet for Easter or Mothers Day. I was expecting better. Service was not great, my waiter made a grand total of 3 visits to my table. But the dining room is packed with folks trying to upsell you. I bought this rum drink they were wandering around with for $15. Its flavor was ok, but it was such a tiny pour that you had to squint to see it in the glass. It was meant "for me to sip on through the meal." If I sipped it, it would have evaporated. Four people tried to sell me dessert. Yep, four. The last guy was pushy about. "No dessert? No coffee? Are you sure?" Ironically, after all of this high pressure up selling, not one server noticed that my wine glass had been empty for half of the time I was there. I would have loved a second glass, but they missed it. For $115 for one person, I left disappointed. I had high hopes for this place, but sadly I cannot recommend it.

Thank you for making us aware of your experience, Michael. It is our goal to provide top-notch experiences, and we are sorry to hear you left with such an impression. We would be grateful for an opportunity to invite you back for a better experience in the future. If you are willing, please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com, and we will be in touch. Kind regards.

Good service and the food was most of the time amazing. It was really fun when the waiters just kept bringing each type of meat over and over. Although there were two things that bugged me. The waiters said that the bottle of wine we bought was supposedly $35 but once on the check it said $49. Also towards the end of our meal they offered us a "cachaca infusion" which was $15 dollars for a shot.       All in all the service was great and so was the food just wished that I had more foresight on random stuff they "decided out of the kindness of their heart" to bring us.
This place was a true experience! The buffet and the meats were phenomenal, not to mention the dessert. Definitely will be coming back. The service was also amazing. Thank you NY Fogo de Chao.

Kimberlee, we strive to create excellent and unique dining experiences and it's wonderful to receive your supportive feedback. Thank you for taking a moment to share and please feel free to stop by anytime!

Highly recommend Fogo de Chão! The best Brazilian BBQ. I want to personally give a shout-out to Christopher. He was beyond amazing and took very good care of my family and guests. The experience is worth the price! The food, service, and staff are excellent. The meat cuts were plentiful and delicious.  Seasoned perfectly, plus they do not rush you out the door. I can't say enough of the drinks. Just a fantastic experience! The only thing I wish they didn't do as much was the constant questioning from the waiters  that come around trying to sell you a better cut of meat for a higher price as well as trying to sell you a shot of a high end liquor.

Best all-you-can-eat place. Make sure you're hungry before going. The service is spectacular. You will not leave hungry. Lots of variety in the market table. Remember to flip your card to the red side when you're full, if not food will keep coming your way. Their steak is seasoned perfectly. Just try all the cuts! For desserts, I recommend their creme brûlée.
It is wonderful to hear how much you enjoy the food and service at Fogo, Maria! Thank you for your support and we hope to welcome you back soon!

As someone who prides themselves as a aficionado of Churrascaria,  I was excited to try Fogo de Chao, as it was the last remaining rodizio on my Brazilian bucket listAtmosphere:   Compared to most any other Rodizio I have tried, the atmosphere and vibe here is more modern and more elegant than any other Brazilian restaurant. Very deceptive when you first check in, as the entrance floor is just a small hostess stand, but then you are lead to an expansive dining room, with an elegant, minimalist design, with a soaring wine rack and large lampshade type of modern chandeliers to set a pleasant but dimly lit atmosphere,  The marble marketplace salad bar is gorgeous, and I havent even gotten around to describing the food that adorns itFood:  This was the most pleasant surprise of all. As a chain restaurant, I expected the food to be somewhat "Americanized" but nothing could be further from the truth. The  day that I went, they even had a regular Picanha and a special Picanha, the latter which was as flavorful as any restaurant I have been to, even those in Rio and Rio do Sul. The filet mignon was melt in your mouth good,  and the other varieties of sirloin were on point. The grilled cheese with honey was very unique and quite a treat. The star of the show may have been the marketplace salad bar. To begin, everything is so fresh, and is immediately replaced when they are getting low. I never thought to combine smoked salmon with honey bacon, that may have been the highlight of my day. The soups and salads were delicious, everything is very well labeled, its tempting to just make a meal out of thisService:  We were taken to our table by the lovely Sarah, and our server and busser were fantastic,. The gauchos could not be any more pleasant, the food was flowing endlessly and the most impressive part, was depite having a huge dining room and a wide selection of meats, when we asked the gaucho or  server to come back with a specific  type  of meat, they never forgot about us, and even remembered the temperature of the meat we had ordered from last time .  Usually, in a review, I can try and put one thing I would like to see the restaurant improve on, but I am at a loss for words. Rogerio and his team should be commended for making everything flow just perfectly, from beginning to end
I went to the wayua & wine event it was amazing. Anna was customer Service was spectacular . She was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely come back .

I personally like the meat here than most nyc steakhouses! I love the salad bar with a lot of options for veggies and fruit dishes. Cocktails are also wonderful ~~~! The darkly lit atmosphere is fancy and opulent; service is attentive and excellent. I also appreciate the layout of the restaurant -- how the tables are arranged. I enjoyed every bite from last night's splurge.

Took my significant other here for his birthday . We went for brunch . Service was outstanding , food was amazing. My boyfriend said the meats were great, he tapped out from the all you can eat experience pretty fast . I ate at the buffet , which was really great .

Went to Fogo Brazilian restaurant to celebrate  my Birthday with my twin sister .  The FOOD was great, the service was great, everyone was pleasant and was so happy , they made our time there rememberable. I will definitely be going back.

Overall fun experience with tasty food and lively environment. The meats were cooked well and the freshness of them really stood out. Service was fast and attentive when they came although because we were seated on the side sometimes it was a little harder for them to reach us. Definitely go hungry as everything is pretty rich and filling and it is all you can eat. The salad bar was also decent and it helped balance out the meat. Would recommend to others for a fun date night or a group get together however it is a bit on the pricier side. We went to celebrate a birthday and they were very sweet!

Pros:- Great tasting food - ALL. YOU. CAN. EAT. ~ Eat as much meat and sides as you want - Nice servers Cons:- Expensive - Very crowded ~ It honestly didn't look like they were following city/state regulations with how packed the restaurant was Overall: This is my 2nd time at Fogo (first at this location) and the food is just as good as the first time I had it. I did, however, feel a bit uncomfortable with how many people were eating indoors. If you're concerned about this, I would recommend eating outdoors

Only offered 3 types of meats and asked for more other types the staff seem to not care.  One of the employees kept bumping into my table then spilled a huge bucket of ice next to me on the floor and got me a little wet in my pant leg.  This is just the start of dinner, you just can't make this crap up its crazy.

Kevin, we truly apologize for your recent visit, as this certainly does not reflect our professional service. We want to ensure this is addressed, as your support is important to us. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Amazing restaurant, great service and wonderful ambiance  Staff is very attentive, we had the pleasure of being served by Jennifer, best chocolate dessert!
Excellent food. Great service, everyone kept coming past and checking on us and tge experience was phenomal. Great gluten free options too.
Best Rodizio hands down in the NYC Metro area. Only better place I've been to is Rioz in Myrtle Beach and that's only because the salad bar is superior because it offers sushi and much more.

came for the $40 special which was noted on our reservation however they initially charged us for the regular price. they also come around with things that are an additional charge but dont really say. food and salad bar are not bad

Thank you for taking a moment to share your thoughts, Brandon. We always want our guests to leave feeling completely satisfied so if there is anything you would like to discuss regarding your visit, please feel free to send us an email at feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Kind regards.

This restaurant is a Brazilian restaurant and it is beautiful in the inside. The staff are very attentive and courteous. They come around and offer u special alcoholic drinks. The Fogo Churrasco experience is when u get to experience different meats when they come to the table. The meat was good, but a little salty. So if you have high blood pressure this restaurant is not for you. My husband did enjoy it. I had the lobster and shrimp but sautéed because I didn't want it chilled. It was ok. There was a lot of oil and onions. It wasn't my best lobster and it was small. We had those 2 meals and 1 drink each $$$$. I had a coconut martini and my husband had Smoking honey. They were both good. For side dishes the experience comes with plantains, bread, and mash potatoes. I think the salad bar too, but we decided not to use. The staff did a good job bringing out my friend's specially made cake. Overall it is a good experience, but I probably won't go back.

Demishia, it's disappointing to hear that we let you down, as your experience with us should be fantastic. We'd love the chance to address this offline, in hopes of working towards a second chance. When you can, email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Best.
Yen & Anna are always amazing and take great care of us when our crew comes in! Superb service!

Dining at Fogo is truly an unprecedented culinary experience. The food is so fresh that you can eat for hours and still feel incredible. The staff is not only so accommodating and attentive but you can truly feel how much they love their job and take pride in their work. (They even teach you Portuguese words throughout the experience!)I cannot recommend Fogo de Chao enough and I want to quickly mention that their Director of Sales, Benjamin Maddy, makes it so easy to plan an exceptional event. Fogo is our new go-to for all our dining and private event needs!

Two words : HAPPY HOUR !!My friend from Brazil brought me here one time a few weeks ago for the happy hour , I went back yesterday with 7 more friends. Everything is amazing. The delicious drinks ($4) , the beer , the appetizers ($4-6) and the HUGE picanha burguer with the faroa fries !!! ($9!) I came to have the spades here years ago and I enjoyed it. But I'm so happy they have this kind of quality food and drink deals. ( from 5 pm- 6:30 pm)

Honestly, for what you get, it's quite overpriced. I appreciate that it's an all you can eat meat fest. However for the price, it's not worth it. I went on a weekday evening and since we have reservations, there was no wait and my party of three was seated promptly. That's all nice and fine. The waiter we had was trying too hard to be friendly and came across a bit aggressive. When you pay for higher priced meals, the wait staff general treat you a little better. Generally, when they seat you at your table, the waiter will help the females push in their chair. Our waiter practically shoved my female companions into their chairs. Once we were seated, he asked us about drinks. He asked us 3 times after we ordered tap water and continued to push us for more drinks. We ordered some simple stuff just to get him to calm down and go away. Another member of the wait staff pushed us on some cognac (I believe) and mentioned it was rare and limited time. But again, pushy. Long story short, the wait staff here try to be friendly, but come across as pushy and a bit aggressive by constantly trying to up-sell drinks. In terms of the meat, it was a bit on the salty side. Perhaps it's this ploy that encourages customers to order more drinks to offset the excessive salt in the food. The food here does not stand out. We have a good varieties of meats and were MAYBE impressed by one cut. After a certain point, we got tired of chewing because of the toughness of the meat. In addition, this place was packed. During COVID. Less than half the wait staff wore masks. Many waiters constantly bumped into our chairs and table. It's as if they are trying to pack everyone in to make up the lost months of revenue during the height of the first wave. When we tried to close out our bill, it took almost 10-20 minutes to get the attention of a waiter. Considering we paid almost $100 per person, I was highly disappointed and don't expect to return.

We appreciate your feedback, Kenneth, as we always want your experiences to be wonderful and exceed your expectations. We'd love to work towards regaining your support, so please email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Warm Regards.

Rafael was AMAZING! He was extremely attentive, had a great sense of humor, and was timely when bringing our orders to the table. I've been to this restaurant before but I've never laughed with a server the way I did with him. I'm hopeful to see him again for my next visit.

Fabulous time with Andrea! We came for the Zuccardi wine night it was amazing. The Malbec were great and the parings with the meats we're yummy. Also a shout out to Marina for my BF's cheesecake. Would definitely come back for another wine night :)
Everything was fantastic! Sazia was so kind and attentive and we love coming here. I come with my brother all the time,
One of my favorite Brazilian restaurants for a good hearty meal.  Nice atmosphere for an Afternoon meal
Great experience here.  Great setting and beautiful space.  Staff was excellent, food great and I recommend highly!  Bring your appetite!

The food and drinks were great but service was a little slow. Took forever to get drinks and initial appetizers. Charges way more than regular Fogos in other locations for the full rodízio experience.This location: $71/personOrlando: $50/person

We didn't have the experience like most people.  We were a group of five.  Came to dine with a reservation.  The restaurant was beautiful and come highly rated.  Therefore we had high expectations.  But once we got inside and sat down.  We got ignored by the staff.  Not sure why, but their meat staff will serve the table next to us over and over, but will walk right by our table.  We end up calling the manager and threatened to walk out before we were served.  For $71.00 a person and be ignored.  It's a two stars restaurant for us.  Tips, go during lunch. No reservation needed for lunch. Dinner is not worth the price, at least the service we were getting.Update:  June 29-2001I email my contact info as requested about a week ago.  Still waiting for a callback.Update July 1st:I got a VM from someone at the restaurant.  I then called them back immediately.  After waiting on hold, I was told that they were busy and they would call me back in 30 mins.  Well, that was two days ago.Update: July 8thStill no response from restaurant as promised.  Now we all know if they are serious they are about customer service don't we?

Khanh, we are disappointed to hear that your visit wasn't up to par, as we should always be delivering top-notch experiences. Our team would like to speak to you further in hopes of understanding how to make this right. Please send us a note with your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Best.

I went to Fogo de Chao on Saturday evening and had a reservation for 7 pm. They took about 15 minutes to sit us down. When we got to the table, our server told us to look up the menu with a QR code and took about 10 minutes to come back to us. My boyfriend ordered a lemonade and we decided on getting the Fogo Churrasco meal where you can get food from the salad bar and food from the people walking around with skewers. The salad bar food was delicious but has a very limited selection (there were only two types of cheese, a few deli meats, only 2-3 types of fruit, salads, and other items). Other Brazilian steakhouses have a huge selection of items.The ribeye, filet mignon, sirloin, picanha, lamb, pork ribs, and other meats did not have flavor at all. Their filet mignon taste like beef stew meat. The lamb was VERY gamey. I NEVER thought any lamb tasted gamey but now I know what the gamey taste that bothers everyone is like. It didn't seem like they put salt on the meats AT ALL. We waited more than an hour for the sausage because the person kept skipping our table... only to find out it was very over cooked and didn't have much flavor. The only meat that had flavor was the garlic steak which was delicious.Our sides came after 20 minutes which includes the mash potatoes, plantains, and their famous cheesy bread. I love their cheesy bread and mash potatoes.We had to remind our waiter for my boyfriend's lemonade 30 minutes in. He took another 15 minutes to bring the lemonade to us. The lemonade drink was pretty good. The service is not great since our waiter took forever to get our order and took forever to find out what was going on with the lemonade. Our waiter checked up on the party that sat next to us frequently because they ordered a lot of alcohol. He even told all the people with skewers to head to their table but couldn't bother checking on us. We wanted more cheesy bread but he couldn't bother looking our way until 45 minutes into the meal when he handled us the lemonade. We ended up spending two hours here because of all the waiting....Overall everything was gross except for the lemonade, garlic steak, cheesy bread, mash potatoes, and salad bar items. It's definitely not worth $70 to only eat those 5 items and wait forever for anyone to pay attention to you. Go to Churrascaria Plataforma or Texas de Brazil instead of this place.

Maggie, we apologize for letting you down, as we always want to live up to the expectations you had for us. We'd like to discuss these inconveniences offline, in hopes of regaining your support. Please email us your phone number and the best time to reach you at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday. The best dinner I've had in a very long time. The buffet was delicious, I would go back just for the buffet honestly. The food is pricy but actually worth it. Once you put the green card up, the waiters keep coming with different steak options. The steak cuts are mouthwatering. The service was great too. Different waiters were coming by every so often  to check on us. All in all, I highly recommend!

The best meat experience at Fogo de Chão, great food, an amazing service, and btw, if you are going there, look for Andrea, she's definitely the best server at that place, very kind, helpful and thanks to her my husband had a perfect bday at one of his favorite place!
Great service and amazing food!!!! Loved coming here with my family. Always incredible and consistent.

Decent Brazilian steakhouse that has affordable happy hour deals available in their 2 bar areas (the street level floor and the mezzanine. The beef sliders, the grilled chicken sliders, and my personal favorite "The Bone" are my go-to bar menu items that I can recommend during their happy hours. The Brazilian beer, Xingu Black, is an available option to order, but they also feature several cocktails to try out as well.
My sister and I love this place so much. We love the food and the service as well. We come here once a month
Amazing experience this saturday afternoon at Fogo de Chão Brazilian SteakHouse Manhattan, great food and special mention for the service, Ana Beatriz made our experience outstanding!

One of the greatest experiences ever!! Amazing place and an extraordinary service. I was helped by Ana Beatriz and she offered a great experience throughout the food and drinks from Fogo. She's so nice and beautiful!! Come and look for her!
Luiz, your words of praise have been very much appreciated by our team. Thank you!
Yen is amazing as always! She always makes us feel welcome and perfectly tended to. I will continue to frequent this location and ask for Yen!
I love coming here! Rafael and Yen always provide top notch service and make me feel like I'm home away from home. I will continue to make this one of my regular stops.

What's that point of making a reservation if I still have to wait for nearly an hour to get seated? I made a reservation for 2:30PM in hopes to catch lunch, and still had to wait 30-45 minutes for a table. I asked the front desk host for an ETA and she just told me to wait by the side for my name to be called. My friends approached her again shortly after to find out we were not even put on the list to be seated. Poor organization. Food took long to reach our table as well, we had many moments where our plates were empty while we stood by for passing servers. Most disappointing part was we were charged dinner prices because of the long delay. Not coming back and do not recommend.

It is imperative that we win your vote of confidence, Lisa, and so we'd like the chance to invite you back for a five-star experience. If you would please email our team directly at feedback@fogo.com including your contact information and availability and our team will be in touch. Best.
Amazing food and service! Maria was particularly helpful and gave great dessert and drink recommendations.

"Gimme alll the meat here!"The is the place where you eat till you drop...dead...into a food coma. It's a carnivore's heaven, but they throw in a salad bar thing in case you wanna bring your vegetarian friend/family (you shouldn't though LOL). Or I guess, to cleanse your palette after eating too many servings of meat. (It helped.)Came here for an anniversary dinner, which was all around a wonderful dining experience. Loved the service, the patient and helpful waiters who stood still if we wanted to take pictures of their meat offerings, who asked what kind of thickness of meat we wanted, and when it seemed like we were waiting for a particular cut of meat (beef ribs!!) they asked and then a few minutes later, it was brought over to us. Yasss.First, the bread. Omg this cheese bread. I don't even know how many plates of bread we consumed (possibly on par with the meat) that's how good this cheesy mochi like treat was. Super stretchy, super cheesy, super filling. Super wanna smuggle plates of these homeIn terms of the meat cuts, my favorite is the beef rib. It's hands down the most tender of all the meats sampled, and has a really good meat-to-fat ratio that makes me salivate just thinking about eating it again. Next is the perfectly cooked and juicy lamb chops. I normally don't care for lamb chops because it does get a little gamey if not done right, but these were grilled perfectly with a perfect blend of seasoning. 10/10 would come again and wear bigger pants (even though the place is realllly nice and fancy looking) when I've finished a two day salad cleanse. Heh.
It was good. The experience left me satisfied and full. They worked fast to make sure everyone was served in a timely manner. 10/10!

We ended up having our anniversary dinner plans cancelled last minute in NYC, but were able to get in here within 15 minutes. Easily the biggest Fogo I've been too, but the quality of food and service didn't miss a beat. So friendly and as always, very tasty. Thank you.

Absolutely love it! We went for our 8th anniversary. As crazy as it sound to go to a Steakhouse being vegetarian, bit hey, the food is SO good. The place is very nice. Decor is great. The only downfall is that we had to wait for the meat servers for more than 15 minutes. The buffet is so yummy and the add ons they bring to the table are delish. I took home. Kids younger than 6 eat free. Kids 6-12 eat the buffet 1/2 price, so do veggies. Can't wait to go back!

Update, our check took almost 30 minutes to be paid. My sister had the check with credit card on her hand and waved, but no one came by. Bad...Service was mediocre compare to Location in California.Been asking for grilled pineapple 4 times, 2 times with manager and 2 times with servers. Funny thing is, last manager informed me that he will check on it but took all of our utensils...My server hardly check on us after the this first order. I wouldn't recommend this place if you want to enjoy all that Fogo de Chao has to offer.

Providing excellent service is our mission, and we are sorry that we failed you, Lexa. We would like a chance to make this right with you in the future, so kindly email us at feedback@fogo.com with the best way to reach you. Kind regards.

Excellent dinner for a group who loves to eat!! I came here for my birthday dinner and didn't eat all day to get as much as I can out of this place! The all you can eat option comes with access to the salad bar and unlimited cheese bread, polenta, and fried plantains. I'd recommend not filling up on those apps as delicious as they are and holding out for the meat! They serve on rotation probably 10 or more different cuts in different temperatures. My favorite is the picanha, the fat cap makes for a super juicy and almost sweet like meat cooked at a perfect medium rare. The waiters also come by with grilled cheese in a honey like marinade and crisp bacon. Oooooh my mouth is salivating just typing this out so I think I'll end it here hahaha

I had the most amazing time here! The service was phenomenal. The staff was super attentive to our every need. The food is delicious and how can you go wrong with unlimited steak. Absolutely loved it!!!!!!!!!!!
Creating amazing experiences is what we strive for, Michelle, and your feedback brightens our day! Thanks for the Fogo love!

I had dinner here once on a date. I love Brazilian food in when I'm craving it I go on dates. I ordered from here once on postmates, this fine ass Brazilian guy arrived at my door I was miserable when he left like damn can you eat with me or something lol  the food is very expensive but I only went one time to experience real Brazilian culture. I hope I can come again!

This was my second time going to this restaurant different location the 1st time and it was my friends first time going and we both got the Full Churrasco Experience and let me tell you it was nothing short of amazing. It's all you can eat buffet style with all the amazing fine cut meats you can eat, so bring your appetite. We will be going back again cheers.

Now let me explain to you that the idea that this is BOTTOMLESS PRIME BRAZILIAN MEATS with endless sides for $45!!! A must go to for a special occasion. This is a go to spot for friends and I ever since i spent my 29th there a year ago & must of been here 6 times in that span. This lunch we went for a friend's birthday lunch and wanted to try a few other items, so HERES THE SCOOP...I always go for lunch (before 430p) since the Churrasco experience is $45 instead of $70. We tried the jumbo shrimp cocktail ($25) marinated in garlic sauce. The shrimp was delicious. It was slightly over cooked but the salsa dip was delicious and the garlic gave it so much flavor. The churrasco experience is amazing! They come to your table and slice the meat for you at the cooked temp of your liking (Med, well done). We ordered mash potatoes and they were cold, but the waiter quickly replaced it with fresh hot mash. The fried polenta is one of my favorite side dishes. But let's not talk about the cheese bread they give for the table and the fried bananas. YES fried bananas ! Not maduros. We had some salad, cheese, peppers etc for our plates to enjoy with the meat that came around. The waiters don't overwhelm you with options all at once which is nice because every meat is a fresh sliced piece. We had lamb chops, top sirloin , bottom sirloin, rib eye, lamb steak, and more! We also decided to try a Brazilian non alcoholic drink called pineapple mint lemonade. TO DIE FOR!  just ask for light ice to get your buck's worth even though it was about $4 (old barista hack). We were even dressed in jeans and a nice top. I wouldn't suggest walking in here in sweats but it's also upscale enough to celebrate a nice occasion and dress up on a night out. I recommend to make reservations especially since it's limited dining in NYC. But to sum it up, if your in a  carnivorous mood and want an all you can eat in midtown NYC for a steal of a  price, make a call

I went on 8/4 2023  To the Paramus location. Not good. Felt like I was eating in the mall. The service wasn't the best. Our waiters shift ended and he disappeared. My wife ordered the salmon. Really salty. Sent it back and she ordered the sea bass . That was very  good. Took over 30 minutes to arrive. Just not worth $100 per person. 4 people $400. Not ok.

Your experience at our restaurant should always be worth it, Cliff. We value your feedback and would like to learn more about how we can earn your complete satisfaction in the future. If you are willing, please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com and we will be in touch. Thank you.
Service was wonderful Food was delicious Exactly what I hoped for to show my 4 kids a fun night out in NYC.

The salad bar was excellent. The meats, on the other hand, were totally tasteless. Every cut of meat tasted the same -- no flavor at all. What's more, much of the meat was tough and chewy. For a better restaurant, this was a very disappointing experience. Would not recommend.

While we're happy to know the Market Table was excellent, Craig, it's disappointing to hear the rest of your meal was not as satisfying. Please know we take your feedback seriously and we hope you give us another chance to impress you. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

henomenal Brazilian Steakhouse with an all you can eat special with more than 12 types of meats cooked in any rendition. Garlic Beef was a personal favorite of mine but make sure you do lunch vs dinner cause it's a huge difference in price.

Great location in Long Island. Definitely not a every week thing as price is about $69 per person but the service and food was excellent. We were able to try every meat except the BISTECA de PORCO " Double Bone-in Pork Chop" . Everything was delicious, my favorite was definitely the lamb, filet mignon Lombo "pork" . so much flavor. Some were okay only because we didnt get the part of the meat we wanted but when we told our waiter she went ahead and advise them and mins later they came back and we got the good part. I love that. Dessert was great too. Got the Tres leches. Great service and great food.

This review is based on take out for restaurant week which btw has been extended until Feb 28th. Restaurant week is a perfect opportunity to try some of the best places your city has to offer without breaking the bank. It also allows you the opportunity to try new things you may never had the opportunity to, or perhaps under your radar but not within an allowable price range. BTW meals at participating restaurants are semi pre-selected at $20.21 which is phenomenal!!!!!The take out process is awesome. Especially, if you are not yet comfortable dining out but still want to support restaurant and want to have delicious meals. What did we order for pick up? I selected the steak and chicken with a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes. The meal also comes with Brazilian cheese bread & the amazing chimi sauce. My husband ordered the lamb and steak combo with a potato salad & a caprese salad. His meal was accompanied by Brazilian cheese bread, chimi sauce, & mint jelly. Each meal was just $20.21 for restaurant week. This by far is a top phenomenal deal. The food was absolutely delightful!!! There are more options when you visit the restaurant week website. Please do not forget to tip kindly.  They also have lovely out door seating and I believe this weekend limited, indoor seating resumes.  Call in advance for further information. The take out is so nicely packaged. You will definitely enjoy your meal.

**COVID LIMITED INDOOR DINING REVIEW**TL; DR: I am not exaggerating when I say that my visit to Fogo was one of THE BEST restaurant experiences I have EVER HAD. I am a proud, self-proclaimed Foodie/Brunch Queen (haha) so this is saying ALOT! My boyfriend had made a rez for the Saturday night before Valentine's Day PRIOR to the announcement that NYC's indoor dining would resume that same Friday...Needless to say, we weren't quite sure what to expect (complete madness?!) and hoped for the best. To say the experience exceeded our expectations would be an understatement. When we arrived we were promptly seated downstairs, and while the restaurant was completely booming, all of the tables were distanced and staff wore masks and gloves. (We were temp checked and required to wear a mask throughout the restaurant, as well.)I can't remember our servers name but I was taken by how genuinely HAPPY AND PLEASANT ALL OF THE STAFF WAS! It was evident that this wasn't an act, and that everyone was simply happy to be back among the NYC dining community. (I even joked with one of the staff members who brought our drinks over, and he was so cheerful and expressed how he was just happy to be back at work!) This sentiment truly resonated throughout the building and created the best environment for our first time eating out in a while! Now, THE FOOD...*wipes drool* I made sure to eat super lightly all day to preserve my appetite, and boy, am I glad that I did! Everything was absolutely delicious. Seriously. I also appreciated that the salad bar/buffet was manned by a staff member who worked around and served us, to avoid tons of ppl reaching over (and possibly cross contaminating) the food during COVID-19! This put my mind more at ease, and this food was equally DELISH!I don't know when, but we'll be returning to Fogo as soon as humanly possible. My boyfriend is absolutely hooked now (after his second Brazilian Steakhouse experience). I am relieved to see that Fogo weathered the [pandemic] storm, with so many other restaurants shuttering, and will absolutely be a customer for a long time to come!THANK YOU FOGO, for such a memorable and incredible experience! :-)

This place never disappoints!!! Like seriously. Stellar service'! If the food was bad it wouldn't matter because the service is unmatched! Anna was sooooooo amazing! She came over to our table and asked we were celebrating which we were! She brought shots!!!!! LikeGirl! Sugar cane tequila!!!!! It hit the spot! Told her we' weren't having dessert and she still surprised meWith a slice of cake with HBD written across. So sweet so memorable. Thank you soooo much for that experience!The meats were delicious!!!! I believe krystal was our server and she was also VERY nice!!!

Came here for Valentine's Day! It was so delicious!  Wine is overpriced! Waiter would take long to come to us. We had to waive just to get some steak. They wouldn't come to us. Other than that everything was good.
Popped in on a whim and glad we did. Rafael's service was impeccable and the food was perfectly delicious! I will be back...

What an amazing experience. My wife and I came here to enjoy some food after a spa day and mannnnn it was everything. The service is wonderful. We've been to a few fogo de chaos and there are none like this one. Way better than the Long Island one. We'll definitely be coming back

Fogo de Chao has been on my radar for quite some time and I finally got the chance to try it. I want to first start by saying that the atmosphere of this restaurant is incredible and has a very elegant feel to it. The service was exceptional as well and they really nailed the AYCE system here with the circle cards (green side for more food, and red side to pause). As soon as the card gets flipped green, meats will be coming to your table every minute or two. They had a good arrangement of meats from beef, lamb, chicken, and pork. Although there were a few good cuts of meat, most of the leaner ones were tough and on the dry side. I also felt that most of the meats were lacking in flavor, mostly just salty. The salad bar was quite nice though and acted as a great palette cleanser after being fatigued from the meats. I loved the assortment of fresh greens and fruit and found myself returning for more pretty often.It was a good experience to try, but at this price point I don't think I'd return for seconds.

We appreciate you giving us a try, Phil, and sharing your honest remarks. We apologize for not completely impressing you, as we always want our guests to receive cuts that meet their satisfaction. We would love another chance to have you in, so please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

I had a wonderful dining experience at Fogo de chao. Service was top notch, the servers and managers were checking on us constantly to Make sure we had clean plates,and brought us our preferred cut of meats . Upon my request,manager Rogerio made a plate of grilled pineapple with caramelized sugar, they were delicious. And the grilled cheese were amazingly good.

Our favorite Brazilian Steakhouse and honestly, such incredible value for money! Hubby and I wanted to do a traditional steakhouse to celebrate Valentines Day the day after but have been ironically let down recently by a couple of supposedly good ones so we thought of just going to our tried and true. This time for Saturday brunch and it turned out to be a really good decision. :)We were immediately seated and given a nice corner table. Italo was our server and he was warm and on point. Knowing how it works, my husband and I went to the salads etc. table in case there's something worth having before we start enjoying the steaks. I ended up enjoying some cured meats, cheese, and smoked salmon. And I discovered something new this time, their bacon. You guys, their brown sugar and black pepper is incredibly yum! Like you will try to keep yourself from coming for more level! I had to restrain myself from having more since I obviously wanted to go for what we came for, the Brazilian steaks! That being said, I've tried almost every cut but I always enjoy the Picanha the most! The filet mignon, bottom sirloin and pork sausage are the other cuts that I can highly recommend.We were also given a few slides: Brazilian cheese bread, mashed potato and fried banana, but I didn't touch any of those carbs. Since we chose to skip alcohol, we tried a diet versión of a Brazilian soda which we actually liked. Overall, we definitely had an excellent time and certainly won't be the last. It's the best place if you want to eat some delicious steaks but pace out how you want to indulge. I actually managed to lose a pound the day after so it's definitely a win-win!P.S It's beside MOMA so for those visiting, you can definitely plan seeing both the museum and having a great meal here!

I did want to give an update on my last review and thank management for getting in touch and resolving the issue. I was able to visit again this past weekend for dinner and had a very positive experience. Food was great and the service was even better. Love the South American cocktails.

The food was amazing!  Unfortunately the service by the waiters for drinks and dessert was subpar. I always had to flag someone down when my wine was empty.  I also left a shopping bag from lululemon on the chair at our table and realized it was missing after they closed.  I came back in the morning to grab it and they said that there was nothing found.  We were one of the last parties that were in the dining room when we left at 11pm so i'm not sure how it could have gone missing.  Really disappointed by this but the food was fantastic.

Although you enjoyed a delicious meal, Aisha, we are disappointed your service was not up to par. Please know your concerns are important to us, so we encourage you to reach out to our team directly. To do so, please send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.

+ Reservations, reservations, reservations. Be sure to make reservations before going as there may be a long wait without one.+ The main dining area is in the basement. If you would like a quiet dining experience with less people, ask to be seated in the second floor. There is also booth seating on the second floor. The downside is that the salad bar and constant foot traffic of servers is in the basement. The elevator is available to pick up food from the salad bar which is a slight inconvenience. Also, the flow of servers with meat seemed to be less on the second floor, but not to the point where we need to search for the servers.+ The alcohol cart that is rolled around and served is not complimentary! The servers will try and entice you to take a drink, but keep in mind, there is a cost. On that note, I totally recommend the pineapple drink that cleanses and flushes the meat, that feels stuck in your chest, down to your stomach.

Over all was a great experience though it should be meant to note that this is my first Brazilian Steakhouse experience.Service and ambiance was phenomenal. Service was gracefully strategic and the food was very good. You can stay for as long as you like, no to go boxes and leftovers seems to be a nonissue. Quality of meat is definitely noted, it was good. The taste however aren't hitting too much into the spot. Taste is good and decent, it is definitely not bad. Though if you pay around $75 for the experience- which means as much meat as you can devour, it is justifiable.The experience include the entire salad bar, all the meat cuts identified on the menu, they are served with plantains, mashed potatoes and polenta.

My friends and I had the Fogo Churrasco experience. It was absolutely an amazing experience. The place was very fancy and elegant and provided delicious meals. Service was well organized. The experience includes Market Table and Brazilian side dishes. From appetizers to desserts, definitely recommended course meals in new york city. Got to celebrate for my birthday here. You should check it out if there's any occasional events going on for your special ones. Thumbs up :)

We had date night here last Saturday, first outdoor dining in a minute for us, and we were excited!
