I took my blanket with me as I didn't want the weather, distracting me from the food, but that wasn't necessary as we had two heaters per table and 2 fresh sealed blankets were handed to us. We decided on the Fogo churrasco experience, and that was a smart and delightful option, it's basically a continuous table side service of signature cuts of fire roasted meat, my favorites were the pork ribs, rib eye and the chicken. Oh my! Quite tasty, needless to say, the hubs and I were STUFFED, but very happy and warm. Rodrigo was our server and he was on top of things.

Took our daughter out to dinner before our concert and we choose this restaurant for she never had Brazilian and We have never been to this restaurant. Everything was absolutely amazing, delicious and fresh. Our server Tania was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. The rest of the staff were great also. My husband and daughter raved about the lamb. Wish there was a closer location to us but next time we are in the city we will definitely be back.

I had the best dining experience here. The atmosphere/decor is classy and not overdone. The COVID precautions were very modern and thorough. My husband made a reservation for us two for dinner. We got the "Fogo experience" where you receive unlimited cuts of meat and the market table. Upon checking-in, they asked for one of us to complete our address and name on an iPad and then proceeded to have our temperature checked by a separate iPad.The cuts of meat were amazing and the customer service was impeccable - staff was super attentive but not annoying. The drinks were strong but delicious - my favorite was the Caramelized Pineapple Old Fashion. The price for the food is pre-fixed at $70 per person, not including drinks or anything else. There doesn't appear to be a dress code as my husband was wearing sneakers and sportswear. You will see a mixed crowd which is nice and unpretentious. Due to our amazing experience, we will be back to this restaurant in the future.

As in my previous review Trey was also an incredible asset to this establishment . The food, wine, atmosphere and waiters as well as waitresses were all amazing , warm and inviting. It does not disappoint.

I am sad I didn't not get any pictures as my phone was left in the car . However, I went here for my father's birthday and might I say it was an AMAZING experience. The service was very amazing. The staff was very friendly. The food was great. The only think is if you are use to seasoning the meat is kind of under seasoned in my opinion. But it was still amazing. The market table was impressive. I willl be returning ! It is $74 a person. There was 6 of us and the bill came to $600 and some changes.

4 stars for the incredible Restaurant Month deal ($39 pp) and those glorious caramelized bacon strips, omg.I managed to book a 6:45pm table for Friday night, the last night of Restaurant WEEK ($42 pp) - this was the original plan until we were told that Restaurant Month is essentially the same, just no dessert, and we could make our decision after our main course. Shoutout to the flexibility! We ended up being way too stuffed for dessert (though we were offered to pack our desserts to go, again very nice of them) which was going to be like a cheese cake or chocolate cake... no thanks. Was happy to cap the night overstuffed from the unlimited meats & salad bar for only $39 (+tax and tip)!I had been to the Philadelphia location once before, about 2 years ago, so I knew what to expect -- a crazy salad bar (Market Table), sides, and nonstop meats. I was SO excited and prepared all day by eating super light. I was ready.My boyfriend kept trying to wean me off of carbs during the meal since he believed our stomachs should've been 99% meats that night, but I just couldn't do it. Those warm cheese breads to start? I had like 3. The rice & beans? So delicious (don't remember having this in Philly). The caramelized bananas? YUM. The Market Table was also amaaaazing - from smoked salmon to green beans to tomato mozzarella to various fruits...  I wish I had more space in my stomach to return, but one plate was more than enough.Now let's talk about that bacon. I'm usually not a huge fan of bacon, but I've heard great things about this brown sugar and black pepper bacon. We each grabbed a couple of slices, returned to our table and took a bite at the exact same time. We just stared into each other's eyes, stunned. This was the best piece of bacon I'd ever had -- perfect mix of sweet + savory; something I could snack on all day. It tasted like jerky but also like kettle corn. Twas spectacular.As for the star of the night, the continuous tableside service of fire-roasted meat... it was lackluster at most, disappointing. Pretty much all of the cuts were way too salty for my palette. Maybe the pork ribs were the only thing that wasn't so bad. Texture + temperature of the (medium) meats were good, just again overly salted. If I had to pay full price for this experience ($68?), definitely would NOT be worth it. Service was nice, accommodating and attentive though. Would only recommend during Restaurant Week / Month.

This is somewhere between a 4 and a 5 for me, but rounded down only because it was a to-go order and steak is best enjoyed right away. I've actually been here before for restaurant week in person and it's phenomenal. Our first restaurant week outing this year was to try the amazing $20.21 deal at Fogo de Chao. I was pleasantly surprised by the portion size. You get your choice of two meats and two sides. Plus they give you two pieces of pao de queijo and sauces to accompany the meats. We chose to try the lamb and top sirloin. The meat itself was delicious- tender, juicy and perfectly seasoned. They wrapped each meat up in foil to keep it warm, which was much appreciated. The steak came with a yummy chimichurri sauce. The lamb came with a mint jelly that I didn't really care for. The meats were sliced, but not all the way through, so it was hard to fully detach the slices with the plastic dinnerware. The pao de queijo was really good, but cold. Had we been able to eat it straight out of the oven, it would have been even better. We got mashed potatoes which were perfection- rich and creamy and topped with scallions for some freshness. Our second side was caesar salad, which was just okay, but you don't come here for the salad. All in all, it was a spectacular deal and a really good meal. If you can, stop by this month to take advantage of the reduced price point at this fantastic steakhouse.

First time, but not the last!What a delight this place is!  We stopped after a visit to the museum and were both pretty hungry.  The ambiance is very high class and chill.  You usually go down a lovely staircase to the main dining area, where you order your drinks, and then begin with the salad bar (depending on what you order).The salad bar offers an array of non-traditional items as well as a nice selection of meats and cheeses.  I went light on this as I was preparing to get some meat in my belly!  Wow, the meat was all well prepared and it just keeps coming til you are done!  I tried it all and ended up with the meat sweats (yay)!For drinks, I had the brazillian bloody mary and it was delicious.  I would also recommend the flan for dessert.  I've had a lot of flan, but none as good as this in both consistency and flavor!I'll definitely be back to this location!

They are COVID ready with outdoor dining and takeout.  We happen to order takeout during restaurant week so we really lucked out. The steaks were cooked just right. Juicy and tender. Bacon wrapped steak was moist. The chicken was tender and nor over cooked. Lamb was tender too. The sides like (the mozzarella,tomatoes and basil), was fresh and tasty.  Asparagus were tender and not over cooked.  The soup was yummy.  The portions we big!  The restaurant was elegance inside. Can't wait to return and sit down!

Where has this restaurant been all my life. The best steakhouse in the State.  The food is so delicious and staff is amazing.   Great place to come for birthdays,Engagements, and any other type of celebration.   The meat is endless and salad bar is full of great treats and things you never would've wanted but of course you add it to your plate and you eat every bite. Food is served to perfection. They have a pineapple mint drink that was so good I had two!  Everything is amazing and worth trying.
Love the place, great sides , and lots of options with steak definitely gonna be a regular

The Long-standing leader in Brazilian style steak mastery the Long Island location did not disappoint. The Picanha was delectably perfect and the Beef Ancho (Ribeye) was amazing! The Frango (roasted chicken) and Costela (beef rib) were indescribably perfect! Also there is a spicy honey drizzled grilled cheese that is desert level quality and a true stand out by way of flavor diversity and new to my Churrasco Experience, though that did not prevent us from wrapping the meal with an amazing Crème Brûlée which did not disappoint either! 5 of 5 stars, thank you Fogo for a wonderful dinner able to be shared with a dear friend!
Amazing! We had the best time. Food was fabulous and the service was EXCELLENT! Highly recommend visiting the 53rd Street location in NY.

Thank you for your high-star recommendation, Nadine! We strive to create the best experiences and your support is greatly appreciated. Please know that we look forward to serving you again in the future!

An almost absolutely exquisite brunch experience. I have heard of Fogo de Chão from a couple of friends of mine who highly recommended it and I can see why. If you are new to Brazilian style steakhouses I suggest coming to this one first for its top notch quality and value.The first thing you got to know about Brazilian steakhouses is that all the food is "shared around." What I mean by this is that, instead of ordering your steak and having your meal served to you, all the waiters walk around with already cooked meat on skewers. You are given a "medallion" (which is really just a coaster) that says the meat you ordered and if you flip it over to green then waiters come over to slice some meat for you. It's a really fun and quick way to get your meal. Instead of waiting for one dish it's already floating around you waiting for the chance to land on your plate! What is also nice about this setup is that you more or less get unlimited meat to eat! When I was here for the brunch buffet I got a few things from the buffet bar, like pineapples and cheese, then I just kept filling my small plate with meat when it emptied. I think the front desk said you can use the "medallion" for up to an hour or something but by the time the hour is up you will probably be bursting with steak. This is quality steak too, especially if you order the Picanha or "prime sirloin." With that in mind I think the brunch buffet here is a really great value for a high end steakhouse.The service when I was here was pretty great as well. I suppose people don't regularly come to steakhouses for a weekday brunch so the place wasn't too packed. I was seated quickly, I got my orders in quickly and all the meat I wanted came pretty quickly too. The waiters and staff seemed in good spirits when I spoke to them and were more then willing to explain the setup since I didn't know at first what I was doing. Kudos to the staff for making this experience even better! There is a reason if you google "Brazilian steakhouse" Fogo de Chão comes up as the second result. It really deserves that spot. The service, the food and the price all make it worth coming. Next time I am here I will be sure to try out there other meats.

I celebrated my baby's baptism at Fogo de Chao and had the most amazing time. The planning process was easy as the restaurant was very responsive. The food was delicious and plentiful. All  of my guest gave rave reviews about the food and the price was right for everything included. What made the day extra special was the service we received. We were attended by mainly Carlos who was very detailed oriented, made sure to meet everyone's request and was so accommodating and attentive that it truly brought the already great experience, over the top. Thank you Carlos and the Fogo de Chao team, my family and I will definitely be back.
Moné's service was amazing. Food was absolutely delicious and my plate was never empty. Great experience.

Meh, the food was hella salty and we just kept getting the same meats, it was circulating through 5 types, we didn't even see the other meats... disappointing experience... and tf? 4.5$ for a can of soda.

Andrew, it's important to us to offer delicious and quality cuts, and we're concerned to read that we let you down. Your complete satisfaction is our goal and we would like to make this right, so we hope you'll consider sending us a note with your contact information and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

I celebrated my birthday last night at this location and I must say they went above and beyond to make my experience very special. Ask for Paulo, he is the absolute best! The staff in general at this location will make you feel like you have to tell a friend about it. More importantly the food is amazingly scrumptious, I'm still drooling over the filet mignon and the lamb chops. You would be cheating yourself if you do anything less than the full churrasco experience. Fogo de Chao is my favorite restaurant in general for great eats, but this location does not disappoint!
Thank you for choosing our restaurant for your birthday celebration! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your experience and we look forward to having you back for your next occasion!

What a mixed bag. The food was delicious but ultimately undone by a friendly waitstaff that seemingly forgot we existed. I understand being short staffed during these times but that didn't appear to be the case as there seemed to be as many waiters as diners. Now, my friend did love the meats and there were plenty of fresh vegetarian options at the salad bar. Although the meats came in quick succession, our waitstaff forgot to visit our table for long stretches and it took ages to order dessert, get another drink, and ask for the check. Also, my favorite item -  the cheese bread - was often delivered cold. Making matters worse was that I had mentioned my friend's birthday when making a reservation. The gentleman on the phone made a note and said that a special dessert would be delivered. I'm neither picky nor demanding, but it did feel odd to await something that just never came. The desserts that we did order were delicious.Staff were friendly and courteous, but the lasting impression is of having felt neglected and unimportant. A shame given the high quality of food and excellent ambiance. I'd definitely return, but not for a special ocassion. At a $100 per head without alcohol, you definitely do expect a more premium experience.

Vinay, thank you for taking a moment to share the details of your experience. We are disappointed to hear this, and we'd like to work towards another chance with you, so if you would be willing, please send your phone number and the best time to reach you in an email to feedback@fogo.com. Kind Regards.

A fun delivery alternative!! To be perfectly honest, I was just craving their pao de queijo (cheese bread/ popover) it's so addictive that - like a pillow with a yummy cheesy center. I felt it was wrong to order bread without steak from a steakhouse- granted this is my favorite steakhouse usuallyThe tabbouleh was fresh, you can tell it was made the same day and quinoa was cooked properly. In terms of the steak- I will be honest- I ordered medium and got medium well... something tells me putting hot /cooked meat in a foil and delivering it will keep it cooking in transit- but it was good, seasoning was lacking though. Mashed potatoes were good though on the heavier side, it was dense, I prob would order something else next time.

The food is the standard Fogo meat feast so that was good.  The only detractor was the service which was mediocre at best and pretty absent at worst.  We literally had to flag down our server to get refills on sides and try to chase down a gaucho to even get meat brought over (yes the cards were on "green").  Part of the issue is that we were seated along on the side on the lower level - but to be honest, that should not have warranted being ignored.  It was pretty busy too on a Saturday but definitely not ideal to sit for over 10 minutes waiting for a server.  The gauchos seemed a bit over-worked to be honest and, like others here mentioned, pretty unhappy.  I would conjecture that under-staffing on a busy weekend is definitely a root cause and recommend that the management look more into this.  I did also notice that there was a very HARD push on upsell - we were pushed to get the Wagyu immediately ("we highly recommend this and just know that this is the only item you can take home") and an entire bottle of Malbec after we were told that they were out of the glass serving.  Without this "strong hint", we would have likely gotten both but the pushiness definitely stopped us from doing so.  A cold, reheated Wagyu should definitely not be the goal and to use the "take home" rationale is pretty off-putting...Some overall tips and highlights:1. While the picanha is the heralded featured cut, I would recommend starting off by asking the servers or gauchos to swing by when they have the costelo (beef ribs) or ancho (rib-eye ready) - I found those to be the most flavorful and juiciest cuts.  Since they don't come in plenty supply, make sure you grab multiple servings when they come by.  Trust me on this.2. The filet is decently tender but not very flavorful - get a serving to try but I left it at that.  Same with the bacon-wrapped variant.3. The parmesan pork loin is definitely worth trying but it is very heavy and filling so save that for the end.4. The lamb steak is another must-try: flavorful, tender, and with the perfect hint of mint.  This is another hard to find cut so let the servers know that you would like it to be brought over as soon as they have the next round.5. All of the sides are good but the pao de quejo is definitely the one to get.  They are light, fluffy, and flavorful - try them paired with the butternut squash soup as a "palette cleanser" between meat courses.  The mashes potatoes are also solid but heavy so save them for the end.6. The candied bacon is very solid - flavorful, crispy, and the perfect blend of sweet, smoky, and savory.  Be sure to grab a few slices!7. The chocolate brigadeiro is basically a version of a chocolate cheesecake mousse - creamy and dense enveloped by a robe of chocolate sauce.  It's big enough to share and definitely worth saving room for.  In fact, all of the desserts looked very solid!

Most of the servers were nice.  The ambiance was beautiful.  I have no problem paying for high quality food .  However this is definitely quantity over quality.  We visited Mother's day and the price was $20 more person than advertised on the menu or the website.  The cuts of meat were fair and not seasoned well. The bar was amazing.  Also,all the other restaurants we visited in NYC served tap  water for starters.  They may offered bottled Easter at $8 per bottle .  Not impressed.

Serving high-quality meals is our commitment, Carla, and we're saddened to receive your feedback. We would like to speak with you personally regarding the details of your visit so if you are willing, please send us an email at feedback@fogo.com and we will be in touch. Thank you.
Excellent experience! They could improve their side choices though. Otherwise, I loved it!

I had a WONDERFUL experience here. I have a handful of food allergies and the staff was extremely sensitive about this. They were even able to provide a full allergen menu for me that showed which of their menu items contained certain allergens. Food was amazing and service was wonderful. Highly recommended.
Yeah I tried again and the quality of the meat has definitely fallen.  It surely doesn't match the rise in cost.  I think I am done with this place...so sad

Tracey, while we appreciate you giving us another try, we truly apologize for falling short of your expectations. If you would like to discuss anything further, please feel free to contact us at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you, and we hope for a future opportunity to earn your trust.

It's a great place for lots of food.  I have eaten in this restaurant many times.  But this time the meat was bland nevertheless good with lots of choices in the salad bar.  The NYC  location is currently $71.95 per person but any other location is $10 cheaper.  But the grand ballroom in nyc is quite nice to see.  And on your birthday they send $25 coupon which helps.

Came here today for restaurant week. The restaurant is huge. Prepare to book a table in advance. I didnt have to wait because my table was booked 3 weeks in advance. Google says the restaurant is closed and reopens at 530pm, but that was false. Got here 15minutes earlier and they gave us our seats right away.We got the restaurant week menu. It doesnt come with all the special cuts. Went to try the food bar first. The smoked salmon and the sugar spicy bacon caught my eyes. They were delicious. The meats start coming every few minutes. I had around 10-15 slices. Some was cooked perfectly, but some was a bit salty. I would give everything a 4/5.Overall very good service. Walking out with a happy and full belly. I would reccomend and come again to try the prime cuts.
The ambiance, customer service, and most importantly, the food was excellent. I plan to go back with my father-in-law.
Jason, we're glad you enjoyed your experience, from the food to the service! We appreciate your review and look forward to your next visit!
Not 5 but 100 stars! Simply the best, enjoyed every minute every dish, great wines, salad bar, the best Brazilian meat

Absolutely jawdroppingly gorgeous venue, truly amazing architecture. We had a table for two for Brunch and were overall vey pleased with service. I ordered the seafood tower and it arrived with the lobster horribly dry. I don't think that's a common order and possibly had either been stored improperly or was just old. The issue was remedied with giving me some more muscles and some shrimp - I wasn't thrilled with the trade off but it is what it is. My husband enjoyed his entire meal and everything he had with the exception of a few pieces of well done meat were gobbled up. For our meals and a glass of wine came to about $180. We left will full bellies and will likely return
Patricia was amazing. And thank you Dillion for singing Happy Birthday to my best friend.

My second time here & I think it's gotten even better. The choices of protein are amazing & staff are friendly as ever. Thank you for a great experience. I recommend to go and try the cheese bread they give out A-1 as well as the roasted chicken.
Service was absolutely wonderful! Sazia and the rest of the team at Fogo took great care of us tonight. Great time celebrating the besties big move out of state!

Brilliant steak house with a very nice twist on the views. The interior is insane it looks unreal how the stairs are and how the wine cellar is above the dining area where you can see inside of it. The food was good they had a great option of meats. The service was great as-well they let my charge my phone when I could not find a charger.
I decided to have dinner great short ribs Tinder and season perfectly great mashed potatoes and broccoli an experience you definitely must try

This review is given in consideration of organizing a small office event at lunch time in midtown east during weekdays. I was organizing a departmental lunch event during pandemic. This is the only restaurant we can find private room given the budget and location. More importantly almost every can find something to eat here. Pescatarian or vegetarian. The event coordinator was very helpful providing information and quick to respond any questions I had. This restaurant became our go-to even after the pandemic when we no longer need to a private room.

Today 07/15/2022, I had the most horrible experience at this particular fogo de chao location and it will forever leave a very bad taste in my mouth!!. This review is based off on the terrible, Rude, customer service I experienced from the so called manager on duty by name "DANTE". Guys! Stay away from this place if this miserable man still works there or be prepared to have your day/night ruined.The night started off good , with myself and a friend. The waiter was friendly and the cashier was also pleasant. We had the "EXPERIENCE".  I had loved the "grilled cheese with honey" and when I requested to have some, the waiter told me it will be coming out in 5 minutes! 5 minutes turned out to be a over 30 minutes wait and mind you this was past 11pm and we were ready to leave. However, the waiter was kind enough to compensate us for the delay by offering us the option to take the grilled cheese "to go" if we want. She had then stepped away for a minute. I then saw another worker and asked the man politely if we could get a to-go pack because we wanted to take the grilled cheese.? The Man was so rude and aggressive explaining to me "how because we ordered the experience meal, NO FOOD IS ALLOWED TO GO"- I TRIED EXPLAINING TO HIM THE SITUATION, about how its a "compensated 'TO GO' after the longg wait, he insisted that it wouldn't be happening! At that point I asked for his name, and to my dismay - he told me rudely that his name is "DANTE, one of the 'MANAGERS', and he went on to say to me- "you free to call whoever or whatever you want to do, but that is the policy and that's it! He took the grilled cheese off the table without even asking if we were finished! I was so disgusted at the so called manager's behavior! How is this man even a  "Manager "??! . He has absolutely No customer Service skills whatsoever ! He was condescending and just all round distasteful! Today will be the last day I ever visit this restaurant!! The company need to do better in hiring people to manage their business!! Customers are the 'heart' of any business and ld hope my review will help someone.

Stara, it's disappointing to hear our New York location did not meet your expectations, as we love welcoming our loyal guests. Our team should always be circulating to ensure our guests always have fresh cuts and refills. Please know your feedback is taken seriously, and we will review this with our team. We ask that you kindly send us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com to speak with you directly. Thank you.

I give this establishment a 9/10. Booked a table for me & 12 guest on. Saturday Night in March of 2022. Food was great. Service was great too. The only thing. On Saturday Nights they need more staff to help out with the drink. The drinks my guest & I ordered took some time before they can be delivered. I visited the Location in Roosevelt Long Island.

Calling all meat lovers- Fogo de Chao is a Brazilian steakhouse with unlimited meat, fruit, and salad options. There is a huge dining room in the ground floor and a bar in the check in area. Our server, Ashley, was not the friendliest nor helpful server but it was a busy night- probably tired. The meats at Fogo de Chao are quality meats but over salted. The wagyu however was perfectly cooked and came to our table on a salt block. The servers for all the meats were professional, took the time to find the right doneness, and came to our table just with eye contact. I would say the buffet is the better option (unless you are pescatarian or have other dietary restrictions) because the buffet station offers additional choices such as fruits, salads, lox, and charcuterie.

I came for my 1st time on a Friday after work. To start when I walked in I loved the decorum of this restaurant.  Very nice. I had a 615pm reservation but arrived at 545pm so I decided to get some happy hour drinks. The cucumber mint smash was amazing. A refreshing cool after work cocktail. The mango Habanero was also Very good.  The bartender was attentive and served me and my guest right away. At 610pm I checked in to get my table and was seated right away. The hostess was pleasant.We get to the table and our server came to us immediately.  I didn't even get a chance to sit down yet. Lol. But I thought that was great service.The salad bar was good. A nice variety of selections and tasty. Now for the meat selection. The bacon wrapped filet was oh so good. The picana was seasoned and tender. The garlic sirloin also very good. The lamb another amazing taste of meat. The pork rib lacked seasoning and flavor but was tender. Never got to try any beef ribs. Was very disappointed. It would have been 5 starts but there was one server who had the filet and picana but he kept passing us by although we had the green side up. We had to stop him every time. Felt intentional but again I did not let it ruin everything else that was good.I will definitely be back.

Fogo is always a good time with a group. There were 8 of us and We tasted everything offered. Service was good and the meats kept coming. Cold bar is always yummy and drinks were good. And the service was good. Looking forward to the next time.

One of my all time favorite restaurants. Decided to hit up this place with some friends after comiccon.Food: I've been to this location exactly 3 times. My first Fugo experience was actually in Brazil. Sometimes the meat is done to perfection and sometimes the meat is a little too rare. The flavor is always on point though.Price: I would round up to maybe $70 per person. Not a bad price for a night out in NYC. I feel it is justified based on the quality of meat.  Service:  Service is a hit and miss. I had on point service from this chain and I've had service where the waitress looked lost. Parking: $$$ cause its NYC. Fun Note: Once upon a time in Brazil, they had told me they only Brazilian natives to work at Fugo. Don't know if this still applies but that was 10+ years ago.

Honestly all you can eat steak? A must try. This place does it in such a way! The seasoning isn't overpowering the meat you're consuming. It compliments so well. There is bacon wrapped chicken and sirloin. They also have a traditional buffet with like fruits and cheeses and salads. The service is always amazing. I've been several times, pre and post covid, same amazing service. My suggestion is to go empty stomach and try as much as you can! Dont over pile the plate because its so much better hot!

Top notch Brazilian steakhouse. The place is refined indoor and outdoor. The food is to die for, off the wall. Rodizio is a must at Brazilian restaurants, the variety available is astonishing. There is so much to choose from, all top quality. You can't keep up with all the choices in front of you. Every single plate I tasted delectable. I'd love to have a second stomach to be able to try all of this amazing food. All meats are cooked to perfection. Smokey flavor on the meats and the salad bar had everything I could think of. Service was incredible, all of our waiters and bus boys were super attentive to all of our needs. Highly recommended. The dessert and drinks are very good too. I went with my family and visitors, we had a blast!
amazing time, love the ambience, more than enough food, great service, lovely hosts and waiters. truly a great experience
Amazing service,  had a great team dinner here with my coworkers . Great people. Good food and wine
Great food and very considerate staff (we had some special accommodations that they helped with). Would definitely recommend!

Great service. Great meal. No rushing or pushing our table. Very refreshing for an AYCE spot. The Parmesan pork and chicken hearts were the standouts, but all the meat was top notch look forward to our next visit.
Amazing service, staff, and food. A 10/10 experience overall. Definitely come hungry because the portions are very generous.
Thanks for your five stars, Zane! We're glad you enjoyed the food and service, and we look forward to having you back!

What an amazing place! My boyfriend and I came here for dinner for my birthday after seeing a matinee. We had a reservation and were seated down stairs right away. The place is huge and has different levels and even a lounge area. We did the salad bar and meat option. The salad bar alone is amazingggg! Since we were starving after the show, we kind of went a little crazy. By the time we were ready for the meats we were slowing down. All different options, cooking styles, etc. Also came with bread and sides. Even though we had no more room, since they knew we came for my birthday they brought out a dessert and sang quickly. I would definitely suggest this restaurant and would come back.
It was amazing and Harold  the manager and all the Staff were great we were a party of 8. We have gone back 2 times since
One of our favorite spots to eat. Food is seasoned well and the service is impeccable. We're always served with genuine care and grace.
We are honored to be one of your favorite restaurants, Tiffani! Thank you for sharing your review and we look forward to having you back soon!
A cool experience. I will definitely go again. The bacon wrapped steak is top tier! Cool staff and nice setting
The rare celebration of meat ever. Don't waste your time with grass (vegetables). Go straight for the green. The endless meat.

A great place to celebrate your birthday or a special day. We tried the full Churrasco Experience and would say that you'd get your money's worth of food (~$70 including tax and a glass of wine). I was pleasantly surprised by the plentiful and various meat cuts they provided. They came around pretty often too! I'd recommend saving your stomach and skipping the chicken cuts. My fave were the sirloins. Overall, the meat quality wasn't something extraordinary but worth trying at least once. The ambiance and service were great. Also got a free birthday dessert which was the perfect way to end the experience!

Went here for a birthday dinner and this was an amazing experience.It's been sometime that I been to a Brazilian steakhouse, but this was the best I been to in NYC. The ambience, salad bar, food, staff, and drinks were all amzing.  I had so much food that tasted so great, that it was hard to remember what stood out as far certain meats and chicken that I had as everything was great. I recommend this place and definitely looking forward to coming back here.

Great service Great food!!! I enjoyed every second of this experience as soon as you flip the paper to green is non stop meat coming your way  go on a empty stomach!! you'll regret it if you don't lol
The service was outstanding, and the food was amazing I would recommend this place. Great atmosphere.

Great service and ambiance. Of course the food was delicious however next time we will be bolder and make sure the variety we get is a little more (the filet mignon and tomahawk didn't come around until much later in the dinner which was disappointing since we were too filled up to get to enjoy them. Everyone is very attentive though and it was nice to be able to go out without the crazy restrictions!
Came over after an early show and had the Pichania salad and the strawberry caipiriña both are very good, highly recommend. Hugo at the bar was great.

Fogo de Chao never disappoints. Originally visited FDC in Texas, had a great time with delicious meat selections. Years later wanted to give it another try for my partners birthday. The food was great, waiter was on point and had a great time.
i come here all the time with my twin! today i came here without him but still had an amazing time. sazia is great, she always comes and greets me and makes sure im enjoying my meal! :)

This restaurant never disappoints me. I've been here several times in the past 5yrs. Celebrated my birthday twice. It's a beautiful restaurant, I always dress up because they have the best areas for photos. The food is delicious, the staff is pleasant. The salad bar is served by staff now due to covid, which I appreciate. See you soon!
Thank you, Gerri! We love to hear this. Thank you for the support - we can't wait to serve you again!
Antonio and Lillian  did an amazing job for our bday party Antonio makes the best drinks we had  a great time we will be back !!!!
Great food and service.  Emily and Raphael always do a great job at the bar downstairs making drinks and service.   Everyone is great.

Sometimes you just want steak. If that's the case Fogo de chao nyc is serving up all the meats. I definitely suggest getting the whole experience. You can start off with the salad bar buffet, and by the time you head back to the table appetizers will be waiting (polenta, plaintains, mashed potatoes, and cheesy bread) For the entree the waitstaff just keeps coming back with different cuts, until you turn your coaster from green to red. We were so busy trying to keep up with the waitstaff we barely kept track of what was on our plate and even forgot to take pictures. We were so stuffed we had to pass on dessert. Make sure you come ready to eat! The experience is $70/pp w/out drinks and dessert.

My dinner guests and I came here to celebrate a wonderful birthday. Beware of the stairs If you are a woman in heels, the floors are super duper slippery. The endless amounts of meat was a carnivores heaven. I really liked the salad bar, it was clean and stayed stocked. There was this drink that I had I cannot seem to remember the name but it had ginger in it lol it was super delicious...I will be returning as soon as the world opens
Food was great and meat cooked well. The service was constant. Large amounts of people there but still good ambiance.

I had a really disappointing experience here earlier this week. I've been before and thought it would be special to bring my partner to celebrate our anniversary. The reservation was in my name, and the hostess only acknowledged by partner. She led us to the dining area, pulled out HIS chair and left me standing. Our server, though pleasant-kept interrupting us and asked what we wanted to eat before we could look at the menu or order a drink. I thought she was trying to "flip the table" but the dining area was packed. We left feeling a bit disregarded and at a loss. I love Fogo, and I know that restaurants are getting their grooves back, but this was disappointing especially since we were hyped up about eating there for two weeks. We'll try again eventually

Topaz, we're troubled by your remarks, as we never want you to feel uncomfortable during your experience. We apologize for missing the mark, and we'd appreciate the chance to invite you back for a better experience, so please email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Warm Regards.

Very disappointed, dined with 2 friends my wife. For basically 100$ a head we would of have expected better. The wait staff was pushy, overly suggesting some of their liquors that were " rare" their suggestions didn't match our flavor profiles of what we were drinking that night, obviously a ploy to up the bill.The food was overly salted and lacked any other flavor. We really wanted to like this place, but we all left with a salt headache and underwhelmed with flavor.

Wonderful, fine-dining experiences that exceed your expectations is our aim, Jonathan, so it's disheartening to learn we missed the mark. We'd appreciate the chance to discuss this visit further, so please send us a note with your contact information and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Best.
My lady and i recently visited the Fogo de Chão in elmhurst and had an Amazing experience.
It's excellent to hear that you both had an amazing experience, Pierre! Thank you for your supportive feedback and please stop by again soon!

Not in the mood for the full experience &/or still covid cautious?  No worries.  Restaurant Week (RW) is back and Fogo has one of the best, if not the best, take-out only RW dinner.  Everything was packaged individually and very well.  We both had the picanha and! fraldinha, hers medium-well, mine medium-rare.  Shared caesar and mixed veggie salads, mashed potatoes and asparagas (only 4 stalks though).  $3.73 tax, 15% tip /$6.30 came out to about $52.  Couldnt finish her fraldinha, so we'll have steak and eggs or a steak sandwich tomorrow.  Get it while it lasts!

My third time eating here and it does Not disappoint. Went here for my mother in law's birthday with my husband. The staff? Is amazing! Very attentive. They are always making sure you are good and your table is well stocked with bread,drinks etc. Joyce our server was great.We couldn't ask for better service. There was a young woman that came to our table in a beige blazer, we didn't quite get her name but she was also great. The food was delicious. Everything from the drinks to the dessert. I recommend you try the Fogo de Chao experience. I also recommend not to eat anything before coming here. You will be stuffed by the time you leave!
Place , food , price is exceptional... highly recommended for those who loves to eat buffet . Salad bar is amazing they have a variety of choices .

Raphael was great. I was not feeling well when I arrived. Had a bit of an upset stomach. Raphaël made some great suggestions of things to eat. They were awesome and perfectly prepared. I left Fogo feeling much better and as if I  had been properly cared for.  Thanks to the chef at Fogo who got the Cordeiro perfect and for Raphaël for being attentive and kind!
Great place for happy hour! Discounted  drinks and appetizers! Emily is my favorite bartender there!
The food is great. And all of the servers and bartenders are very polite and attentive. Come early and sit at the bar for a few drinks, while you wait to be seated! Ask for Emily and/or Rafael!!!

Brought my sister here for what I was planning to be a quick dinner (quiet celebration for her belated birthday). What I didn't expect was that we'd have such a great time and would end up dining in for nearly 3 hours. I've been to other Fogo locations before, and especially as a then-broke college student, I remember how fondly my friends and I would recall our rare but beloved Fogo meals in Boston. This was my first time returning to Fogo as a working adult (business unprofessional), but this experience was truly memorable. I cannot emphasize how fantastic the service was - staff was warm, attentive, and kept the experience light. The food was flavorful and delicious, but for me, what really brought this experience from 4-star to 5 was the service. Thank you Fogo, not only did you unlock old memories tonight, but you were a home for new ones. We will be back!

Very expensive,  but very good. The selection of meat in their rodizio was excellent and the picanha left me drooling! The customer service was superb. My wife and I felt like we were treated like VIPs, which was a great experience.The location is also amazing, right across the street from the MOMA. Try it out if you are looking for a delicious dinner for a special night!
everything is beautiful sazia is fuckin amazing‼‼the food was amazing the service was top notch and sazia made my birthday dinner worth every thing it could be

I visited Fogo de Chão during restaurant week with my brother and some friends. I have eaten at many restaurants that serve rodizio, and Fogo de Chão was way overpriced!The restaurant itself is very nice, but that's to be expected for something that is with restaurant week. The rodizio menu is limited if you get the restaurant week special. You also receive dessert. The limited rodizio selection is about as diverse as the lunch selection at similar rodizio restaurants, but at twice the price.The majority of the meats were cooked to medium, not my preferred medium rare, but they were pretty average compared to other rodizio places. I enjoyed their leg of lamb and top sirloin the most. Service was pretty slow, we often found ourselves simply waiting for people with skewers to show up to the table. I've had better experiences in the Brazilian section of Newark.
such a fucking waste of money experiences to all fit's timer to eat to this place better dine in other place.
Make sure you have time to sit down, relax and digest. Good quality, good service, slightly slow due to amount of the tables, but nothing to be upset about.

I gotta say, I remember when it came out it was great. However, I keep going back expecting that and it's not. First, they always crowd the tables together. I get it gets packed but you can fill in the gaps when you have to. Everyone is ontop of everyone else. The meats they bring are pretty repetitive. I hope you like sirolion because that's 90%. The staff is nice but not attentive. If you go on a busy night hope you got some time. They cleared the table and after 30 min we had to flag the waiter down to order deserts. Which were wrong. Also I a few times the waiter would start talking to me, I'd look at the menu and turn around and they were gone. This place is like an upscale buffet. Just go to platoforma instead. Way better experience there.

George, your feedback is disheartening to read, as we love serving our guests continually delicious meals. We would love the opportunity to make things right and hope you will dine with us again soon. Please reach out to us at feedback@fogo.com with your contact information and availability. Thank you.

Terrible service. Asked for the filet mignon about 7 times. Spoke to the waiter , manager, said it would be out in a minute. 25 minutes goes by and no filet. Absolutely ridiculous to be honest when you're paying $$$. Never coming back

Michael, our team strives to provide prompt service and should always be circulating to ensure you have everything you need. We will be addressing this with our team, and we hope to have another chance to better meet your expectations. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Great food. Good service. Perfect for date night. Indoor seating is nice. I prefer the outdoors as it was a little quieter. But indoor has great ambiance. Perfect for a date night.

Food was good. Service slow. They push the cheaper cuts of meat. Filet and ribeye are hard to get, in addition to pork and beef ribs. The filet was great. The ribeye was VERY disappointing. Beef rib melted in my mouth. We actually felt slighted as to what we were offered. I literally had to flag down a waiter to ask for ribs. Deserts were delicious. After being served dessert, we were ignored until once again having to flag someone down for the bill. Ten minutes later we had to ask where to pay so we could finally get the hell out of there after 3 hours!! I would rather take $200 and buy tomahawk beef steaks and make them on the grill ourselves. Would be better. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!

Your disappointment is not taken lightly, Brenda, as every guest should be able to enjoy their perfectly cooked and seasoned cuts, as well as receive attentive service. We want to discuss your visit offline and invite you back for a better time, so please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Fogo is the definitive Churrascaria experience in the U.S., and while the New York location is not bad, I think the Beverly Hills location is better. Fogo is one of those bucket list restaurants for all carnivores, you need to try it at least once if you like meat. While the variety may be appealing the first few times you do Brazilian BBQ, you'll quickly hone in on a few cuts that you like more than others. You'll also notice that some cuts are way juicier and tender than others. In any case, know that you can ORDER the cut of meat you want and they will bring it to you, instead of waiting for a cut to come around!!!My favorites are lamb chop, beef rib, and picanha, so I just end up eating those 3 cuts. The beef rib is a MUST, but it rarely comes around, so be sure to order it for your table as soon as you get there! It is more tender than texas BBQ style beef ribs, albeit less spicy and salty.

Buckle up we're going to be reading for a while. Following a night at Mastro's, we came here for the first time.  I've always heard so many great things about Fogo De Chao, but this just didn't match up to the things I've heard. We were originally seated downstairs and ultimately started to decide to leave based on the menu. The server approached and we discussed possibilities of leaving due to menu portions and not fully understanding we did have the options for smaller entrees, the server proceeded to pour bottled water, which customers are charged for. We end up reseating and are served food. The steaks were overly salted and dry. We asked for medium well (under advisory that it would be slight pink in the middle) and got well done.  As you can see from the picture, the steak is dry and the edges are extremely dried out as well. One of them is actually somewhat curled up. The waiter we had offered a replacement, which was declined, and ultimately brought out another steak. This was better but it was more medium than medium well. (We did eat this one) The more I ate the mashed potatoes, the more they tasted like Banquet mashed potatoes. The complimentary cheese bread was rather questionable. It was very spongelike and oddly textured. We also had spinach dip which was okay but we were brought a big bowl and less than a handful of bread to scoop it with. The restaurant tried their best to accommodate so there's no issue there but how does a steakhouse mess up the one thing they are known for.... three times in a row? I've had better steaks from Waffle House. Fix. It.
The slowest and worst service I have ever experienced.  Waited 40 minutes for someone to come take the check. Waited over an hour for the first round of drinks, second round never showed up.

Thank you for reviewing our business, Steven. We want your visit to be 5-stars worthy, so we'd love to hear about your experience and what we can do to improve. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Best.

Meattttttt. I've been here three times now in the past three years, and it's been fun and coma-inducing every time. I'd recommend taking advantage of this place during restaurant week. You definitely save a lot and get a lot in return. Atmosphere: large, bars at the top and dining room at the bottom. Reservations recommended.Food: during restaurant week, I think they limit the menu only a little bit so you're not getting filet mignon or prime sirloin. No biggie though, I feel. Let me speak to the wonder that is their salad bar (they call it market table). It's is plentiful, full of fresh fruits and veggies, charcuterie to die for, and things that you wouldn't expect, like smoked salmon. I LOVE their chicken salad, it's like a mixture of chicken and veggies in a light mayo or aioli sauce. They also had this delicious butternut squash salad (i believe that is seasonal cause i didn't see it the last time i came) that had feta in it. I also love their roasted eggplants and asparagus. They also had a yummy yucca soup, and their black beans with bits of steak is tasty.All the rodizio meats are solid. They give you the option of choosing how well you want the steak and they cut the piece for you. And they're really generous with how much they give. I truly enjoy the pork sausage (super juice and flavorful) and the top sirloin (esp medium rare). The lamb is a little too gamey for me. Beef ribs are plentiful and juicy. Also, can't go wrong with bacon wrapped steak. Also, the side dishes. Like, damn. Pao de queijo are these little warm soft cheesy airy bread balls. They are so damn good and fluffy and addicting. The polenta fries are good and crispy. Not too swooned by the garlic mashed potatoes, but only because they're 100% smooth, and I like mine to still have bits of potato in the mix. The caramelized bananas are soft and really, really sweet.Desserts are just okay, but who's coming for that, right? Service: fantastic, you're never wondering where the food is and our waiter was attentive and checked on us often, even asking if we were waiting on specific meats. They also provided a bigger dessert to us during restaurant week since it was my birthday :) Solid place. Fun experience. Just make sure you don't food coma on the way out.
It's always a great time when I come here with my friends! The food and drinks are top notch and Hugo at the bar upstairs makes the most amazing drinks. Will always recommend this place 100%
Súper nice, food was amazing and the people were so accommodating, definitely recommend. Loved it.

Finger licking good!!! This place is perfect for a fun night out in the city and you want to eat some good meats. I love the rodizio here. The service is always amazing here and they stay on top of cleaning your table etc. The salad bar is a must try. The options here are superb and delicious. Try not to stuff your face on the salad bar before the rodizio comes. Be prepared to walk out with a few extra pounds from stuffing the face. The ambience is relaxing and chill. Perfect for date night or group dinners.
Good was great! If I knew there were sides coming I would not have eaten anything from buffet salad bar!

Ugh. For people who doesn't have a great apetite, this place probably won't be the best choices. What very interested me is their steam cauliflower with a little bit beef for offer. But the truth is you can't get any of your company's meats otherwise they would charge you. Well, who would eat those crazy meat within 3 hours of dinner time?Not cost effective for one girl who likes to dine aloneBut if you come with a family, maybe ? ( not really)Meat, is okay. With the price, I just felt like eating all my dimes with little joy. PricyOh I f***ing hate midtown

Tina, this is disappointing to read, as our guest's satisfaction is of the utmost importance. We would like to invite you to reach out to us at info@fogo.com, as we'd appreciate the chance to earn another visit. Within your note, be sure you include your phone number and availability. Warm Regards.
Good place, good food, nice environment. Best Brazilian food. Good drinksTry caipirinhaGreat service, clean space

One of the few Brazillian steak houses in new york. Had to try out the Churascaria experience. It's situated in a large space next to a hotel so you'll have a expansive view of the eating area as it's 2 levels. Service was nice as you brought over the different cuts of meat. A card is provided with a red side and green side. Red means no more meat and green means keep it coming. You start off with a salad bar which has many different items. Standouts were the marinated mushrooms, the papaya and melon, the large fresh wheel of parmesean, the charcuterie of salami and cheeses, and the artichokes. They also give you complimentary cheese bread, fried polenta, and fried bananas. All were deliscious. I loved the 3 items which really make a great pre dinner snack.The meats were plentiful. Chicken thigh and leg, bottom steak, and top steak, sausage, and Brazilian style cut of steak. I particularly liked the bottom steak which had nice char and flavor. They cut it to your liking, a more medium outer cut or a more rare inner cut. The showmanship is great as they cut it right in front of you onto your plate with large knifes. It's definitely a experience. Dessert standouts were the cheesecake which was very smooth. It's a bit pricey at $65 and during restaurant week $45 but i'd definitely bring friends or family here. Reservations are definitely needed.
Easily the worst restaurant in nyc don't eat here u barely get steak and they get you with worst and cheap cuts

We take great pride in the high-quality cuts we serve here at Fogo de Chão, so we are taken aback by your feedback, Ashay. In order to learn how we missed the mark we encourage you to email feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
The meat tasted horrible. Been to both Vegas and Irvine ca restaurants that were delicious. Definitely not worth going to the NYC branch.

It is always our goal to create top-notch dining experiences here, and we are sorry that we fell short, Arian. If you would like to discuss your feedback further, please reach out to us at feedback@fogo.com with your contact information. Thank you.
We enjoyed a fantastic meal and wonderful service by Hanna on our 30th Anniversary! Great food and great service!

MehI found the food to be over-seasoned (actually gave me some major indigestion after the meal) and while I love my meat, it's just hard to justify spending so much on a mediocre meal. For the same cost of the pre-fix at Fogo De Chão I could have had a top notch, equally filling meal elsewhere in NYC. If you're into the chain thing, and also gorging yourself and prioritizing quantity over quality, then you'll love this. I must say, the staff here was excellent. Our servers were lovely and helpful. Only the guy hawking the lamb seemed sad and curt.

How can you say no to all you can eat! We made reservations for 7:45 and it took a little long to be seated. Came here for restaurant week $42 dinner is not a bad deal. My best friend and I came here and let me say all the meat we had was really good. Medium rare is the way to go. Definitely need reservations for this spot or you probably will never be seated for dinner time. Salad bar and steak is buffet style. Dont miss out on desert make sure you got some space for that as well. Highly recommended brazilian steakhouse. It was absolutely delicious and super filling. My friend and I was definitely in a steak coma from eat 2 hours of non stop steak haha. The wait was worth it.

We were a party of six people and sat in the back near the wine inventory. The table was set nicely for us as we had made a reservation for 7pm. We were served by Anderson, a very talent server, who would be attentive to us and another six top near us. We all selected the $64 menu option and the meats were excellent, we were all happy with the experience. Anderson is very knowledgeable in the Fogo de Chao menu and the types of drinks. He offered two drinks to two members of our party and they both enjoyed them. Overall it was a great night and we enjoyed ourselves alot at Fogo de Chao. Will be back for more!

William, thank you for coming online to share your experience! It's great to hear that your server, Anderson, made sure that your group was well taken care of and that you enjoyed everything. We are grateful for your compliments and look forward to having you back!

Brazilian steakhouses have risen in popularity in the last 5 years or so, popping up in malls, suburbs, and of course, big city locations like midtown Manhattan. Fogo de Chao in NYC is in the heart of Manhattan, very close to Rockefeller and many corporate offices. All-you-can-eat meats at a high-quality restaurant is the standard in a hub filled with tourists and high profile professionals.The first Brazilian steakhouse i've ever gone to was in Dallas, Texas, which was actually the first US city to have such a restaurant. I was captivated by the variety of meats offered, and needless to say I was contently stuffed!Since I had gone to a few Brazilian steakhouses before Fogo in NYC, I've had an internal benchmark in my head about my expectations.Overall, this Fogo satisfies me in essentially all ways that all steakhouses of this kind does. However, I have gotten the sense that they do not offer as much of a variety of different steaks and other meats as I remember from other Brazilian steakhouses like Rafain in Dallas, and Texas de Brazil in other locations. This doesn't stop me from loving this place and making it a top choice on my list for places to indulge, but I'd say that I've had better in the past.

I love fogo de chao! I have dined here several times and have definitely taken up the restaurant week offers pre covid. I have always had an amazing meal and look forward to my visits. First off there are unlimited options from the salad bar which is nice to have some lighter options in between your meals. The PÃO DE QUEIJO (soft cheesy bread) melts in your mouth, and the mashed potatoes and bananas are also delicious! The meat options are endless and while some pieces of the cut may vary in term of seasoning, I still enjoy my experience and the food! Not to mention the chocolate cake is heaven!!!

Thank you for this feedback, Christina! We are so grateful to be able to learn from our guests, so we very much appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience. Thanks for choosing Fogo, we  look forward to having you back in!

This was my husband and my first time eating here. Let me say the food was amazing but more importantly the service was phenomenAl. Our server Santa was attentive and kind. Whatever We needed or wanted she was right on top of. We will be coming here and we will also be recommending this restaurant to our friends.

Great spot across from The museum of modern art. Brazilian steakhouse. Nice scenery and bar section. We ordered the sea bass and roasted chicken. Both were very tasty. The staff was also polite as well . No complaints , Fogo got the job done.
Impeccable service, excellent Happy Hour with $4 appetizers and $8 Mixed Drinks. The best option after MOMA

Thanks to Restaurant Week NYC 2021, we were finally able to try this place. The affordable pricing was so tempting. We were like, okay let's take this chance and try new food world (never experienced Brazilian food before). Foods were delicious and, I'd say, classy (even its complementary sauce was made of chopped parsley in olive oil, wow). It's customer service was also superb! So lovely a place. Happy to get to know this restaurant :)  Great grilled foods and cool vibe. * Considering its price of $20.21, the food portion and packaging was very very generous. Hope to come back and try other foods too.
Thank you so much for this fantastic review, Eugene! We are thrilled to hear you had such a great time and enjoyed the cuisine! We hope to serve you again soon!

I absolutely loved it here! I love the concept of all the various meats coming around and being carved in front of you. The appetizer bar is filled with different little plates as well and a huge selection of cheeses and salads. I highly recommend!!
Definitivamente tienes que tener esta experiencia en Fogo de Chao. Todo muy delicioso y el servicio y amabilidad de las personas excelente.

I've been wanting to come to this steakhouse for such a long time and when my husband said that our friends were making plans for a Sunday couples' brunch here, I was ecstatic! I didn't know what to expect. I wasn't sure if we were going to get the full churrascaria 'meat parade' experience but it didn't matter.When we arrived, everyone was at the bar waiting for us. We were late because parking was a nightmare (see note). We all ordered a cocktail and waited to be seated. I started off with one of their grapefruit gin drinks which I found to be a bit too sweet but I'm sure the bartender could adjust it to your liking. She seemed more than capable and was very knowledgeable about their various available spirits.The place is grand with three floors. There is outdoor seating, coat check and a bar on the main, a dining area below and I believe a second one above. They also have restrooms on each floor. The hostess' were super accommodating. They saw that two of us couples had strollers and small children and asked us if we would prefer a larger table to accommodate the strollers, providing us with enough space where we didn't have to check the strollers and they set up highchairs for us. It's a plus that they have an elevator to the dining area which makes life so much easier. When our table was ready, we were escorted down to be seated and our server immediately approached, took our drink orders and welcomed us to enjoy the salad bar. I really wish I remembered his name because he was soooo helpful during our dining experience. Since we were here for brunch, they also had a waffle and omelet station in addition to the salad bar. There were plenty of greens, rice, beans, cheeses, charcuterie, salads and a soup special on display for our gluttony. I even asked for some chimichurri which I kept plateside, along with some of their pickled onions. We also received the signature mashed potatoes, candied bananas, yuca frites and pao de quiejo (cheese bread), which I love. The meat that we did get to try was amazing. When they finally did come around, I was able to sample their bottom sirloin, filet mignon, lamb, picanha and chicken. I usually find the chicken to be overdone and dried to death two times over but theirs was juicy and thoroughly enjoyable. Since we were a large group at a rectangular table, many of the gouchos seemed to only really go to the end diners and they wouldn't come to the rest of us so we were missing out on cuts of meat as they were flying by. I didn't even know they had lamb chops until someone on the end mentioned it and then I had to personally request that some be brought to me. I know there were at least three or four cuts of meat we didn't even get a chance to try because the gouchos either only went to the two diners on the end or cometely passed our table. I'm not sure if it was because we had the two kids or if it was just that there were so many of us that they didn't even want to bother. Either way it was a bit frustrating because we're paying the same as every other diner in the place, so I expect to receive the same experience. I will say that in my opinion, the best cut of meat is their filet mignon which I normally never order because of its lack of fat but in the case of Fogo, theirs was like butter. It was exceptionally good.I must mention that Jessica (manager?) was so sweet to all of us and very attentive to our needs. She came by often to check in on us, she escorted us up and down the elevator and she got me my lamb chops. Her demeanor, alone, made up for missing out on all the meats. Even our server went above and beyond the call of duty when my beautiful daughter spilled my soup all over the both of us (luckily only my kimono was sauced). It landed in my lap while I was holding her and he was very helpful in assisting me with tons upon tons of napkins and a paper bag for my soupy kimono. He didn't miss a beat and he kept asking if there was anything he could do. I could see on his face that he felt my pain and he was trying to do all he could to help make this little snag remain nothing more than that.I definitely want to come back here but we might have to leave the baby with my parents so we can enjoy the full dining experience without leaving the restaurant wearing any of our meal. Also, I think I'll be asking about the meats they offer before we even order our drinks so that I can request the specific cuts I would like to try. NOTE (as of 8/04/19): Even on a Sunday parking right now in the area is atrocious. There are many restrictions due to construction so make sure you read the signage because the construction signs supercede the regular daily signage and we narrowly missed getting what was sure to be a hefty ticket.

First time at the restaurant and met Elsa our server. She was an absolute delight. Great energy. Very helpful. The service was phenomenal. Extremely pleased with the experience. Definitely will be back and recommend coming here. As for Elsa to be your server. You will not be disappointed.
The service and food are amazing! Such great cuts of meat and the servers are all helpful and sweet.
We are known for the delicious cuts of meat that we serve and are so happy to hear that you enjoyed everything, David! Thank you for sharing and please visit again!

We had an amazing experience at the brazilian steakhouse in Beverly Hills on La Cienega Blvd.  Our server, Elton and his manager made our dinner extra special. We felt a great vibe from them as they were upbeat and happy to serve our table at the highest level. It makes all the difference when you feel welcome at a restaurant and they made sure we got immediate attention on our orders. Thank you for a great time, our family really appreciated you. We will certainly be back soon to enjoy the fresh and high quality delicious food and great service.

I've been to Brazilian Steakhouses many times in the past so I knew what to expect at Fogo de Chao.  I've heard that the restaurant is pretty pricey so I was glad to take advantage of the Restaurant Week pricing.  I have to say, the place is HUGE with seating on three levels (the main level is a bar/seating area and I'm not so sure that the meats come to that level).  The decor is very nice and the music was fantastic - not too loud that you had to scream in order to have a conversation, but loud enough that you could enjoy it.  They have a pretty good selection at the salad bar, although I didn't try too many items in order to save my appetite for the stars of the meal.....the meats!As I said earlier I've been to Brazilian steakhouses many times I was anticipating the meat to be tender and well seasoned.  I have to admit that the cuts weren't what I was expecting (top and bottom sirloin, leg of lamb, chicken) I'm used to cuts like lamb chops, rib eye, etc so I was a little disappointed.  Also, none of the meat had the seasoning that I am accustomed to as well.  Most of what we ate was just ok - nothing special.  For sides we had an order of mashed potatoes and sweet plantain (not with the cinnamon sugar that I'm accustomed to).  For dessert I had the cheesecake, again, just ok.I do have to give a shout out to the service - although we never knew exactly who our actual waiter was because whichever waiter was in the area serviced us, I will say they were attentive and very pleasant.I'm wondering if the types of meat offered changes when it isn't restaurant week, although with the prices they charge I'm not so sure I want to risk coming back.

Definitely only visit if you're ready to spend some coins. Access to a salad and cheese bar 6 shrimps, and a cocktail nearly costs $100. But the vibes are immaculate and the staff is so attentive and amazing

While we're glad to know our team delivered attentive service, Thomas, we're sorry for falling short of your satisfaction. We hope you take a moment to send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com, so we can work towards earning your support. Thank you.
Andrea provided amazing service. Took my friend here for his first time and he had a wonderful meal. He tried everything and left incredibly satisfied
Fantastic meat, a great atmosphere, and terrific service, I had a great dinner here, and would highly recommend going.

While enjoying our meal, I was worried my girlfriend would notice the seductive look I gave the waiters when they brought over the lamb... And who could blame me! As always, Fogo was an amazing and memorable dining experience. A reservation is definitely a must. The service was impeccable and I never looked at an empty glass of water. The MVP of the meal was certainly the lamb (ask for a side  of mint jelly!!) and the bacon featured at the market table was TO DIE FOR. Make sure to pace yourself throughout at least 2 hours to fully enjoy (and digest) all that Fogo has to offer.Fogo De Chao is well worth the price and should be on almost every foodie's bucket list!

Came here for a lunch buffet. No wait since we made a reservation but during weekday lunch, it's quite busy.Food:1. Sides:The complimentary sides are cheese bread (omg they are so delicious), mashed potatoes, caramelized banana and a fried cheese stick (not sure if it's cheese inside but it did taste like it)2. Buffet bar selection:There are all kinds of salad, fruits, vegetables, bacon, rice & toppings, and soup of the day. I'm very satisfied with the fruit selection: other than the basic fruits they also have dragon fruit as well as papaya.3. Meat There are many types of meat. The way it works is that you can flip the card to the green side, and the server with the meat will come and ask if you like it. The server also asked us what type of meat we were waiting for since we've been waiting for the lamb chops for a long time. And the server came directly to us once the chops were ready.Service:Great service in general. It's around $55/person include tax & tips. Advice: If you don't have a big appetite and still want to enjoy the buffet and eat many types of meat, I suggest getting different selections of the meat at once and then take a break (by flipping the card to the red side). Once you finish 1 round, it's likely that new selections of meat will be served.

For NYC Restaurant Week, this is an incredible deal. You get unlimited meat/trips to the salad bar/side dishes (cheese bread, fried polenta, mashed potatoes, caramelized bananas). First off, I love the decor of this restaurant. It's multi-level, and super spacious. Dining takes place on the lower level, and you get to walk down a set of stairs into the center of the room (what an entrance). However, if you need an elevator, don't worry -- they have one! The salad bar/feijoada is incredible expansive (all types of fruit -- even dragon fruit, cheese, charcuterie, rice, soup, delicious brown sugar bacon, salmon, etc.).  Also, I love that they use little cardboard coasters to indicate whether you want meat or not. Once you flip it over to yes, they start coming pretty quickly! And I love that you can pick whether you want it rare, medium, well-done. The cheese bread and mashed potatoes were also delicious. At the end, each person was also able to select a dessert (NY cheesecake, key lime, or chocolate mousse). All in all, great value & fun dining experience.

I want to go back at least once a month! I really didn't know what to expect but Michelle and her staff easily surpassed whatever I thought I was thinking.  Definitely going back!! Thank you Michelle!!!!P.S. That cheese bread and the fried cheese with honey!!! OMG!!

Fabulous restaurant! Went there last week for a birthday celebration! I had the full churrasco experience. The meat was fabulous! My friend had the salad bar & soup. I recommend this restaurant highly!

Incredibly impressed! A ridiculously low price for a staggering selection of food. I am Norwegian and accustomed to buffets. Thus this is indeed a BRAZILIAN SMØRGÅSBORD with gorgeous items. An absolute MUST...& if/when entertaining guests, you will not be depleting your bank account. Highly recommended!

The service was very attentive, bringing around different cuts of meat. We could order specific meat dishes.There were also plenty of non-beef options from lamb, pork, chicken, bacon, salmon. There were also many vegetarian options from cheeses, fruit, salads, soup, etc.The only bad thing was that it took forever to get the check. I guess that's the downside to having 50 waiters that just float from table to table instead of being assigned to a specific table as per usual. It's definitely an interesting setup and operation rather than the traditional steak dinner where you order and enjoy one cut of meat--here you get to try several different cuts, meats and you can also order what isn't brought around (such as chicken hearts).The decor, atmosphere and orderliness were excellent.

The main complaint here is that sometimes the meat comes out way too salty especially the lamb cuts. However, the Gauchos did accommodate our no salt requests. Ask for your meats to be cooked with no salt and season on your own. With the Coronavirus, you have your choice of dining in the front of the building or socially distanced indoor seating. The salad bar is closed and each table seems to be sprayed with disinfectant. Servers wear masks.Service is still amazing. Our water was continuously refilled and our server always checked in to see how we were doing. To make up for the salad bar being closed, each table gets a free charcuterie platter upon being seated. Gauchos also come around with salad bar items including salmon and asparagus.

Review for lunch visit December 24, 2019.I went here after seeing the 11:00am performance of A Christmas Spectacular featuring the Radio City Rockettes. It was just a short walk from Radio City Music Hall to 53rd Street.  Earlier in the morning I made a reservation on their website for 1:00pm (confirmed by email).The storefront was great - as you can see by the picture it really makes an impact. We arrived at 12:45pm and they took us (my wife and I) immediately. We availed ourselves of the free coat check. The experience is downstairs (pictured from the top of the staircase). Looking down makes an immediate and grand impression! Loved it. We were seated against wall at a table for two. Everyone was friendly and greeted us with enthusiasm. Just like other Brazilian steakhouses, there is a general overseer, the servers and the gauchos (the people that bring the meat).They explained the coasters at the table (flipping to green means to bring more meat and flipping to red means stop). We were offered bottled water, sparkling or tap - stuck with tap water and a couple diet cokes. The server also advised that if we didn't want meat, there were different fish selections we could just ask for off the menu.We then proceeded to the buffet area. Wow! This was the most extensive selection I have ever seen at a Brazilian restaurant (pictured). There was a variety of cheeses, deli meats including prosciutto and Genoa. At least 4 kinds of cheeses including blue cheese and Parmesan. We noticed a huge board of smoked salmon and capers; there were pickled onions and cornichons on the side as accompaniments. Beautiful!For those inclined, there were roasted peppers, roasted garlic and roasted asparagus. A variety of salads and fruits like kiwi, pineapple and melon. Beside the buffet in chafing dishes (near the wall) was rice, sweet potato and some kind of what looked like Brazilian pork stew.We returned to our table and continued to dine. The gauchos came by with meats like: top sirloin, bottom sirloin, lamb, pork, pork sausage, chicken leg and garlic steak. I thought the selection was typical.  The taste was good overall. Just a note: when we returned to the table, the server brought little breads, mashed potatoes, fried bananas, polenta and mashed potatoes - without asking. We avoid carbs so we did not eat any of this. Might be considered wasteful, so if you know this in advance I would tell the server so they don't waste the food or their time.I used the men's bathroom before I left. One stall and one urinal. It was clean with two sinks. I'd definitely return. Keep up the good work!

Oh my yum! I had no idea such deliciousness could exist in buffet style.When you step into Fogo, the high ceilings, beautiful wooden interiors and classy decor already tell you that you've chosen your dining experience correctly today. For ~$40 at lunch, the meats just keep coming - you're left struggling between eating more of one dish because it's so good or saving room to try them all. Some meats I preferred over others, but so many have passed through my plate that I can't clearly recall which was which.I would highly recommend getting the full experience option to, well, get the full experience at Fogo de Chão
