Came here for HH and Hugo just made me feel like I was in Brazil. His Caipirinhas were amaaaazing!! Me and my date came for just one drink and we ended up having a few lol The food was great as well!! Will definitely came back! Many many times

First time at a Brazilian steakhouse and the food did not disappoint! Definitely save your appetite for this place. The service on the other hand was not as good as expected. We had 7pm reservations and waited 20 min to be seated while walk ins who arrived after us (a party of 2) were being seated first. The host who sends you down to the stairs was also very rude not sure what her deal was that night. We had to repeatedly ask for beer refills from our server who ended up forgetting so we asked another server. The 2 ended up bickering in front of us which seemed unexpected given how fancy this place was. I would for sure go back again when visiting NY, I can deal with a few rude people to end up with some delicious food.

I always have a good experience here. The salad bar is amazing and the staff are always super friendly and accommodating. I recommend this location over the long island location. They have happy hour even on weekends, but lunch closes at 3 pm on weekdays and 2 pm on weekends!
We're happy to hear that you always have a good experience at Fogo! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and we look forward to your next visit!

Let me start off by saying it was by far the best restaurant ive been to since covid hit. Ive read a lot of iffy reviews from yelp and put off coming here but let me tell you i was blown away. I went for my friends birthday and we all got the churrasco option which included an amazing salad bar option. From cheese, cold meats to variety of salads and pickled vegetables- everything tasted above average. Most of the meats were delicious and not salty(hard to find in American restaurants). Plus, all of the workers were super friendly and accommodating especially JEFF!!! I don't think i've encountered such great service in any other restaurants. I can't say enough how my friends and I praised the wonderful food and service affected our dining experience. I would 100% go back to this location very soon.

Update - the manager personally reached out to hear about my dining experience. I shared that my party's expectations were quite high given the great experience we previously had in another location (PA) and how it fell short compared to that. That food and gauchos were great, but how other areas of operations and service had a room for improvement. He took time and listened, which I really appreciated.

Everything about your Fogo de Chão experience should be spectacular, so it's disappointing to hear we fell short, Sunyoung. We'd love to address this offline, so when you have a moment, email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Best.

We had a reservation for 12pm on a Saturday. Half of the party came on time, the other half a little late due to parking issue; we were not seated until half an hour later. The space is beautiful when looking down from the lobby, but the tables are put together so closely, it feels extremely crowded when dining. Their meat offerings were descent and all the gauchos were friendly. Servers were hard to get ahold of, whether to put in an order or to ask for a bill, etc.They checked our vaccination cards upon entering, but masks are not enforced in the waiting area nor at the salad bar. Almost none of the staff wore masks.

EDIT:I'm providing an edit to my original review which can be found below.  I was contacted by the general manager of this Fogo de Chao location and was able to discuss with him directly my concerns and my last visit.  He promised to make my next visit better and seemed genuinely interested in my feedback.  I was able to return to Fogo de Chao and received MUCH BETTER service, with a wider selection of meats being offered.  The second visit was definitely much better than my first and I truly thank the general manager for discussing my concerns with me!

Hello Ahmad.Thank you for letting us know about your dining experience.   We apologize that your meal was less than you expected.Please send us your contact information via private message so a member of our NY team can reach out to you directly.Regards,Mary DensonFogo Guest Relations

I've visited Fogo de Chao in multiple different states now, with this one being the original location that I visited.  The experiences and service are all pretty similar.  If you're not familiar by now, you're provided with a card (more of a coaster), with the color green on one side and red on the other.  If you want more meat servings, you place your card with the green side facing up.  If you're full/satisfied, you place the card with the red side facing up.The full meat selection and salad buffet are included in the price of your meal, at a range of $64.While the concept is newer, this specific Fogo de Chao has fallen off.  Unfortunately, they tend to prioritize the lesser quality meats and avoid bringing the more expensive ones to your table.Multiple requests for specific cuts went ignored for some time until the end, when we really couldn't eat any further.If you've never been to Fogo de Chao, I would recommend you go at least once for the experience.  But it has fallen off a bit.

I have only done takeout orders from there so far, and OMG everything is so delicious!  They specialize in fire-roasted meats and all of the ones I have tried so far were incredibly delicious, as were the sides (e.g., mashed potatoes, polenta, Caesar salad and others).

Snarky hostess that states they don't allow walk ins. Perhaps that's the case but seems strange sincr the restaurant was half empty. Restaurant is in the basement. Quality of the food is good but an expensive night out.

Came here for weekend brunch and had a 5 star experience! The place itself is huge, beautifully decorated with these orange ceiling lights. The tables are classic old school steakhouse, elegant white table clothes etc.  Room itself is dim, giving you enough privacy to pig out. We started with the cheese breads - I had these when I visited Brazil years ago and they were literally amazing. Soft and fought with chewy cheese on the inside. With weekend brunch you get access to the full churrasco experience, sides and market table for ~$50 per person, which I thought was a great deal compared to dinner ($80?). Not sure if the meats/market table options were different though. There are also entrees a la carte. I had the passion fruit mimosa, which was sweet and refreshing, and my bf got the Bloody Mary which was quite tasty as well. Highly recommend the black pepper candied bacon from the market table, literally insane, super crispy crunchy and delicious. The mashed potatoes were also pretty good, smooth and creamy. Other sides were good as well, good salad option. Only regret was the cake went away at 2pm which we didn't know about until after. Then began the churrasco experience. I thought they had a really smart system- they give you one red sign and one green sign, green signals the servers to bring you more meat and red means stop. We were unfortunately seated in this back corner, which felt mia, but we still got our serving of meats. The house special beef was melt in your mouth, my bf described it as "beef bacon". Get it medium rare, sooo tender and juicy. All the other cuts were pretty good as well, although the garlic steak was a little overwhelming. Chicken and pork were good but I would probably stick with beef. I didn't see any lamb and when I mentioned it to our server, she was nice enough to have it brought over. At the end, they surprised us with this giant plate of dessert for our anniversary: molten lava cake, ice cream and whipped cream. Definitely recommend coming here if you haven't already!

In addition to the meat, they have a very nice buffet style salad/charcuterie bar with a large and tasty variety of things to choose from. They offer a couple tasty and well priced Happy Hours drinks as well. My disappointment is with the meat in that most of it was over cooked for my taste, although I suspect that's because the average person coming here likes their meat cooked more heavily than I do. Still we had a nice time and found plenty of tasty things to enjoy here.

To be honest, I'm not sure what happened.Went for my birthday dinner as I used to (whether it is here or king of Prussia), and I hate to say it, but the experience was kind of lacking. Made a reservation, and got terrible seating in between people. What's annoying about being in between people? You will be skipped. Despite the two of us having our cards face up we were skipped, and by the time we were remembered, it was the very last pieces of whatever was left (which means no temperature preference) and they just.. weren't that good. The char was there, the salt was there, but it seemed like we kept getting these super fatty pieces and they just were not very good at all. It's hard to say for one of my favorite spots, I even kept telling my wife she was exaggerating, "it's the same", but honestly it was a bit off. That, the rice was under-cooked, the beans were flavorless, and where was the bacon? For the first time, the market bar was my friend because it made up for the lack of flavor in most of the meats.Somewhere towards the end we were asked if there was something we were looking for, because the same pieces kept coming and it was the end. We asked for Picanha when it comes out. We did get the picanha, and this was still my favorite, but by the time I finally got a piece of rib eye, it was so bad I had to say we were done. The pork ribs, and the last bottom sirloin I got, which again was the last of what was available, wasn't edible.At the end of the night, we did get a dessert, and the creme brulee was done masterfully. The top was light, crisp, perfect.Again, I honestly don't know what happened, I don't know why anything changed, but it's looking like I will have to try another spot to get my cultural fix.

There is no way to give this less than 5 stars, NO WAY.From the moment we walked in the hostess is courteous , patient, and got us to our seats right away.Despite having an idea of how it works, our main waiter informed us on every aspect of how this experience. We were encouraged to start with the market bar, but not to fill up at all, because they will keep the meat coming. The bar was fit with olives, delicious mozzarella, cesar sald, bread, peppers, potato salad, salami, proscuitto, and so much more! The one item that sounded better than it was was the candied bacon, don't worry about that as there's plenty pork to go around. There is also rice and beans at the market table as well. We started with salad, peppers, salami, etc, as they would compliment the meats chosen.We tried every single one. Or at least I did, my woman got filled up and I had to encourage her to fight the good fight. Every piece, succulent, juicy, so much flavor especially in the parmesan pork and garlic steak. I could give you a long description of how amazing each individual cut was, but I'll get right into the ones that were so good I had to have more than one: parmesan pork, house sirloin, and the strip was the very best medium rare.I want to add this note, I have NEVER eaten medium rare before, and trying it opened up a whole new world for me. If you are used to well done, medium, etc, I strongly encourage you to try a slice of medium rare, you won't regret it, I promise.The only pieces I had any issue with is the lamb was a little tough, and I was given well.done filet that wasn't right. Honestly it was barely a bother considering they typically ask which temp you'd like first.This was a real experience for us both and while we do look forward to returning, we are excited to try the one in Puerto Rico on our next trip.Thank you for this experience, wow.

Made reservations here for anniversary and it was an overall good experience. There were a bunch of ayce appetizers including the cheese bread which is my favorite but try to eat them in moderation because it can fill you up fast. We did go around dinner time so it was busy and our original waitress  forgot waters we asked for but they were super kind and offered both me and my bf a free drink on the house. I don't remember the name of our waiter but he provided us great service. Also, we had a glass of champagne (not sure the name) but it was so good as well as the strawberry hibiscus caipirinha cocktail. Overall, it was a great experience and I would go back.

I'm in love with this place! All-you-can-eat steakhouse? Sign me up! Just thinking about the waiters slicing off tender, succulent pieces of beef onto the plate makes my mouth water. They have so many different cuts, from top sirloin to filet mignon to filet wrapped in bacon. There's also a couple types of lamb. Wouldn't recommend getting any of the chicken or pork (even if they are delicious), because you're there to eat beef!! You can ask for some accompanying sauce as well. Both the green (chimichurri) and red sauce are amazing. It's always a shame when you first sit down and they bring the warm, cheesy bread because it's so tempting but you don't want to eat too many pieces and get full on that. 1 or 2 at most. The garlic mashed potatoes side is also irresistible. Then head over to the market table, which has a nice diversity of items for accompaniment. Roasted vegetables, chickpeas, cheese, fruit to eat after the main course.Dinner price is $66.95 per person which is on the pricier side. I've never been there for the $42.95 lunch before but would definitely try to go at some point

Tried this place for restaurant week. I've been to different Brazilian Steakhouses but definitely hands down on this one. Fast pace but never rushed if you only flip to the no sign. Their salad bar quality was incredible. So many varieties, very fresh!!! We would love to go back!!

Amazing churrasco experience. My only issue is that the meat doesn't really come around consistently/enough. There were times where we had our green cards up and no one came for 5 minutes or so, and then everyone came all at once in a span of two minutes. Better pacing would have been nice but overall, loved this location.

I got invited with my yelp friends for restaurant week dinner in this place. The whole amount we paid was $60 + including tip & a 1 pitcher of sangria shared for 4 people. Great deal! We had a reservation for 8:30pm & got seated on time. The restaurant is really big & clean. The waiters are nice & friendly. I'm impressed with their salad bar. Lots of delicious choices. They have sweet crispy bacon for your salad, cheese, fruits & a lot more. If you're not careful you'll be full just by their salad bar alone but better watch out because lots of yummy meat coming. For the pitcher of sangria, I don't really drink & don't enjoy the strong alcohol taste but this sangria is fruity & sweet so I like it. Good pair for churrascaria (bbq). On the table they gave cheese bread & fried banana. It taste good. They also used a circle flip go signal if you want more meat then you turn it into green & red for stop giving me meat. Haha! From the sirloin, bacon wrap chicken, bacon wrap steak, marinated chicken & many more its all delicious. All cooked perfectly base on your preference. They also ask what type of meat do you want, medium or medium well but I myself like medium.If you're a meat lover then this is the place for you. I highly recommend going here with an empty stomach. Don't eat for the whole day so you'll enjoy everything. Haha! I had a great time & food was delicious!
Good quality meats for the Rodizio, happy hour specials are great! The picanha burger for $8 is a steal for nyc!

Amazing service, Muhammad was so attentive and friendly. Was so quick on everything and friendly. Great atmosphere, was busy but the noise level wasn't bad at all. Amazing food all around! One of the better fogos I've been too !

I would never come back to this place! We made a reservation at 7:15 pm in a Thursday but we got a table at 8:00pm! The place was extremely busy and loud and front desk employees wouldn't give us any time estimate on how long it would take for the table to be ready! Awful experience.

We apologize for the wait, Sina, as your time and satisfaction really are important to us. We hope for a chance to make this right and deliver you the amazing experience you deserve. Please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Went here for a conference dinner . So it was all inclusive and paid for . So there should be zero reasons for me to give this 3 stars and I really don't want to ! Because this place was great! Except this ONE SERVER he was HORRIBLE  . Not sure if he was racist sexist or just a douche of a persons! I'm a small person and I know that sometimes people don't take me seriously for that reason but he kept ignoring me! Even when I straight up asked him for something!! So RUDE!! Never have I ever. I wish I got his name so I could reach out to management! Like why would you treat your customers that way! Or anyone for that matter  ! I don't get it ! The salad bar and meats were amazing! So was the wine! And even dessert . The place is really nice! Really wish this one server wasn't so awful! Really takes away from the experience

This is one of my favorite Happy Hour places in NYC! Very affordable with $6 wines and $4 Beers and $8 Cocktails and I love there Chicken Sliders for less then $5! Amazing And they have downstairs its way more pricey but it's all you can eat. They have the salad bar as well but one of your guest have to get the main dinner. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who's nearby.

Great food, bad service. I came here with a party of 6 last night Upon arrival, they could not find my reservation. When they finally found it I was told to have a seat and wait. 15 mins later we finally got a table. We were seated on the upper level and we're told the elevator was broken but "it's good exercise" to go up and down to the salad barThe meat cutters were not friendly. Seemed unhappy to be there and had a bit of an attitude. The server removed our plates without asking if we were finished. W

Michael, we're sorry to hear our service was lacking, as you deserve marvelous experiences all around. We'd hate for you to stay away, so please allow us the chance to invite you back. Kindly email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Best.

The word "churrascaria" really rolls off the tongue. Unfortunately, so does some of the meats served during restaurant week. It's roughly $15 cheaper than regular fare, minus the higher quality meat cuts. Hardly worth it, except for the complimentary dessert and the fact that I can say I've finally eaten at a Brazilian steakhouse.Despite my better instincts, I sampled the chicken and pork, both of which were husks of rather bland meats. Lamb was well marinated, although it didn't have that charred taste I look for in most lamb dishes. I believe the only steak cut I enjoyed was the sirloin. It sported a fair amount of gristle and lathered in garlic butter. Ugh, that was good. All the other cow parts seem lacking in moisture or heavily covered in salt. Not entirely a bad thing... just had higher expectations. There weren't any distinct flavors, so it's hard to give any reason why this steakhouse stands out. I didn't even touch the drink menu. For $18 a glass, I'd rather be caught passed out in an alleyway with a bottle.The dessert is obligatory if you want to make the Restaurant Deal worth it because I'd rather pay the $15 more to have an unlimited amount of the higher cuts. Their options were chocolate mousse, keylime, and cheesecake. It's all very standard.
Nothing to say but absolutely delicious! My family and I were delighted with the food and can't wait to return!

I really like Brazilian steakhouses and Fogo de Chao is one of the originals in the States at least.  The meat selection is great and very well seasoned and grilled.  The salad bar is excellent as well.

I've never dined at an "Authentic Brazilian Barbecue" venue before so this place was a sure eye-opener. We made a reservation for a party of 3 for a Thursday evening. We were quickly seated and our waiter explained how the ordering process works. The meat was never ending, and you had your choice of different kinds and cuts of meat. They ranged from lamb chops to fillet mignons and smoked sausages. The meats were literally cut right in front of you to the doneness  of your choice. I had a majority of my steaks medium rare- medium. Just the way I like it. There was also an open salad bar that consisted of cooked rice, different cheeses and deli meats...which I later took advantage of. The starters here weren't bad either. Definitely try the garlic mashed potatoes, polenta and cheese bread. We settled for dessert at the end of our meal. Dessert was a great way to end a big meal. My only complaint was that the slices of cake were paper thin.

Went there with some friends for RW; I'm currently pescetarian, so I didn't participate, but they seemed to enjoy the food. The service was "okay" at best; they messed up my drink order twice and still charged me. They also sat us in a very cramped corner, and refused to move us. I also waited a really long time for my seafood dish.I ordered the mango sea bass; sea bass is great because of how buttery it is, but the mango sauce was kind of overpowering. Not really the best taste combination.I probably wouldn't go again. Ever.

- overall rating: 3.5- no wait with reservation - came with a large (20+) group, staff was a little slow with the drinks but for the size of the group, they managed themselves well- there was a bit of a dispute with the bill (a few paid early had to catch a flight and the staff argued with us about whether they paid their portion of the bill, but ultimately was resolved)- wish they had seasoned their meat a bit more, was mostly bland, and some pieces were chewier than I had anticipated- I find the food at Churrascaria Plataforma better, but Fogo has a more modern feel

Great serviceSkip the salad bar except for the pepper-ey candied bacon Ask for chimichurriThe hot sauce is spicyyyServers had different definitions of medium wellAlways eat more cheese breadTHE GRILL CHEESE WITH HONEY IS AMAZING. Get 4 before the guy leaves and doesn't come back for another hour

Came here for their restaurant week special($42), apparently they have a restaurant month special ($39) without dessert. We choose the non dessert option because usually will get full before hitting the desserts. Great value. This place is very spacious, high ceiling and a lot of tables. We got seated very fast and soon after they are already coming to serve the meat. For the restaurant week/month they don't offer the 4 prime cut but there were still a lot of meat options. One of the meat I had was way too salty but other than that all the meat taste delicious. I also love their fried bananas.

This was my second time here. The first time was AMAZINGGGG!!! We were in the main dining area and everything was great. Decided to go for my husband's birthday recently. We were a group of 15. The food was still good but we were seated in a back table of their "private room" which actually resembled a cafeteria or waiting area. I wish we were in the main dining area to get the full experience. Also, the check took forever to the point where I had to go look for a manager. She was very nice and we were offered a free round of wine. Although it was a nice gesture we had plans to go somewhere else for an hour. The check took nearly an hour to be brought out so we could not make it to the second place since a few of us had made babysitting arrangements and had to get back to our babies. If I return again I'll ask to be seated in the main area for more attention. It kinda ruined the end of the night since things didn't go as planned.

The setting is elegant and clean. The staff was on point with sanitation. The meat was juicy yet satisfying. The bread left me in carb paradise. I didn't encounter any negative experiences. My husband and I left the restaurant feeling content. I recommend this restaurant!

Meet friends here for happy hour.  We went to the bar on the second floor.  We decided to sit at the side table away from the bar so we can chat.  Limited menu with great happy hour prices.  We ordered both sliders (ribs tasted better than chicken), spinach and hearts of palm dip, empanadas, and polenta fries.  Overall food was good, atmosphere was great and service was prompt.  Couldn't have asked for more.
Gone twice, excellent meat, excellent service. The only thing is that the 2nd time I went, the creme brulee tasted like bacon grease lol. Almost ruined a great night but nonetheless, love this place.

I came here for their restaurant week dinner deal which is $42 (excluding tax and tips) for unlimited meats and salad bar. The difference between this deal and the regular full churrasco experience is that for the restaurant week deal, you can't get the beef ribs, ribeye, filet mignon and lamb chops. For this deal, you also get some sides (cheese bread, crispy polenta, mashed potatoes and caramelized bananas) throughout the meal. At the end, you get to choose a dessert, either cheesecake, chocolate mousse cake or key lime pie. The lamb and top sirloins were my favorites because they were so tender. The other options tasted average to me. All the side dishes were delicious, especially that cheese bread (looks like a cream puff)! With unlimited side dishes, soups, and meats, you'll get full pretty fast. It was a bit overwhelming for me. I would recommend that you come try this place for restaurant week first  because the price is so much cheaper compare to the regular price of $67. And if you like it, you might think it's worth going back.
What a spectacular place and impeccable attention, I'm sorry I don't remember the gentleman's name who attended us... Blessings!!!!

Went with a group of 6 on a Sunday brunch. Made a reservation but still had to wait about 10 min.The servants were very nice and attentive. Nice atmosphere for both adults and family. Sat right next to the salad bar which included salad, cheese, cured meats, cured salmon, fruits, pasta, pound cake, and yogurt.The meats were OK, beef was better than pork. Pork was well done thus too dry and tough.Overall, enjoyed the experience. It's worth the price you pay.

Why wouldn't you come here.... It is a dream... unlimited meats and salad bar for 65?I ate my heart out and it was more than I expected.The salad bar is out of this world.It is really well prepared The meat varieties are amazing.Each meat is seasoned perfectly I'm just upset I didn't take more pictures of the meat because I was just so busy stuffing my face.Literally there was not a second when I had to wait for more meat.They keep coming around before you run out.Everything was just amazing.Can't wait to go back!

Great service as usual! Took my bf here for his birthday. The salad bar was open, a waiter/waitress serves you the food you want (covid) . Only thing is we had late reservations so was kind of rushed when they closed. Food was fresh and the drinks strong  (we had margaritas)  Our waiter was perfect. Definitely coming again!

My first time here & it was a great experience!! As soon as we walked in I felt comfortable with the hostess till the waiter... as soon as we ordered, the food came so fast ... it was non stop lol but every waiter was nice and courteous !! They all had on a mask which is a big plus for me... I will definitely be coming back !!!

Fogo de Chao is my go to place despite the fact that I work in midtown Manhattan and am surrounded by my pick of the litter of restaurants!  The food is amazing and NEVER disappoints.  The ambiance is spectacular and brings people in droves.  The staff is bar none THE best, THE most courteous, THE most friendliest .... I can go on and on!  Hugo the bartender is the man to go to for your drinks!  I adore him and love him even more after he fixes my favorites just the way I like them and you will too!  Make some time to enjoy the Fogo experience, you won't regret it!

I've been to this steakhouse 3 times for churrasco and I've enjoyed it immensely every time. I'm not able to eat a lot but I still find it worth the price. I love that there's a huge spread of salad, veggies, pickles, and sides to go along with the meat. I've also discovered that I am in love with the VIK Eulila red blend, only sold in Fogo de Chao  It's delicious and I rue the fact that it's exclusive there.I'd recommend the top sirloin in terms of meat, endives from the buffet, and Eulila to pair

The hard truth: restaurant staff was excellent and super helpful made the experience worth it. The highlights of this adventure was the the bacon from the buffet the bacon made me say wow the potato salad was good. The Meats the servers was bringing out was ok the house meat was exceptional a+ the perfect amount of salt the other skewers was a it on the salty so if you have high blood pressure this is not the place for you. The Tomahawk steak was 32 Oz steak but it was not a 32 Oz steak it was like a 18-20oz at most steak was how I wanted it medium rare not salty nice and soft the chimicuri sauce was great... the bottom line it is a good experience and I recommend you try it gave 4 stars because of the the Tomahawk steak size it it was actually a bigger size like stated on the menu. I will go back and try other things and update the star ratings when I try the rest of the menu

I have been to couple of Fogo de Chao's in the past few years. I always come here because I like the variety they serve. And of-course I cannot afford expensive $$$ steakhouses.This is a pretty affordable steakhouse and the quality and variety you get for this price is pretty excellent.The only concern I felt during the pandemic late in the evening the indoor seating got crowded which kind of scared me bit. They do have taken measures like checking temperatures, asking us to put down our contact information incase they need to track the spread and have hand sanitizers. But I feel that the seating could have been more efficient.In all, the food was excellent as always. I was bummed that they did not have happy hour for indoor seating, just for the outdoor seaters.

This is a place to go in a special occasion as you are  prompt to over eat and is pricey.Basically an all you can eat in amazing different kinds of meet: best cuts ever!If you wonder why I didnt provide a 5 stars? Is because Chicago location offers better salad bar/side bar so I was kind of dissatisfied with NY sides.Totally worth it!Will go again, but will also give a chance to another location. I do recommend to reserve your spot ahead.

Service and food was amazing. They are coming with tons of steaks every single minute. So fast service and we stayed there 3 hours. Nobody said anything to us even we didn't order something after our first hour.

Very nice experience. The decor and ambiance was amazing. All of the waiters were very helpful and friendly, except when my friend had to ask 2 different waiters for a drink she ordered 20 minutes prior. The food was great. The salad bar had a nice variety and the meat options were great. The chicken was a little dry but the steak was perfect. The mashed potatoes were good and the plantains were very sweet. We also had dessert; tres leches cake and molten cake were perfect options. They provide a lot of food so come with an empty stomach.

We had a party of 13 on Sunday night .  I think our server was a little overwhelmed.  So to save the day here comes Alciohe Yarin (not sure if I'm spelling it correctly)   What could have turned out to be a horrible experience, turned out to be absolutely fabulous!!!!  Thank you so much for your kindness as we were celebrating a newly married couple & a birthday.

We were really hungry so we decided to try the adventure, The seasoning of some of the cuts (specially the Top sirloin were not that good but some other like the Garlic picania balance the experience. Great place other than I had an splinter in my finger from the chair(the most unusual things happen to me) but service is amazing and they take care of youExpensive for the offering but in general terms good place!
We loved the service and the food. Definitely ask for Travis, he was such a wonderful host and made the experience incredible.

If you know how Brazilian Brasseries are, this is a good one.Fancy decoration, fast service, it is good for groups or moments where privacy isn't needed - it is quite noisy.The choice of salads and sushi is decent - regular sushi, don't have high expectations. My suggestion is to not eat too much of these buffet part, as the different meats that come later ("all you can eat" basically) is the best part: chicken, pork, beef, lamb - several cuts offered, it is just personal taste which one you prefer. Tasty and in some of the meats you can choose if medium-rare or medium when they come to your table.You have to pay extra for dessert, but they are all quite good! Very sweet the ones we tried, but worth it!Restrooms are clean.4* as the price is quite high, but for the location and food quality, I'd recommend if you like meat and you are ready to eat BIG portions.

Absolutely recommend to everyone. My first experience was amazing. Service & food is exceptional. William, our server went above and beyond and I will be back probably tomorrow because it's so fricking delicious, I miss it already  The bread, the plantains, the drinks, and the quality meats.. you cannot go wrong. YUM

Was just there for brunch and had a fantastic time. There are a lot of options at the buffet - definitely get the black beans and the soup (which was carrot ginger at our visit). The garlic steak and ribeye were amazing and I couldn't stop eating the polenta fries at the table. The rose wine was $6 a glass.
Great service, awesome space. Ribeye was good.

very disappointed.  I went to the new Paramus location for happy hour today. When I arrived at around 6 PM, I was one of four people at the bar. There were at least four bartenders. they were standing around talking to each other, and it took about five minutes for one of them to greet me despite the fact that they kept passing me, and I kept trying to get their attention. Lavender was by far the friendliest bartender, and she makes a mean drink! If I could have her take care of me, every time I went, and I would definitely return! She was the highlight of my evening, because the other bartenders completely ignored me. I ordered some food and it took quite a while for it to get to me even though the restaurant was fairly empty. I went to the ladies room. Again it was not late, perhaps 7 PM. One sink faucet did not work. another soap was empty. There was no paper towels, and the toilet paper needed to be replaced. I had to tell the manager. Where are the people that are supposed to be monitoring these things?  eventually, I wanted to leave and it took me several minutes to get the bartender's attention. Lavender was on the other side of the bar so I cannot fault her. The bartender finally brought me my check and I immediately put my credit card down, and again had to wait for her attention, and she completely ignored me.  There is the difference between giving people time to enjoy themselves and completely ignoring them. I'm very disappointed in the service.

Emily, we apologize for any disappointment you felt during your experience. We have high expectations for our team and hope to make this right for you. Kindly send an email to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability. Thank you.
Cool ambiance and great food, the drinks are great and the food is worth the price! Definitely a must try they are national so I am not sure if it's fits "New York" but I'd still recommend.

The food here was good but the service was terrible. We were sat about 5 feet away from the bathroom and we had multiple waiters ask if we had been helped for the first 20 minutes. Again the food tasted great but I would not return or ever recommend this place to a friend. We were oversold the Churasco experience and when we asked for more food they told us the kitchen had closed without warning. They're simply just not accommodating, especially for the price. They have quality cuts but they do a terrible job at making their patrons be a part of the experience.

Providing accommodating service is important, Molly, and we appreciate you sharing your experience and concerns with us.  We value your feedback and would be grateful for a chance to make this right, so we hope you'll consider sending your contact information and availability in an email to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

WHAT a disappointment. I went here on Saturday it was understaff and disorganized. Had great and high expectations they were notMet at all. Drinks where juice 90%   We chosed the churrasco experience it was slow and kept getting the same meats all over and over and they took soo long to come around with the meats . Very disappointed I couldn't wait to leave

Melody, we're saddened to read of your disappointments. Our team would be grateful for another chance to provide you with a five-star experience, and we ask that you kindly send an email with your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.
The food was amazing my experience was amazing the steak was so good I started with a shrimp appetizer and and a passion fruit drink a amazing the service was on point definitely will be coming back

By far the best place we have visited during this pandemic. Food was delicious and service was exceptional. Hostess, Lorena was beyond courteous and extremely helpful when recommending dishes and drinks. Place is reasonably priced. Will definitely be visiting again.Satisfied client.
The amount of food is down right impressive.  I think i am pregnant.  There is still a massive amount of food on my plate.    The prices are not to bad either.   Glad i went here.

Fogo was great. All the meats were delicious - the picanha was incredible.Stepping inside, I was shocked by the churrascaria's size. It's one of the biggest restaurants I've ever been to - tons of people. Yet, the ambiance is very nice, it does not feel crowded, and there are plenty of servers who take care of you. The buffet was decent. Pretty basic foods. I liked their assortment of cheeses. Plus, the nonstop banana appetizers were great, and the butter bread . The real worth, however, is in the meat. The bottom and top sirloins were amazing, and the picanha was sliced so think it melted in our mouths. The bottom sirloin was well done, the top, very much rare. Everything else was simply alright, so we kept waited for those 3 cuts.The dessert and cocktails were good, but nothing special.

All the meats you could possibly want. You don't get the full experience until you do the meat carving option ($40 for lunch, $65 for dinner) where the waiters bring on endless options for you to choose from. There will definitely be more meat on your plate than you can eat. I'd recommend trying small pieces of each one until you find the ones you like. Also order the Guarana soda. Just do it.
Very good food. The price you pay is worth it. The quality is top notch. Very good experience
Hugo and Andrea were amazing at the bar. Definitely recommend coming if you want a good drink.
First of amazing service, very friendly servers. Especially Andrea. Out of all the Fogo's I've been to, this is the best in terms of quality. Definitely a must fo go to.

If you feel the need to wine and dine with kings and queens, you've found the right place.You will be tempted to go for the full experience, any mere mortal would. After a couple visits, you'll probably stick to their alternative options which are less filling, and less-skewery.Word the wise: Make sure to start with some greens at the salad bar first, than work your way through chicken, pork and beef... in that order. Your body will thank me later

Fogo de Chao was truthfully amazing . I came to celebrate father's day with my family . We all got the Full Churrasco Experience . First of all I'd like to mention that the waiters bring out the different variety of meats so often , we LOVEED it . My favorite was the chicken and the beef ribeye. All the meats seasoned so well. One of my biggest fears was not being served meats frequently. The salad bar had such an amazing array of options from fruits , vegetables, salads . The white rice and beans were soooo good omg , and the warm pão de queijo ( cheese bread ) was SOO GOOD . All in all I have zero complaints. Father's day caused the restaurant to have so many reservations yet we still received optimal treatment . All the drinks we ordered was amazing as well .  I cannot complain about anything . My family and I enjoyed my father on father's day thanks to this restaurant !
Best Brazilian Experience!Todos visitantes brasileiros precisam conhecer e ter essa experiencia!!

My husband and I had dinner here a week after having tried the other popular Brazilian steakhouse in the area, Churrascaria Plataforma. While both have their upsides and downsides, I enjoyed Fogo de Chao more overall.Meat selection seemed to be better, and the salad bar was by far better with a selection of cheeses and fresh fruit. My favorite cuts were the ribeye, filet mignon (bacon wrapped and normal), and the top sirloin. Instead of the usual fried bananas, they caramelize their bananas here too, and they are delicious! The PDQ bread here is more airy than what you would usually get, but when at Brazilian restaurant you shouldn't be filling up on bread or sides anyway. The PDQ, by the way, is gluten free - my husband has celiacs sprue and had no issues.Our waiter was very friendly, and even asked if there were select cuts we were waiting for. The dining area is very spacious, beautiful, and modern. Definitely a great place for a date night.

Went there with a group of friends.  We had a reservation,  We arrived and we were seated very quick.  The first waiter came over was very nice and friendly, but then he disappear.  Another waiter came along and asked us what we want to drinks.  We asked for a wine menu, he was happy to bring us the menu, and he recommend us some EXPENSIVE wine, which we didn't order.  We ordered the one we wanted, and he wasn't happy about it.  He said we need at least two bottles of it, we told him we will start off one bottle first.  Again, his attitude start to change.  Service wasn't great at all..  As for the meat selection, there's wasn't much selection at all, most of the came repeating itself.  Finally we ask them if they have Ribs and beef ribs, then they one of the guys said he will ring it out.  When he bought it couple, it was only a couple of pork ribs.  Then I asked again for beef ribs, he finally bough it out with a small proton it it, and it was way over cooked and very dried.  This place used to be really good..  Now the food selection and the service is not as good as it used to be.  To me, it doesn't worth over $70 per person for all you can eat meat since it's not much selection of the meat.

This is disheartening to read, Kevin, as we always want our service and your cuts to be amazing. We'd like to discuss this experience offline, so please send us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

I do not want to give this place a low rating but I had a really terrible time here. It was expensive and the service was very slow. The meats came out very slowly and they were mostly repeats. It also took over 15 minutes to get the check and the check was sitting on the other table the entire time but the female waitress did not bother giving it to our table. We had to ask twice to get the check. I had the chicken wrapped with bacon, filet mignon, lamb, and sausage. They tasted okay. The salad bar was very limited compare to the other Brazilian Steakhouses I went to. The rice that they had was very hard too. I do not know why this place has such high ratings. I had the tomatoes, rice and beans, peppers, and fresh mozzarella. It was just so limited. Half way through the meal, the wait staff finally gave us the sides, manduras and polenta. The only highlights were the drinks and cheese bread. I also had drinks-Guava Do Sul- it has Belvedere Vodka, guava, lemon, La Marca Prosecco and the one with the cucumber in it was really good.I do not recommend this place as the service was slow and there are too many repeat meats -not enough variety. The food was very mediocre especially given the price. Afterwards I got really sick and my stomach was hurting. I have a very strong stomach and this almost never happens.

My family and I went here for Fathers Day and were very disappointed. We had to wait an hour for our 6:45 reservation because they overbooked. When I mentioned this to the host he blamed the wait on me for not accepting to dine outside. Dining outside means we would have had to go up and down the stairs every time we went to the Feijoada Bar. So naturally we had no choice but to wait. When we finally got seated the dining room was in complete chaos. We were offered a free round of drinks which I thought was a nice gesture. But then the bad service started. We decided to go with the Churrasco Experience but due to the overbooking we only experienced 5 meats. We literally had to flag the men down so we could get a slice of beef. When a restaurant sacrifices service just to get a few more bodies in the place it's time to move on. Note to management - Giving such bad service on a special day leaves a lasting impression.
Came here for lunch yesterday evening, Will NOT be my last. Absolutely incredible experience! Can't wait toCome back eat even more
Thank you for the Fogo love, Cynthia! We can't wait to have you back in - Cheers!

Prepare to spend some dollars in Fogo de Chao!! Bring your stimulus money for the check if it's more than two people. The one thing I didn't like about this place is the prices for things are not listed. They have a variety of different meats that they serve table side, which are very good and juice. The salad bar options were varied and accommodated vegetarian and vegan customers but wouldn't be worth the price if you are vegetarian or vegan. Still enoyiably though

My first experience at a Brazilian all you can eat steakhouse and I would say it was just average.Most of the meats were salty and though the chicken was very tender & juicy it was flavorless. If I had to choose my favorite it would be the top sirloin & bacon wrapped steak. Both had a good amount of fat/juice but still salty towards the end. I really wanted to enjoy the filet mignon but it had a weird texture :( I think I drank so much water that I was more bloated from that than the actual food. Definitely pricey and not worth the $64. However, service was attentive and it wasn't too packed on a Thursday night.
My previous review still applies, but this time around it didn't wow me as much. Still solid, but I feel I could get similar food for a lower price elsewhere.

If you love meat and you've never experienced churrascaria/rodizio, do yourself a favor and go try one. All-you-can-eat meat brought right to your table? Yes please. I've been to a couple other churrascarias before but this was my first time at Fogo. I went with a group of friends for Restaurant Week and despite a more limited dinner menu,  I thought just about everything was great. I won't go through every type of meat I tried, but I tried them all and the majority were delicious and cooked to perfection. My favorite was probably the picanha or fraldinha, both cuts of sirloin. They both had a good lean:fat ratio for great juicyness and flavor. The lombo, or parmesan pork, was probably my least favorite. It wasn't terrible but I found it a little too salty. The meats are the star of the show of course but the sides are no slouch either. Hands down my favorite is the pao de quiejo (cheese bread). The mashed potatoes were very good as well, but I didn't eat much to save room for the meat. I found myself taking a little bite of sweet plantains when my mouth was overwhelmed by the different meats. Best part? All the sides or all-you-can-eat as well. The "market table" (read salad bar) is exceptional as well. They have all sorts of vegetables, cured meats, and cheeses for you to enjoy. I was torn when I saw all the delicious options because even a big guy such as myself can only eat so much. Dessert was on point as well. Between my friends and I, I got to try 3 kinds:  key lime pie, chocolate mousse, and cheesecake. Of the 3 the cheesecake was my favorite but all were solid ways to finish off a superb meal. If I had to complain about something I'd say the bathroom could be a bit larger considering how large the restaurant is. I'm not sure how many others there were, but the one I went into had one urinal and one stall leaving a queue of people outside waiting. It was very clean though.All in all Fogo de Chao is a wonderful experience.
Really good food, but expensive. Make sure to bring a full appetite, otherwise it's not worth it in my opinion.

I came here for dinner during restaurant week. ($42)I have heard a lot of great stuff about this place before. Traditional brazilian bbq, people walking around with the meat and cut it for you if they see you turned your sign to green. Salad bar is heaven like. All kinds of salad, cheese, fruits etc. Dessert menu for restaurant week only has 2 options cheese cake and chocolate cake. Only reason why im giving a 4 star instead of 5 is because of the waiting time. I made a reservation at 730pm and arrived at 7:20. We werent seated until 7:50. What is the whole purpose of making reservation? Overall I would come back for the food and dining environment.

Came here June 5th for my brothers birthday celebration. We had a very large party of about 30 people. First let me say how absolutely beautiful this restaurant is. Such a wow factor that was beyond my expectations. We had a private room in the back of the restaurant which was perfect for the amount of people we had. Second I am sorry I didn't take more pictures of the food but as soon as it hit my plate I couldn't resist lol. There is a buffet of cold food (salads, cheeses, veggies, etc) and they bring sides to your table (bread [divine], mashed potatoes, maduros etc) and they have a non stop surplus of all the meat you can eat still sizzling as they come serve it to you. Omg so good! Steaks and chickens and lambs and ribs and bacon wrapped things being bought straight to you from the kitchen by their amazing staff. Definitely coming back and worth the price if you are a foodie so do yourself a favor and try it.
If you're a meat lover this is the place to be. It's my first time here and had a blast. Andrea is very warm and will definitely recommend it to my friends.

All around fantastic!  I have been here many times and Fogo de Chao never fails to impress.  I am particularly grateful to Benjamin Maddy, the Sales Manager.  He goes above and beyond to make my dining experience exceptional every single time, from his consistently positive and accommodating attitude to his attention to detail.  The food and wine and atmosphere are also just perfect, I highly recommend Fogo de Chao, you will not be disappointed!

That's my second time and not my last time either I went for my bf birthday and wanted to go for mine too thank you so much my Fogo family I love y'all so much you guys are the sweetest servers in New York, if someone wants to celebrate their birthday or special occasions right Fogo is it.

I was going to try this restaurant and when I called to make the reservation, the lady who answered put me on hold for 30 minutes and then hanged up on me, and when I a called back she gave an attitude, very rude, maybe they are booming right now and they don't really need my business, that is no reason to treat customers like that.  I will never visit this restaurant, there's alway other good choices.

We are sorry to hear about this, Jose, as our team strives to deliver nothing short of helpful and kind service. We hope to review your feedback and work towards a chance to serve you, so please send your phone number and availability to feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Andrea was amazing, kind, and the best service I've had. She made us feel so comfortable and even gave us some Portuguese lessons! It literally made my boyfriend's birthday night. I will be singing her praises when we leave and as soon as we come back. Thank you Andrea and the Fogo de Chão staff for a night to remember. Obrigada!

Fantastic service and food! Come hungry because they will literally stuff you to the rim with meat!! You'll definitely roll out of this place!! Drinks was delicious as well!! I had a few of the passion fruit caipirinha!! The décor was beautiful and ambiance was fantastic for groups for a nice fancy date.
The food and service was amazing. The staff never made you feel forgotten and everyone was so nice. The place is beautiful and the cocktails were delicious
Came here for dinner last night and I couldn't have had a better experience. Food and service was great.
Thank you for the Fogo love, Caio! We look forward to having you back in.

Excellent service, food and interior design of the place. The manager and staff were always on point to make sure the table was always being helped and that everything was going good. Definitely recommend and will be back for sure!

i came here with my friends from work during restaurant week.. at the end of it.. i had a major case of the meat sweats.. so.. much... meat.... and all skewered on a sword... with waiters walking around showcasing their meat... tehehehe i'm a child.. i was half expecting salt bae to come out.. but alas no... they were cooked quite tender.. bc we were rest week customers.. we couldn't partake in some of the filet mignon and the more expensive cuts of meat.. which was sad... but if meats your thing.. i say go for it..

Beautiful grand space great for dates!! The meats are seasoned well but beware! Their whipped potatoes and fried yuca are to diiiiiiie for. Best mashed potatoes I've ever had from a restaurant! These were complimentary to the table when we ordered the regular unlimited meats, I'm not sure if it's a scheme to get you full on the cheap stuff but I'm not going to look into it too much. When going to the salad bar the waiters will serve you what you want to put on your plate probably to reduce contact between so many people and open food. The arugula was a little watery and the meats took a little while to be served to us but other than that great food and great decor

Wow... as a long time Fogo lover this was EMBARRASSING! I have personally been to multiple Fogo's around the country but this is by far the worst. To begin:  1. the amount of people they cramp into that basement of a restaurant I can assure you is a fire hazard. you can't walk anywhere without running into a another table and overall that many people close together is truly unappetizing. 2. the food...abysmal. Literally uneditable. if i am paying $75 dollars for meat...that meat should at least have some kind of flavor or skill put into cooking it. I could probably cook meat of that quality in my dorm room with a waffle maker. All the meat was dry and over cooked and the meat quality was just above a halal cart in times square. Also the buffet was so repulsive, the food was not well displayed and was extremely unappetizing. 3. The amount of selling on top of the $75 I was already paying was soooo tacky. If i wanted to pay more then I will look for those opportunities myself, don't send people to my table to sell me things. Literally salesman vibes that made me embarrassed that it was even happening. And the cost of these extras don't even equal the quality or quantity of the food. We paid $27 for 5 mini shrimp that looked like they were frozen and not remotely fresh.4. There were about 50 tables and 1 womens bathroom with two stalls... one of which was not working. I don't even need to elaborate on that. I had high hopes for this restaurant given its location in the city but man was it horrible. I will be contacting the corporate office about my experience because this is by far the worst Fogo de Chao I have ever been to and frankly the franchise should be embarrassed.

My lovely friend made a reservation for us to eat here and of course that was a Yeassss !  This place gets packed fast, a true sign of how awesome the food is. It was my first time eating in this unlimited eat all you can serving restaurant, it was extremely fun and exciting. My friend makes me feel so happy when we go to new places because she knows more than me about all these places and she kindly enough tells me how things work (I love her !)...lolSo we sat and a circular color thing magingy is placed on the table, Red means stop feeding me, and turn it around the Green means feed me.  lolThe servers come to the tables with delicious meats on a stick and I was given meat to eat, about 5 or 6 different meats, over and over until I can't eat no more....lolol  that was really, really fun.  Is like speed dating but with meats, although I had only seen scenes of speed dating on TV, never done it, but that is what it looks like, speed eating with meats :) amazing !You know when they say New York have everything, this restaurant makes it so, this is an absolute restaurant that is a must do in NYC. It is pricey but sooo much worthy, one must do this at least once in a lifetime.The coffee gets 1 star, it has nothing special about it, and the coffee cup was too small, one of those tiny coffee cups and the coffee flavor was nothing but average. Everything else was excellent and over the top experience.

I was here for restaurant week and I was actually really excited. I LOVEEEE steak so seeing there was a deal for this place on restaurant week, my friends and I jumped on the opportunity. The restaurant itself is gorgeous. Walking down the stairs to the dining area, I was blown away. We were seated quickly and within a few minutes, the meat was being brought out. The first one I got, I think it was the Picanha (?) was the absolute best one of the night. It was cooked to perfection, juicy, and so tender. However, after that, the quality of the meats somehow went downhill. They started to become extremely chewy, some way overcooked, and when we asked for a certain cut, we were told they were being sent our way but we waited way too long for it. Some people just completely ignored us too. The thin cut top sirloin was delicious as well, but again, he only came around once so I wasn't able to get another piece. I really wanted to like this place but I honestly can't justify the regular price. Even with restaurant week, it was about $60-70 per person with tip. Maybe it was because we ate later on in the night and the quality of the meats weren't the best, but I was disappointed to say the least. I would come back here and give it another shot eventually.

We placed an order to go at 4:55pm, ready for 5:26pm pick up.  We drove from NJ and arrived there at 5:20pm. I was informed that my order was not received. The hostess said they can prepare it in 15 minutes. The manager asked if I made the order through food delivery apps, I said no, directly through your website. The manager gave complimentary dessert and fries for the inconvenience. I received my order at 6:05 pm.  Good food, poor online service.
We apologize for delivering you such a to-go experience, Taryn. We'd love to work towards your satisfaction, so please email us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

This is the famous national chain of AYCE (All You Can Eat for the uninitiated) Brazilian steakhouses. Basically, it entails a bunch of dudes circling "the space" and cutting off amazing cuts of meat from a metal stick (bacon-wrapped chicken, sausages, top sirloin, filet mignon, you name it). You can have as much as you want. Is this 'really' how it's done in Brazil? I don't have a clue, but Ioved it. I entertained the place having only eaten a bagel all day, and I was salivating and ate so much food. Research shows your body can take in a ton of food for like 20 minutes before it starts to shut down, so start scarfing right away after your first bite. We had to stop after 45 minutes and barely being able to walk to the salad bar, which is frankly a complete waste of time. Are you really here for salami, lettuce, and cheese?! "The space" is really nicely, some might say extravagantly, decorated. You climb and down a big flight of stairs to get to the tables, and boy, after all you eat, YOU WILL NEED IT.

Came here for restaurant week with a group of 4. Make sure you make reservations because the wait can be up to 2 hours for walk ins. The interior had an upscale feel to it. There were 3 floors. Top was the bar, second was bar and waiting area and the bottom was the dining area. Once we were seated, our waiter explained how the system works and told us we can get started at the salad bar right away. There were many options at the salad bar. Ranges from fruits, veggies, soup, cheeses, salads and various types of meats. I didn't want to get full off the salad bar and only had bits and pieces of some stuff. The apple fruit salad was delicious and refreshing. The brussel salad can be skipped. It was lacking in flavor and tasted like it had been out for too long. Along with our meal came the caramelized bananas, cheese bread, polenta and garlic mashed potatoes. The cheese bread was definitely a favorite of the table and tasted even better when it was hot. The waiters also kept refilling it throughout our meal!Now onto the good stuff: the meat. I think it's all based on luck with the cut of meat you get. I was not a fan of the parmesan coated pork loin. It was very salty and dry. But then my friends had a very juicy piece so it's really all luck based on which piece you get. The bacon wrapped chicken was very moist. Ribs were really good but a little on the salty side. The beef was amazing. This place is definitely a meat lovers galore. The house signature had to be my favorite! Next would be the prime part of the top sirloin. For restaurant week, you only get 3 choices for dessert. You can pick from the cheesecake, chocolate mousse cake and key lime pie. They were average. Nothing over the top. Could be because we were so stuffed from our meal. Overall I had a great experience and would probably come back if they participate in restaurant week during the Summer. The waiters were so polite and they do not rush you at all. You can take your time eating and when you're ready to go, you just have to let them know. They were very professional and friendly for a place that gets very busy. Also make sure you let your waiter know in advance you're there for the restaurant week menu! You wouldn't want to be charged the full price!

I try to avoid chain restaurants for the most part, but decided to give it a try for Restaurant Week. The amount of food you get for the RW price is a tremendous value! I had enough steak and two sides for lunch and dinner! The flank is delicious and the chive mash potatoes too! Definitely a good deal at $21.

The food was ok.... it was super busy on this particular day we went which was on a Sunday. The manager was called to escort us to our table but when he gets there he stops us and askes the hostess if she's sure we were "next" which i found was extremely rude of him to do. we got the ultimate experience and didn't receive none of the sides that came with it even after we finished eating. The guys who were going around with the diff meats barely came around and we asked them if they can come back around and they never came as well. Finally tho The manager not sure what her name was i spoke to her at the end and let her know what was going on and she ended up giving us two free desserts. Prob the best thing that happened lol other than that i don't think I'll come back

Joanna, our team should always be delivering attentive service, as we want our guests to try all of the cuts we have to offer. We hope you allow us the chance to regain your support, so please consider sending us an email with your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Fogo De Chao is the place to go if you have a hearty appetite for meat.AYCE places are not only awesome in terms of variety, but also an interesting psychological exper-iment-ience: the plates offered at the market table were twice as big as the plate offered for the meat. Service was prompt and friendly.The moment the red circle is flipped to green, we became swarmed with servers offering different cuts of meat.So many different cuts of meat: pork, beef, chickenBeef:Strip steak- a nice medium rare. SirloinBottom sirloinFilet Mignon wrapped in bacon- filet Mignon was juicy BrisketGarlic steak- well seasonedPork:Pork shoulder- huge shoulder but when served it was tender, soft, and not dry and came with amazing mango saucePork chop- looked dry didn't tryPork sausage- flavorful, mildly spicyPork ribs- meaty and juicyChicken:Chicken thigh- niceChicken wrapped in bacon- bacon was yummy and chicken was juicyMarket table- nothing really to write home about in terms of the offerings. There were lots of vegetable platters, charcuterie, papaya. The black pepper bacon was okay, but became not so crispy and hard to chew after sitting out for awhile. The smoked salmon was not bad. Mixed berries were not offered again since brunch was almost over, but I was able to request some from a server supervising the market table.
Food is amazing!! Great wait staff. Our waiter, Ismael was amazing! So attentive. What a great experience. I'll be back soon!

We went there in February and it was great. Well this time was not good at all. We waited a long time to even get meat coming around. After we would get one thing coming to the table we would have to wait again and again. We never got the filet mignon that was part of the very expensive "experience" meal. Never received the lamb. Waited a long time before the next choice was brought to our table. For 6 people our bill was over $500.00 So not worth it! Never going back!

Terri, thank you for sharing your love of Fogo! However, it's disappointing to hear your recent visit did not live up to our high expectations of courteous service. Please reach out to us directly to ensure your next visit runs smoothly. Kindly send us your phone number and availability at feedback@fogo.com. Thank you.

Totally have to give them a shout out (Chris) a manager was so professional, what an excellent dining experience. The food is being handled very well, there is a round going out and going back in to keep warm. The salad bar is closed but there is a lady walking with portions of fan favorites around the tables. I must say they are making outdoor dining an Accommodating experience.
I've gone here several times for restaurant week and it's one of my favorite restaurants to go to during this promotion. Unlimited meat and side dishes and a salad bar, you can't go wrong

I have been to Fogo De Chao in Miami, Los Angeles and New York and been to the Manhattan location several times. I am a huge fan of Fogo De Chao and the NYC location. I always receive great service, top-notch and excellent quality of food, every single time. I visited them for my bday and even if the service was outdoor with heated lamps, the food was sooo good. I don't know if it was because it's been a year since I have visited them but every single meat I had was cooked to perfection. Because of the COVID situation, the salad bar is closed so they bring a small selection to you. Obviously, we don't get the full selection, but the food that we got...everything was 5 stars. The staff was extremely friendly, cordial and you know the staff care for each other and for their guests regardless of the situation. Bravo!!!!

Fogo de Chao clearly emphasizes service, and it made our experience incredible!I booked our group's dining experience through Benjamin, the event manager. I was planning a gentlemen's dinner and had a few special requests that were accommodated by Benjamin. He answered several calls and e-mails when I had questions, and made sure we had a table in a more private area.The hostess, Vanussa (I'm sorry if I spelled it wrong) was lovely and welcoming. She made sure to send people to the bar while we waited for everyone to show up. When it was time to be seated she came and showed us to our table. She was nothing short of pleasant and professional!When we sat down we were greeted by our waiters Alex and William who guided us through the menu and were able to answer any questions we had. They were very attentive and kind, especially to one of our guests who just celebrated his 92nd birthday. We were treated like family.After going to the salad bar, we were treated to an onslaught of food! All of the meat was delicious but my favorite was the Bottom Round Sirloin. So much flavor!It was our first time having a fine dining experience at Fogo de Chao, but it will certainly not be the last. Everyone who had dinner tonight agreed that we'll be back regularly and with even more people. I hope the corporate bosses at Fogo de Chao see this review so they can see what exceptional employees they have!
We had a lovely experience for our brother's wedding reception. Our servers were kind and thoughtful, especially Israel. The food was delicious as well. We will definitely come back! Thank you!

This is hands down the best Brazilian Steakhouse in NYC!!! The quality of meats from the top sirloin, ribeye, filet mignon. the lamb ugh just melts in your mouth!!! The salad bar was phenomenal!! Super fresh. FEIJOADA!!!! CAIPIRINHAS!!! Great for a group or even an imitate dinner for two!Sheer Brazilian Delight!! Must go!!!!!

I honestly don't know why this place is so popular. The meat is almost always cold and the salad bar really just has the basic vegetables and nothing more. Don't waste your money and time and dine elsewhere!
My first time at fogo de chao and the service was AMAZING! Camila N. and Nadia M. were such a fantastic duo; they explained the full menu and made us feel so comfortable and at home. 10/10 recommend!

I usually opt for salad bar only (no way I can eat $60 worth of meat). But for $38, I think I had a chance! This fogo de chao location opened soon after I moved to DC, I was excited to return in time for summer restaurant week! Compared to DC's, the salad bar selection was actually smaller. But I would say it was better prepared - the squashes were nicely charred, the watermelon feta actually dressed in balsamic vinegar, even the green steak sauce was less runny. Meat - Although most diners came for their top sirloins, after trying a bit of everything, I knew where my money/belly was going - chicken drumsticks and pork ribs. The chicken drumsticks were tender and juicy (fell right off the bone!), the pork ribs were perfectly fatty and beautifully seasoned! My dining companion made a comment that I must had eaten two arm length worth of chicken drumstick alone... Plus the pork ribs - meat sweat? the struggle was real. I knew I couldn't refuse the cheesy bread - much bigger than ones in DC, somehow I managed to eat 6 and still asked for refills. Then it dawned me that I still had dessert to come! Key lime pie - half of their normal portion - loved the graham cracker crust but found the pie as a whole overwhelmingly sweet. I would recommend sticking to their chocolate mousse cake instead. Service was attentive and meats were plenty. Although I don't see myself returning for full price dinner - but for restaurant week, definitely worth a visit!

This is one of the best places to come for restaurant week. No, you do not get smaller portions (like some restaurants do), you will be so stuffed to your heart's content.The only difference in the regular menu vs restaurant week menu is that you don't get certain cuts of meats. But for the restaurant week menu, you were able to eat a good amount of meats. I enjoyed different cuts of sirloin, the lamb etc. The pork wrapped in Parmesan cheese was a little tough. You also get access to the cold buffet, which is great. They had prosciutto, smoked salmon, rice and beans, hearts of palm. They also gave us a basket of the most amazing bread, it had cheese in it! It resembled mochi. We were also given 3 sides- mashed potato, polenta and plantains. I am definitely coming back for restaurant week!

So I've been to fogo de chao in Santana row in San Fran, that was the first and only fogo I've been to. I've been to several Brazilian steak houses though, but fogo is kind of in its own class. Came here for restaurant week which was $42 for dinner which included about 7 meats, sirloins, pork ribs, chicken, sausage and bacon wrapped steak. The salad bar however was included as well, the salad bar has several different options, cured meats, bacon (some of the best I've had), rice and beans, veggies, several cheeses and plenty more. The decor and set up of fogo is absolutely brilliant. It is an amazing sight to see, the decor is just stunning. We had reservations for 4 around 9 pm and we were seated about 905 pm. The meat and salad bar were absolutely delicious. Everything was superb here, the only thing keeping this from a 5 for me is the fact that we had to ask for the sauce for our meats about 4-5 times before it finally came out & they brought over the same meats for about the first 5 trips so we had to tell them to switch it up. Now I understand they were super busy so that could have been the reason they were a bit confused or delayed but nonetheless still an amazing place. Make sure you ask for an extra order of their complimentary cheese bread as well!! You will not be disappointed.

Don't have much to say aside great service! Food is so mediocre. The only meat that was good was the filet mignon. The rest was bland or over salted. The side dishes were a poor excuse. The bar had absolutely nothing interesting. Some Mexican and American staples that were not even tasty. Won't return. For $80/person. Avoid. A Chinese Buffet is better and that's a sad comparison.

We are happy to hear you received excellent service from our team, however, knowing our food was mediocre is disappointing. Please know that we care deeply for the opinion of our guests and hope to have another chance to make things right. Please send us a direct message to feedback@fogo.com with your phone number and availability when you have a moment. Thank you.
Nadia's the best server, extremely patient and sweet! 10/10 dining experience... been going to Fogo for years and we're so glad to be back after the pandemic

Was here  with a group of people for a friends birthday. The amount of meat and food at our disposal was quite amazing got the price. I really enjoyed the salad bar as well as all the meats I tried. Everything was well cooked and seasoned. It can be alittle overwhelming with servers coming to cut meat for you every few seconds, but luckily you can turn the coaster-like sign over to red so you can eat what you already have  and then when ready turn it back to green. Looking forward to coming back again :)

Love going to Fogo  I'm seriously in love with there market table. I could eat it all day everyday. From the artichoke to the palm hearts. Fogo is someplace I go when I'm in the mood to eat like a pig lol but I still hold back lol. Love the ambiance the service and the selections.  The sea bass was a little bland to me but I like things well seasoned with some heat. What can I say some like it hot.

Beautiful place, good vibe, friendly staff.. but not what we thought it was going to be. After everyone passes once or twice they stop passing by and is not the unlimited experience they advertise. I had to request with the waiter for a cut of meat to make an appearance at the table after everyone passed by us several times for over 30 min. It seems as they are directed on who to go to and once your time is up they stop going to you

This place was so good, I just had to come here again in less than a week for restaurant week!!For restaurant week only:If you wanna wine and dine, but can't afford a fancy dinner, this place is worth your time and your money. However, you better act fast because the reservations get booked quickly, especially if you have a large party.The first time around, I came with 4 people and we didn't have a reservations because it was booked solid. They told us to come and wait, so we did and they told us 3 hours.... But don't get discouraged, we only waited 1 hour and could have been seated earlier if our whole party was here on time. So key note: EVERYONE MUST BE HERE ON TIME, or you will NOT get seated!You must come on an empty stomach and ready to eat your hard out. How it works:Step 1) You get your appetizers like you would at a buffet Step 2) The waiter should have given you coasters with a red and green side. (Incase you don't know, green = keep the meat coming!, red = so full and can't fit any more in my stomach)Step 3) flip that coaster to GREEN and the meat will start coming! You will have a wise range of meat selections.. Sirloin, chicken wrapped, pork...Step 4) EAT your heart out and have seconds, thirds and fourthsStep 5) once you are full, turn that coast to REDStep 6) Always make room for dessertStep 7) FOOD COMA!!!Quality of food:Excellent! They bring the meat to you and you can select the cut you want. I suggest medium rare and if you can, get some of the outer parts of the meat where it is seasoned.Dessert: I absolutely loved the key lime pie!!Sides: the plantains are to die for!!!Overall: great service, great impression....if I wasn't a broke recent grad, I would come here every week.

Fantastic customer service ---- I came here on Friday, June 18th when unfortunately they had an outage in the kitchen. June, Francey, & Dante went out of their way to accommodate my table (by offering free appetizers) even offering free drinks towards the end. They absolutely made this the best experience possible given the unforeseen circumstance --- I will be back next week before my MOMA visit -- EXCELLENT, AWESOME SERVICE --- the servers 100% know how to handle the situation ... please tip well

One of the better churasscarias in the city. If you don't already know, you get all you can eat Brazilian meats and a buffet bar for one price plus drinks. The meats were salted nicely and enjoyed almost everything they brought out from top sirloin, filets, flank steak and beef ribs. The place is a bit on the dark side and is located in a huge sunken basement area but nicely appointed. Service is a bit frantic but attentive and there are tons of staff always around the tables so you are never left looking for a waiter. The weekend brunch is a great deal and kids under 7 eat free so that is a huge plus if you're stopping in midday. However, the dinner seems to have a larger selection of meats and better service.  Personally I would go there for dinner rather than brunch. The buffet/salad bar is a little lazy here though. For example, they don't even take the seeds off the melon or skin off the kiwis. I do prefer the buffets at the other churascarias in the city. But since the focus is on all the wonderful meats, I don't seem to dwell on that much here.
